rNFUnjIvcUu9brVtFrOs3A.text: Love the Parlor!  I go during happy hour for their specials. The funghi pizza is amazing. The other treats on the menu are as well. The selection of drafts is compelling as are their signature cocktails.

6u7a5lYLEXJQTL0wvfHr5Q.text: This was our first meal at The Parlor. The food and the service were amazing. Don't let the curb appeal fool you this place has the coolest vibe inside. We ordered two amazing pizzas and two salads! Our favorite was a watermelon, cantaloupe, arugula and toasted pistachios salad. It was so fresh! We asked for the feta cheese on the side and it came on the salad. When we pointed it out to our server, she was so apologetic and gracious about the error. We were in hurry to catch a flight and did not have time to have it remade. She took the salad off of our bill and then surprised us just as we were about to leave with a new salad to take on our flight! I wish we lived in Phoenix so that we could eat at The Parlor on a regular basis!!!

cfurICCT36Bhyuap-IwIfg.text: One of the best spicy bbq chicken pizza I have ever had. I'm sure everything else was just as good, I went w a large group so everyone had a bit of everything. Great staff, nice atmosphere. All around great experience, definitely will be returning.

ldiCZhTPjO4TFbSuvMRolQ.text: Love this place, great atmosphere, nice outside seating area, love their pesto pasta & pesto pizza

v8rh0o9ZOAhKLCG_3PbPjw.text: This place is another awesome place to visit when in Phoenix.  The building is 1950s, the architecture is so modern and to think 60 years ago the designer would know what to build so it would be in style 60 years later.. :)  It used to be a Saloon and they still have the original saloon chairs that they use as their "bar stools"super super neat touch to remind everyone of what the building used to be before converting to a restaurant a few years ago.  Super neat patio, has fireplace outside and also heated so even on the cooler evenings super comfortable to sit on patio.     Food was awesome, had the spicy seafood pasta and spinach salad both were off the charts great.  Also had the sauteed brussels sprouts for appetizers which was a very awesome dish as well.  Nice choice of draft beers also.

gbFWCMNl9sKH7a0BDea7xw.text: PERFECT!  Four friends and I dined at The Parlor on Saturday evening, and as usual, it was simply perfect.  Tammy was our server and offered a wealth of knowledge regarding the menu and wines.  The 'Blue Suede Shoes' drink she recommended was a hit as was the Autunalle pizza.  I lived in Sicily for about 18 months and while the Arancine did not measure up to those in Sicily, they were still delicious.  One person in the group had the Alla Norma pasta dish and just raved about how delicious it was - especially the seasonings.  We had the Banana Trifle and Tiramisu for dessert - again very delicious, especially coupled with the French Press coffee.  The food was great - the service even better....all of the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful...many kudos to Tammy!

KZZxjcZ01aMex1eqHmjXVw.text: Great pizza. We had the House pizza and it was delicious. We tried a banana cream dessert that was out of this world. My husband didn't care for the sweet salty but I did. It's not salty at all, just a small hint. Kind of like a surprise. Back to the pizza...The crust was perfectly cooked, thin but not so thin that it's soggy after sitting a while. There was a nice firmness to the crust as well. I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banana cream dessert was yummy
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The House Pizza

D6tDB6OhKR1OiObIpEgDrw.text: Went here for happy hour and everything was delicious! The summer corn pizza is so different and SO good! If you love mushrooms the fungi pizza was also good (I didn't get the cheese they put, got mozzarella and burrata instead).  Their cauliflower app is was good too and service was quick and pleasant!

72Hbd3-EKdzpQKN8LxsQ8g.text: Extremely superb customer service...delicious, traditional and an interesting mix of varieties pizza available- made with fresh, quality ingredients...they even serve espresso and draft beer! EXCELLENT HAPPY HOUR SPECIALS!

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Woot woot! HAPPY HOUR SPECIALS!!!
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

yas51K2KRf2j0CTZenudiw.text: I've been to lots of clubs in Phoenix, but the only club I talk about lately is the duck club from The Parlor. Tomato jam interests your taste buds with the duck/bacon combo and aioli (okay...fancy mayo). I'd also recommend the Parmesan fries, which aren't the best by any means but still gosh darn addictive.   What I think shines here is obviously the pizza. I don't think the crust is as thoroughly cooked or tough enough to remind me of my favorite neapolitan pizzas, but when a pie topped gorgonzola and prosciutto runs at $9, I'll gladly accept it as an affordable, quasi-gourmet lunch. Wash it down with one of their groovy cocktails like "The Gentleman", with its cigar-infused bitters that taste like you're killing two vices at once.   Decor and staff are also nice. I'd recommend the dimly-lit booths for a date. I'd recommend the expansive menu for foodies. I'd recommend you get the hell over here soon--some selections are seasonal, after all.

AwNnvmpC1RX_EL0hOTU5_g.text: A friend took me to dinner here the other night and I was excited to try it out.  It did not disappoint.  Love the decor and ambiance...from the beautifully lit entranceway with the fireplace to the dining room to the bar area.  It is dark and elegantly candle lit and yet very unpretentious because it's not a fine dining establishment.  I am in love with this restaurant!  An all around great place to get some great grub. We tried the Arancini (good but a little pricey for 3 of them),  and 2 pizzas-I had the Autunelle and I highly recommend.  It's basically all my favorite things on one pizza.  I had to stop myself from devouring it all so I could take some home and have my hubby try it.  Salads and pastas seem a little pricey but I didn't order them so I don't know the serving size.  I will be coming back to try out their house made pasta.  Pizzas are a fantastic deal.  Not authentic Italian pizza but I really don't care right now because they were delicious.  I am already thinking about when I get to return with my family. And our service was top notch.  He recommended a delicious wine for me to try which I thoroughly enjoyed.

FGX4sZs7VBC9vAiL0FMIHA.text: Overall this was a excellent place to get some fantastic pizza. The pizza was really delicious with the sausage blending in with the other ingredients to make a great taste. The place looks amazing both in the patio and the inside. Anybody who likes pizza must try this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

aFiSodcO598JBo6Iu25iAA.text: The Parlor is one of the best restaurants I've been to in the Phoenix area. We've been here twice now and everything has been excellent. Pasta and pizza are to die for! And if you go try the chocolate cake. It has cherries and fresh whipped cream. Amazing!

_1VSenKg5aMERoMO2Gv-0g.text: They don't take large groups... only by that app nowait... was a crazy long time before we received our food. Coodos to the waiter... he held it together... but still forgot to order some items. Margarita Pizza was good. Kids Pizza was super oily.  A bit pricy for what you get.

paafR1cKy6H0cVUp-2MiPA.text: Fresh pasta...in the middle of the desert.  It's so good.  If you're up for it, sit at the bar and watch the chefs work their magic with the fireplace.  And Zeus, the chef in charge of the pasta dishes, is an artist.  My wife and I tried two salads, two pizzas, the caprese and then 4 pasta dishes.  Every single one of them was perfectly balanced and intriguing.  One of the pizzas included various pickled veggies (never had that before) and their pappardalle and tagliatelle are made every single morning and it shows.  So, so good!

yoVM2DPCvughoqbewYW-Rw.text: 4 Sandwiches, $48 Dollars and 4 disappointed patrons.  The fries were good...alot to pay for good fries though.  The tuna melt was not a tuna melt.  Toasted cheese bread with bland tuna, not even sure if it was albacore.  The Grinder is a "Subway" status sub, but smaller.  Never again.

xj6f1V6INfGR48qI4pIaBg.text: Best Italian in Phoenix. The pizza is superior to Federal and Bianco. The space is lovely. The bolognese is the best I have had and I am from NYC. I have had two "salads" which are, delightfully, actually hearty meals. Try the mozzarella en carrozza and the chicken milanese if you are a hearty eater! The service is never bad but never incredible.

lslTl8ZsRDe7Ixya3zfCyQ.text: Pizza is delicious!  Every time I visit my son in Phoenix we eat there at least once.  Everything is so fresh -- they grow so much of their own ingredients.  Love Love Love the pizza ... and the cauliflower and Brussels sprouts ... and everything we have ever ordered there.

c6DpUPsQjcZnq6DVjxQ1Nw.text: What's good? Everything! Pasta. Salads. Pizzas. Desserts. Cocktails. I have found myself eating here more and more lately. Staff is knowledgeable and friendly, food is always delicious. And a killer happy hour to top it all off!

9LrWGR9YOmvUmNgf2LDtow.text: Very cool atmosphere. Was once a beauty parlor loooong ago. They changed it into this very delicious restaurant with many different unusual types of appetizers, pizzas, and wines. Desserts are to die for.  If you look around you will see some of the original wallpaper, stools, pictures and dryer seats still within the restaurant. They grow their own vegetables and herbs and have outside seating. The staff is very friendly. Parking can be frustrating but it is well worth it. My friend and I go in before the rush hour, order three small pizzas, wine and share a dessert. Great food with great atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Salsiccia and the Pesto pizzas. Crazy delicious pizzas - our favorites!
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My hubby&#39;s plate: pizza &amp; beer.

62gZIyaDoB-sxATRbEE5_Q.text: Lunch was a hit! We decided on The Parlor over St. Francis today just because I had been hearing so many great reviews. I wanted to check it out for myself!   My guest ordered the steak panzanella salad with delicious focaccia croutons! The steak was dressed with a romesco sauce and was delicious. The flat iron steak was prepared, just as recommended, medium rare. I ordered the funghi 8" pizza. The perfect size for one or for a lunch meal. The mushrooms were a great blend of different types and prepared perfectly. Roasted, the mushrooms were still firm but cooked as well. I said goodbye to the soggy mushrooms in my life a long time ago. The flavor of goat cheese was a great compliment to the truffle oil and mushrooms on this dish. Although the pizza was a bit greasy, it was still flavorful and I had no problem devouring the whole thing!    Continuing my quest for restaurants and bars with the best Moscow Mule's, I opted for a cocktail with lunch. With expectations high for my drink, I was let down when my drink was brought out in a bar glass. Where's the copper mug? I enjoyed the cocktail but I prefer the traditional mule in the cup!

ccSQk5kFiQGs2gNSKuh3FQ.text: Three words: roasted corn pizza. and when they ask you if you want the 8" or 12" try not to laugh. But the 8" is more than satisfying. The duck club was a little flat on taste (what there was seemed overpowered by chinese 5-spice). But really a fun place. Servers were quick in the FCFS bar area. Arancine app was tasty...very subtle saffron flavor and al dente rice. mmmmmmmmm.

aKW9pu9Yw5sBVF2Bhwu-VA.text: If your looking for stupid good pizza, pasta, & drinks--go 2 the Parlor!! Watch out though, the waiters are good @ up-selling menu items during happy hour!

VcUTKbxan8Ihm2MbK4j1fw.text: Love this place. Great decor and food. We had the chefs board (red dragon cheese is amazing!) and the funghi pizza. We spent about 3 hours here. Take you time, relax and enjoy a bottle of wine. Great experience.

I_-8KGIu_KtyPmqu9mhVrg.text: Last night was my 2nd visit to this place in 3 years which is far too long between visits.  I love love love this place.  The decor, service, and food are all top notch. Here is the rundown of our meal:  Roasted Brussels Sprouts = excellent Caesar Salad = excellent Mozzarella en Corrozza (Crispy House Made Mozzarella) Salad = excellent Roasted Corn Pizza = excellent Pesto Pizza = excellent Funghi Pizza = excellent Pepperoni Pizza = excellent  I literally cannot say enough good things about the food here.  I could write a page on each one of the pizzas, but then I would get hungry and carbs are my enemy.  The only thing that fell short was the Arancine (Crispy Saffron Risotto).  It was a fried ball of risotto with marinara sauce.  It was just ok to me.  Can't wait to return.

_nmjPLtUwfIEfThI1nBTGQ.text: I don't know what can be said about this place that hasn't already been said.  This is just great pizza in general.   My favorite part is checking out their garden by the front door.  Maybe one day my own garden will compare to theirs.   OK now back to the food.  I get the meat and cheese plate every time.  Always good.  I have only ran into one pizza I didn't like.  It's called the Manzo.  I wouldn't say it was bad, just a little too different for my tastes.  I've had 7 other  pizzas on the menu and I would order all of them again. Go check out the parlor, you wont be disappointed

YIUZsUM7ijL2Xk_-BkW3AA.text: The atmosphere was cool. Services was great. Food was delicious but definitely overpriced. The wine list was ridiculously over priced so we went with beer that was somewhat reasonable.

40tXW3vDjoDxkRJn-m6Vvw.text: Hands down one of the best tiramisu I have had. We met up with James he was at Cibo before now here super guy great service ask for him. We enjoyed our meal will return.

P7jUtnUIH3uUSWDKuUeq6Q.text: Highly recommend!  We started with the roasted olives and Brussels sprouts, both amazing.  The garden herb mojito was excellent.  We ordered 3 8" pizzas for 4 of us, it was perfect.  We had the salsciccia, the autunelle and the pepperoni, all three were delicious.  Even the basic pepperoni, with house made mozzarella and fresh basil was a treat.  Service was excellent, ambiance even better....we will be back.

R12Bw6WumTZcGodISggXbA.text: Very nice place. Great wine list. The fried calamari was fabulous. Lightly battered and flash fried. Cooked perfectly which is hard to get. I had the Rustic meat pappardelle it was heavenly. Great service!

LqqtcGc0eeedj21gO33_fg.text: Oh what to say about the Parlor... First off their happy hour is amazing with the 8" pizzas and vast array of discounted apps. The wine list was also very impressive, again choosing my favorite the Malbec. I really appreciated the style of the restaurant and the ambiance which made it more intimate.   The only reason I gave it a 4 instead of 5 stars is because I only experienced the happy hour and not  the normal dinner service. I'm most definitely going to visit again and looking forward to trying the rest of the menu.

mpQdgPKpCTH6Jdhgl-jsAg.text: I like The Parlor.  This is a really cool building with a history as a beauty parlor.  Now it's frequented by the beautiful people in search of a good meal.  This visit we ordered a reasonably priced bottle of Calera Pinot Noir.  On their regular wine list no bottle is over $50 which is nice.  For entrees we ordered a Puttanesca seafood pizza and the Pecorino Tagliatelle pasta.  The pizza was cooked perfectly but I wasn't wild about the seafood.  That's my issue because the pizza itself was done very well.  I'm looking forward to coming back more frequently.

hgEzlTHsnaEElPObEfeCUQ.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants! I have never had a bad experience here - the food is always delicious and the service is outstanding. The quality of their food is what really sets them apart - everything is made in house and you won't be disappointed even if you need to be skinny and get a salad because their salads are just as satisfying as their delicious pizzas and pastas. The wine and beer selections are great and their speciality cocktails are on point as well because these are not your average bartenders - these are mixologists. I love it because it's versatile too ... I have had business lunches, happy hours, and romantic date nights there. It's just the best.

GtJup3yU8zcySj6GF9GMYg.text: Ok, the Funghi mushroom pizza = amazing!  5 stars for that!  I love food that makes me say aloud "mmmmmmm..." 4.5 stars for the bruxelles (brussels sprouts) - so yummy 3 stars for the Margherita - I've had better at Cibo & Bianco 3.5 stars for the papardelle bolognese - had better 4.5 stars for the zepolle (fritters) - the perfect fall dessert! 2 stars for the torta dessert - not that good  Ambience and service are great.  Overall lovely dining experience, I don't think anyone would be disappointed with the Parlor, and I will definitely be back for another Funghi!

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Apple Torta - pass
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fritters w/ cranberry compote and mascarpone cream - yummy
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Papardelle bolognese (so-so)

fRHK_PBRjzieE82oE5m4jQ.text: Had a very good meal in route to the airport. It was happy hour tried one of the pizzas one of the appetizers and a couple dishes off the full menu everything was great.

I98fzTUhrrRN1fMSDG5Kcg.text: Another great review! We went last Friday night and were seated pretty quickly. I was instantly impressed with the beer selection and prices, very nice. We were a party of three and shared a charcuterie to start, the farmers cheese is a highlight as well as the tomato jam spread they serve with it, very good. We shared the Calabrian and Salsiccia pizzas, they were both delicious and very different. The spicy salumi on the Calabrian was complemented well with the creaminess of the burrata, and it was all set off by the freshness of the watercress. The Salsiccia has a nice earthiness from the sage and sausage blend, all brought together by a balsamic drizzle. The highlight was the stone fruit crostada for dessert,I want one right now. A perfect combination of flavors and textures, really phenomenal!  I can't end the review without mentioning how great the service was. Friendly, knowledgable and willing to offer great suggestions.

0BzWucZhfUTl-vR771DVxw.text: Favorite pizza spot in phoenix. Salsichia is amazing. This place is consistently on point. Beet salad and basil gimlet go nice with a pie

Eu_Y7ESwkXqSYa2f4gWloA.text: We had the pesto pasta and pizza (created our own).  The pesto pasta was simply delicious.  All there pasta is homemade.  We added chicken (which was odd it didn't come with it) but all the flavors worked well together - pine nuts, pesto, and chicken.  It was pretty busy so I would recommend making reservations (we waited 15-20 min on Sat night).  The prices were reasonable and the service excellent.

v3HDm9qluM2PNIANfTRp6w.text: My wife and I spotted this place by accident in search for another pizza joint near by but we decided to give it a try. This place offers more than rustic oven baked pizza. When you eat there the whole environment has history and charm. It seems every piece of furniture or decor has a story or has been re purposed in some creative way. The pizza really good actually. It was very simple , full of flavor and that oven brick taste is really unbeatable.

Fk691JDdCUvel5_SV2-WRw.text: I'm not sure if it is because women are in charge or this is just one of the few businesses left that actually has integrity, but there was a mistake in our order and they went above and beyond to correct the miscommunication. Thank you for restoring my faith in business management and for making delicious food!

GfnhjDFHSiOzuPDOVfMIow.text: I kept hearing raving reviews about this place from my friends so I thought I better check it out.  Went there with a girlfriend for dinner and was not overly impressed.  Atmosphere cool, food okay- nothing that blew my taste buds away.  This place reminded me of the "most popular girl" syndrome.  Everyone says good things about this place cause that's what's expected.  For me though, I didn't find the "something extra extra' for me to write a glowing review or for me to recommend this place to other people.

TaudemYGEFwVk64-1fbL-g.text: Love this little pizza place. Came with my wife on a busy night and had some muddled, old-school drinks in the bar. Pizza and service were both fantastic, but I don't remember the details. Highly recommended and, if you're feeling the muddled, go with the drink with bourbon and cherries.

P4PYFWnXPlgQ_mY5PdsvKw.text: First of all this place is genious - a beauty parlor turned restuarant and the beauty chairs are the bar stools - cant but love it - food was great and service impecable -

d19jqAri4_xKeLrm9Uvjhg.text: I also love this place!   My sister mentioned a "pizza place" she saw on yelp, this place is so much more than just a pizza place though ... very well-rounded ....great food, reasonable prices, nice ambience.   We had the duck sandwich and spagetti bolognese....they nailed both dishes....we left very happy.  Go here before it gets too busy (we went on a weekday at 12 and got seated right away..i can see this place becoming over-crowded soon).

QyRBS5kMS8jengdy04bxNw.text: Excellent food, great atmosphere, steep prices. The small pizzas are REAL small. Check this place out but be prepared for not a lot of bang for your buck.

esr-CD5MSw_v-aNAglBWVw.text: I obviously had not had as much to drink or smoke as the previous reviewers when I decided to try The Parlor 2 weeks ago. It has the potential(bones) to be a quaint mod place....get rid of the servers, food and shit alcohol selection and it would be better than it is now. I can take the worst parking in the world for an outstanding place. This ain't it. Where to start, where to start???  1. The hostess moved like a barnacle as well as the wait staff. They were either all stoned on non-medical grade weed or were told to look and act aloof, disgusted and put off by the customers. It was bordering on comical.  2. I hate when new places open in the neighborhood expect you to pay high prices for food items and then have shit alcohol choices. We aren't by ASU. If we can afford your restaurant, we can afford higher end alcohol. Remember you are serving the publics taste, not your own. Do the research on high end, hell I would even take midiocre, alcohol choices and present them. You have such a varied menu, but then no choice of vodka..and no organic. Wine list sucks too!  3. It took 15 minutes to get a server and there were 10 tables open. I counted. Then she said I'll be right back..10 minutes later..then she only took our drink order, after she had to go see what kind of vodka they carried.  4. The worst ceasar salad I have ever had. EVER! It tasted like the tangy heel of a cheap shoe.  5. The cheese meat platter was a joke. They cut the meat in big slices for you, but not the hard cheeses and they don't label or tell you which is which... or give you a hard cheese slicer. NICE! 6. Our server came back after 15 minutes of getting our food, just in enough time for us to ask fo the check and get the F...out of there.   We then proceeded to Hula's Modern Tiki for the rest of our dinner, since we were still starving due to the fact that I was worried, that as slow as the wait staff was, that our dinner would spoil on the walk from the kitchen to our table and we would then have a hospital visit.  I'm not real keen on hospital food, but it would be a grade up from here.   In conclusion, if you don't understand good design, like less then sub -parr food, but believe you need to be seen in the new "it" place...just cuz...then go for it.   Now Hula's Modern Tiki on the other hand....reviewing soon.

50192BopOE5i8oVtPF5DwA.text: One of my favorites (I just wish it were slightly less busy).  Beautiful environment, professional staff, great food.  What more is there to say?

T4JoG3euzN-IcFzZ7Zdh0w.text: So my wife, my son and I decided to check this place out for lunch today and man am I a happy camper. We started with the Frito Misto that was served with Remesco, which was very good. We split 2 8" pizzas between the three of us. Each pizza had  6 cmall slices, plenty for the three of us. We had the pepperoni with fresh mozzarella and the Smokey, minus the olive tapenade (wife's not a fan, I think it would have made the pizza a bit better...maybe next time) Both pizzas were just well executed. my wife likes a bit more cook on her pies, but I thought they were great. The smokey had fresh ricotta, arugula and speck. That was the best of what we had, just well put together pizza. The menu seemed well balanced with some classics, and some that were a bit too new age for me (I just moved back from Italy a few years back and have seen everything served on a pizza, but some things are a bit much for me).  The ambience is nice, what a great addition to Central Phoenix!  We'll definitely be back..next I"m eye balling the duck breast sandwich (anything with duck, breast or any combination of the two is right up my alley ;)

N8B1OuoHtxSqS1zMQzGv9g.text: Quality isnt up to Bianco's obsessive standards, but the menu is engaging and reasonably well executed. Service ranges from sharp to self absorbed.  The space is attractive, interesting and comfortable.    Dont get the soup of the day, no matter how much they push it - it's always watery and disappointing.  The pork sandwich sucks. Once I had a hair in my pizza, but we've been here a lot and otherwise hairless.     Favorites include:  Puttanesca pizza - tender calimari.  really nice with fennel and capers.  Margherita and sausage pizzas are bueno.   Duck Club - unique, complex  Shellfish linguine -  the $12 app portion (mussels, shrimp, calamari and clams, in spicy tomato broth)  is a steal.      For dessert, zeppole dipped in mascarpone and cranberry jam was really nice with coffee.     Food execution - 3.5 out of 5 stars Menu Appeal - 5 stars Drinks/Happy Hour - 5 stars Service - 3.5 stars Ambience - 4 stars Value - 3.5 stars

_5KAhclzY4UrdeyXe7q1OQ.text: Had lunch here on the recommendation of a client and we were not disappointed. We each had 2 pints of the Arizona peach four peaks beer, at only $3 a piece it was a good and super tasty deal. We shared a bowl of the split pea and it was good not great but good, the insalata salad was fantastic as well as the margarita pizza with fresh heirloom tomato's. service was great and very attentive. Lunch was $50 + but it was really good.

cm3X8jDwQjzqraCxZDupIQ.text: The pizza dough was absolutely great and light, but perhaps too much toppings.  The appetizers were amazing.  What a cool and comfortable place. Go during the happy hour!

Lbt9wvW_7R9I-mVgITvzlg.text: You have to try this place! The atmosphere is super cool, but not pretentious, and the service is amazing. Most of all, the pizzas are creative, fresh and delicious.  They also have an interesing (but expensive) cocktail list that I will try out next time I go.  The server we had knew so much about the food and was very passionate about the ingredients. He even recommended different combinations we should try and was honest about what ingredients we probably should not combine (on a build your own pizza). The sweet corn pizza (sounds weird) was one of the most interesting things I have ever tasted. It was my favorite. I give it an A. We also got the mushroom pizza with truffle oil (solid B+) and a build your own pizza with shrimp, speck, Gorgonzola ricotta and maybe some other things that I can't remember but it was delicious. The prcies are not too bad especially considering the atmosphere, with a small gourmet pizza (enough to feed one person and leave you full) for around $10.  I really can't wait to go back and try more of the food. Next time I will plan to stay longer and enjoy the great atmosphere over cocktails!

wUhoME2HSSezskEJK5y0_A.text: Two thumbs up. We tried many items on the menu and were very pleased with quality, presentation, and taste. Owners did a great job of retaining the mid-century modern architecture and incorporating the previous building uses into the design. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. Gabe, our server, was great. Highly recommended.

W2oqHeJgKNfRhEgNJoJHZw.text: I held off, I wanted to be judicious, but my satisfaction is so thorough, it knows no bounds.  This is a restaurant that is exactly what it is trying to be.  Everytime I have gone, my expectations have been exceeded.  I have tried most of the pizzas, all have been excellent.  I have sampled salads, burgers, sandwiches, everything A-OK.  Beer, wine and liquor prices are beyond reasonable,  Basically, this is the neighborhood restaurant you have been waiting for, the place where everything is affordable and delicious, and the menu is diverse and balanced enough to keep you coming back a couple times a week.  Thank you Parlor, I love you deeply, and sincerely.

l6ZEOA4NFis0mUdOi-sL_A.text: Fabulous menu! Tons of parking. Casual, cool, non snotty vibe.  Good service.  Interesting dessert menu...  Try the butternut fritters - they come with 2 sauces.  One is a tart cranberry and the other a sweet ricotta.

rJ4r7nVlt3xYy67N_2x1sw.text: It is always a pleasure for me to go to this place. I don't know for sure to what extent they use local and/or organic ingredients, but it definitely tastes like they do and the wood-fire method makes the crust taste out of this world. Usually I sit at the bar and the service there has always been good. The bartenders are attentive and approachable, but don't hover or come off as obtrusive. I've also sat away from the bar area where you can watch them make the pizzas and at the patio too with no real major differences or issues. I like that they only have one tv and that it's in the bar area with no sound on so that you can follow the game as much or as little as you want without it dominating the social scene in front of you. The music played throughout is always interesting in an off the beaten path sort of way and never one type. It's just a variation of Pandora stations they play. Genre's that stick out to me when I've gone are big band, delta blues, new age, and techno. The lighting is great too and they like to use candles when the sun goes down. I'm very price conscious and even on a more liberal order for me with lots of ingredients on an 8" pizza and a good beer it's difficult to break $20. Usually on my order I'll skip the beer, get a club soda instead, go conservative on ingredients, and it comes out closer to $15, give or take .50 cents (tax and tip included) and still walk away completely full and satisfied. While $15 isn't necessarily dirt cheap, considering the quality of the food and the experience, it's far better than you'd get for a similar price elsewhere. To me it's just a consistently pleasant experience in every aspect every time I go. On balmy days sometimes they'll open the wall that separates the patio from the inside.

X7URndhQFPr6tsVib3-rGQ.text: Ok....so I was super excited to go check this place out. I was pretty disappointed.  I had pizza on the mind and heard The Parlor had yummy pies. I ordered the pepperoni pizza. It came out with burnt bubbles all over the top and a completely burnt bottom. It was a huge disappointment. All I could taste was char. The only good thing about it was the over sized pepperoni slices which had great flavor.   I've heard the sandwiches are good but if you plan to get pizza, prepare yourself for some char. Yuck!

vQd1KWjMKFlzbU8EueV27A.text: Went early for dinner, 5pm on a Saturday & walked right in. Appetizers were just as good as the pizzas. Everything was timely, hot and delicious. Prices are very reasonable. Each couple had an appetizer and split  14" pizza (pesto and a calamari/shrimp) and we brought some home.

Cw5epqmb0XTYhPnIDsNccg.text: We have been to The Parlor twice now, it's quickly becoming a regular!  I am a vegetarian and found that this place offers just enough options.  I got the roasted corn pizza the first time we went which was delicious - just the right amount of sauce and a little kick!  Today I got the Zucca which had a more subtle flavor profile but was absolutely delicious!  My husband got the salsiccia both times so you know he loved it! We also got the sweet corn zeppole for dessert both times as they are absolutely incredible and my new favorite dessert!  We tried a few cheeses before our meal today - for $6 we got a piece of toasted soft summer cheese from California and a hard espresso cheese from Wisconsin with 4 pieces of rosemary flatbread and pesto/chutney for dipping.  SO well worth it - my husband and I both had a cheese-gasm with our first bites of both cheeses.  I can't recommend this place more highly - the service was fast and friendly both times we've been there and the food is killer!

gfnMJhpQjzusyDjklqJC0Q.text: The Parlor is one of the best restaurants in Phoenix. At a price point comparable to TGI Fridays.. You get modern sleek surroundings, good service, and dishes that range from very good to stellar. The Parlor sausage pizza is ridonculous! (YES I SAID RIDONCULOUS) It is on par with the wize guy at Biancos imo, But here is why they are one of the best restaurants in Phoenix.. Some nights now during the summer they are offering reserve wines at 15 bucks a glass, that then unlock a 15 dollar special main course. We had a phenominal melbac, and a duck tartee that was probably one of the top 5 dishes I have ever had in Phoenix. It was foodie, complex, rich... Oh yah, it was 15 bucks.. I have had 40 dollar entrees that could not touch this dish.. Yes.. I did just have an orgasm, thank you for acknowledging..Parlor hits all points.. food, atmosphere, and service.. Thanks Parlor

BhJOG28lLLmuMvZs0ZLEfw.text: Love this pizza so so much!!!  Place gets super busy, but it's a really aesthetically appealing space.

UkQ790rsMkZ3MDpfKo_1Qg.text: Went last night and I'm already looking forward to our return. Simply amazing! Everything was perfect: atmosphere, service, food! We'll be going back to try other things on the menu. They've got unique items. We ordered 2 appetizers, 3 entrees, wine and a desert. Great portions and everything was delicious.

ApV1V7Zfpn3bRTVPunv8jQ.text: Terrific food. We have always had great service here. I especially love the salads and pizza!

fRzFLrc0IVefHjJl_138mg.text: We've been coming to The Parlor since they opened. With so many outstanding reviews, there's really not much new that I can say other than they once again were consistently very good. (Plus, I've been putting so many poor reviews out there lately, when I had a good dining experience, I wanted to recognize that.)  The main reasons for 4 stars and not 5 stars was the dessert and the service. Our waitress was certainly professional and competent, she just didn't offer that over-the-top sparkling warmth that other Parlor employees have demonstrated in the past. The host also had a bit of an attitude when we first opened the door. Just that typical teenage "I'm so cool, I have this awesome host job, so I have so much power and influence." No, son, you're WORKING here and I'm paying your salary, so just a tiny bit of appreciation on your part would do wonders in making us feel welcome. As for the dessert, it was certainly good, but did not live up to the menu billing of "Best Chocolate Cake Ever". I can make an equally good, if not better, chocolate cake at home.  The salsiccia pizza was every bit as delicious as always and the duck club was outstanding, especially with the tomato jam just adding that extra little something. Go here, it is definitely a solid addition to your regular rotation.

BWBfZUffQ4vUrD77AH8DVw.text: Pizza-4 Cocktails-5 Ambiance/service-5  Pizza was really good, but if you haven't had Il Bosco Pizza in Scottsdale do yourself a BIG favor and try it out.. IMHO best Neapolitan pizza in the Valley.

8NhGefQupvX8XZowDd0z-A.text: The photos are what drew me into this place, but I left with only subpar feelings. I tried a few of the small pizzas with a group of friends, and all were tasty! But the amount of grease made me feel bloated for the rest of the day.  Tasty food, but very rich, greasy, and saturated.

51ntXCbblFnUGilYIVoTTQ.text: Cool local retro styled Italian restaurant in the Camelback colonnade corridor for a Monday night pizza & pitcher special. Special it was with a pizza with I can't remember it all, pepperoni, onions , mushrooms,  fresh basil,  & ricotta cheese a special treat. Also enjoyed a large pitcher of good ipa Taylor our server recommended. We had a large salad with goat cheese & large side of pasta  bolgnese sp? A hearty meal on a cool phoenix night , with holiday lights & spirit in surrounding neighborhoods . Adults & children alike filled the parlor in a modern yet retro setting . Thanks Taylor for your great advice & service! Fun & warm time filling night at the parlor . Try it , I'm coming back!

s7wK2n99b2S000okwocilQ.text: Really good pizza in a city full of pizzas.  Pasta Bolognese stole the show.  Will go back after trying a few other Phoenix pizza joints to compare.

mdJBq6HterwwBMzVosnpeA.text: Just no.   Bad service. Will not be back for at least 6 months. Figure that's how long it will take for a couple weak links to turn over.   Don't worry about it though.

6fD07JtVFQDZ44mbB1G8wg.text: Came to The Parlor last night for dinner with a couple of friends. I hadn't been in ages, and my friends were talking it up, especially the Bolognese.  Got there around 7, zero wait, so that's awesome. Get seated, check out the menu's, figure out what we want...and then wait. Takes a few, but eventually a hostess swung by with some waters. Then our server, Susan shows up, and she kinda seems in a hurry/rush. Asks if we wanted anything besides water, and we inform we are ready to order. Get kind of a cold reaction, put off almost. This vibe continues for the rest of the service. Our food arrives and it becomes apparent one of our party doesn't have silverware, so we have to ask for that now. It was little things all around that kind of nickle and dimed the experience down. The biggest factor being the attitude of the serving staff, even when Susan got an assist, that individual had a poor demeanor/tone.   The food was fantastic, can't say enough good things about it, however the interactions and the service left something to be desired and definitely lessened the experience.

0c8-goNWRI-ja4PN5eeRBw.text: If you like modern Italian than you'll love The Parlor. The decor is very hip and fun and one side of the restaurant is more for dining while the other side is more relaxed with a bar. We were torn between pizza and pasta and our waiter recommended what he likes for each. We decided to go for it all and split the house pizza and the smaller pesto chiatarra, which was the perfect amount of food for two. The pesto pasta wasn't like any other I've had before, it was light and delicious but didn't make me feel full and bloated like I normally do after pasta. I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pesto Chiatarra
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The House Pizza

cX5U6_HazH8lfZTBKWgYEw.text: Best Pizza in Phoenix! Amazing craft cocktails. The service is flawless. You can tell every employee cares about the work they do.  My Wife and I love love love this place.

qdyvg-b5A8ikUqUYNNzBag.text: Great pizza and wine! Its always nice to come here!

6qzFZHErFwu3bhEVWmQUoQ.text: The Parlor is one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix. It's delicious and somewhere I always suggest if we'll have a mid-sized group of people. Everyone can get the pizza of their choice and it doesn't break the bank. My two favorites are the funghi and salsiccia. The pizzas are flavorful and the crust is thin -- just how I like it. I've also always had good service and enjoy the midcentury modern styling of the restaurant.

e3W030YtbfwKpwGkw2QMtA.text: Loved the pizza, service, and atmosphere. Went during happy hour and had a pizza for $8 with sweet potato cheese and fig jam. Definitely one of the best pizzas I've had.

6e-NZHrng2Jm-sThKx623A.text: Places like The Parlor are the reason why corporate food chains are dying. This place has incredible food with a unique atmosphere. I personally like the creativity injected in the space and the menu items.

JSM71Swc3xO5iAY7acq6Yw.text: Great happy hour with awesome fungi pizza only for $8!!! Service was great despite me having to be on the phone the entire time since I was alone. I would definitely like to come back and try more items on n their menu including their pasta. Only tip is that the market pesto pizza was a bit oily.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fungi and market pesto pizza

0AMSZkCrzIUUs144uKIWVw.text: We decided to try The Parlor while staying at a near by hotel. In short if you are visiting and looking for a good meal, this place is 100% worth it. The staff was good, the Camelback Collins was awesome, my pizza was complex and good, my kid's pizza was a really tasty cheese pizza. The outside dining was beautiful on this October evening. If I lived anywhere nearby I would go here all the time because it was a good meal for a good price. Enjoy yourselves!

fqinzcE80ppGp15v5yFLmg.text: LOVE this PLACE. Everything is so good. Must try the cauliflower gratinata!! I don't even really like cauliflower but this dish makes me DREAM about it. The atmosphere is comfortable and cool ambiance. There is an outdoor patio with a fireplace. I love the fresh herb garden as you walk into the building. Always a great pizza of the month to try and great beer/wine selection. They use to have a short rib sweet potato gnocchi with crispy brussel sprouts that I again (there's a theme) dream about *sigh* I guess the oxtail ravioli will have to suffice.

rjD94Ei4rahD4UULp9YAWw.text: This place was super delicious! We loved the atmosphere but service was a tad slow. It was our first time trying this place and by the time the waiter came we already knew what we wanted to order, that's how long it took. Highly recommend for the pizza!

riOKJpActbi3qv4o9nXBUg.text: Good place, good service and great happy hour prices. We started with eggplant bruschetta it was really yum. We both ate small margherita pizza my beau added pepperoni with red sauce to it and it was really good. And we got tiramisu to go as gift for checking into Yelp.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bruschetta too good
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margherita pizza
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pepperoni margherita pizza

c18iTXxPFrarf6lxcSuHZg.text: Decided to retry the place after 6 years.  We got the fried calamari and shrimp and was regretting this endeavor..  It was fried decently but it was so bland.  We added salt to the bits and the sauce and we can barely taste it.  The portion was pretty small too.  Then our pepperoni pizza came and it was actually pretty solid.  The crust was crisp and I do love the basil on it.  The sauce and cheese are pretty good.  We decided to go for the chocolate cake.  It was a very dense piece of bundt cake with whipped cream and dark chocolate shavings on it.  There was a cherry syrup and bits that really saved the dessert (you can barely taste the cream and shavings).  I think if it was vanilla ice cream instead and maybe some nuts on top it would've been on the really good side.

1PVl8W3wgFZs4CnKlLRxpw.text: We moved to Phoenix about a year ago and have been searching for a pizza that met our standards from where we lived before.  We've had decent pizza in AZ at a lot of different places, but this was the first that we had the 'we're going to keep coming back here' moment.' We got the salsicca which is admittedly right in our wheelhouse in terms of toppings, and it didn't disappoint...Early in the week they basically give you a free pizza if you buy a pitcher of beer from their awesome tap list.  Amazing pizza and an amazing deal.

onhiF3ORRNhcB0oIrqPfYw.text: First time here and let me tell you the pizza was fantastic!! Toppings for the pizza were a little outside the box and out of the norm... but definitely worth it!! Wasn't too busy at all around 6pm.. Will definitely be back!

U5-ar_QrboLeSr9eG0rfDQ.text: I wish there were 6 stars! We stopped in for a late lunch/early dinner Sunday afternoon. It was Happy Hour - an unexpected surprise. Drinks were excellent- especially the Sangria.  We spilt a roasted beet sales between 3 of us - very light, fresh, - a perfect starter for the main course. We spilt 2 small pizzas - pepperoni and BBQ chicken. The crust in thin, the toppings very fresh. We also had a small bowl of the Cavatelli; it usually comes with port, but the pork wasn't fully roasted yet. So we substituted chicken. Who needs pork when this is so good!!  Eddie took care of us perfectly - a really delightful guy with a great smile. We just moved here and are right around the corner, so we'll definitely be back.  We've found our neighborhood pizza place!!!

OjkK4MmszWC0PVpykimdqg.text: One of my favorite spots to get pizza. The restaurant is an old parlor. Cute entrance and patio. My favorite go to pizza's are the funghi and their homemade sausage pizza. Both delicious.

aXq-nv7QzDQQQFjabvVmsw.text: This is a trendy fun place. The emphasis is on pizza, but, they offer a full menu. This includes small plates and a full bar. The atmosphere is fun, but, on a crowded Saturday night the noise level is high. The waitlist can be long, but, if you use your Yelp app. you can add your name to the list from home. The pizza was very good, especially good crust. We split a pizza and Caesar salad. Both were very good. The service was excellent. I would certainly recommend this restaurant. ..we enjoyed both the food and the atmosphere.

U7JFntwz1gQYAxlBR31ObA.text: We decided to do date night here last night; I had dined here twice in the previous 4 years but have not been in recently. We arrived around 7:30 and the place was moderately busy. It was a beautiful night and the patio was packed. The hosts put us as close the patio as possible, in a two top afixed to the patio doors, which was perfect.   Our server was just the right amount of attentive. She gave us time to look at the menu, order wine, and gave suggestions on what size pizza and pasta we should share since I remembered loving all the dishes I had tried there.  We decided on a glass of sauv blanc for me, a cab sauv for him, a yukon gold potato pizza with an egg baked on top and a small bolognese pasta. I kid you not, the food was overwhelmingly delicious. The white pizza was creamy and delicious, while the bolognese was just sweet and savory enough to be reminiscent of italy. The wine was a great choice, I will definitely look for Mt. Beautiful Sauvignon next time I am out.  A++ food, A++ service, and a great night.

T33hqgnqmOIOjoRdnT6asA.text: Summary:  I have come here three times, and have not had a bad thing yet.   Ambience: modern casual, has outdoor seating, and indoor seating had a nice, clean vibe. I would say it's warm modern.   Service:  very good each time I've come. The wait staff is personable, professional, and attentive. They definitely add to the dining experience.   Drinks are great. Good beer selection, cocktails are well done, and wine selection is pretty good as well.   Food: Pepperoni pizza - winner! Duck sandwich - winner! Bacon Gorgonzola burger - winner! Chocolate cake - winner! Zeppolis (donut holes) - big winner! Steak salad (Paul) - yes it has vegetables, but it also has a full skirt steak. Winner!  Honestly, if you're in the camelback or paradise valley area, just come here.

FcFZ5ti3WwRMoVwZrY2ngA.text: Overall a great Italian restaurant.  Place is very under the radar, food is great especially the pizzas.  Great happy hour specials too! Kid friendly, a definite plus!

EGRA53xTaAabittCMf3pxw.text: I had no idea what to expect when my friend told me this is where she wanted to take me in the future. It looked basic from the outside, but as we walked closer into the restaurant. I was impressed! This place has a great layout for perfect romantic, and fancy place to take your girl, or guy out for a special dinner. Well, i felt special knowing the fact that she wanted to surprise me here in the future. Lighting was right, alittle noisy, but it was ok. I enjoy the social noise.   The waitress was very helpful and respectful towards us ordering. She definitely kept us happy. And the food didnt take long at all surprisingly.   The food was great! Presentation was definitely nice to go along with the amazing taste. Very tasteful, nice and light, juicy, and creamy. The desserts will melt in your mouth with every bite. Maybe its just cuz i enjoy food in general, but id take another risk to go back here and try something else. The portion of the pasta dish was somewhat small. Wish i got double the amount for the price i paid for. Still enjoyable though.   Overall, this place is rated a five star to me nust cuz the fact that i was impressed that this is where my friend wanted to take me in the future. Its that thought that counts. And its an experience, and memory to have for sure. I definitley felt special that night. This place is good. And i recommend it to everyone!

Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Hw_1bruyzLccQhzvVqj4TQ.text: 5/5 for food and 3/5 for service & ambience.  Food: So good! They're known for their interesting and unique flavor combinations, and they didn't disappoint. We enjoyed a customizable charcuterie board to start, and appreciated that we could choose the cheeses and meats to start with. We had a Yukon Gold pizza (roasted yukon potato, gorgonzola, pancetta, leeks, and rosemary) and the Roasted Beet salad (organic beets, walnut crusted goat cheese, arugula, fennel, avocado, gastrique onion, and white balsamic vinaigrette). The potatoes were tender and went well with the cheese and meat pairings, and the beets were amazing. I would definitely go back to try different offerings. Portions were adequate, but not enormous. We didn't have any food left over.  Service: Somewhat long wait time, but that was to be expected - we went at night, on a weekend. Server was nice and hospitable, but didn't go out of her way to explain anything very well. The mood was somewhat ruined by the people at the bar shouting intermittently at the television. If you want to be able to hear your date, call and check if it's game night before you go.  Other tips: We appreciated the valet parking, but they park the cars in the same parking lot that you would have parked in, so I'm not really sure what the point is. My car was literally 5 steps from the door.

-4oDBKSTpFgMrDjiCuJOMg.text: Great pizza and salad, came for lunch. They were a little busy which was probably why it took a long time for our food to come out, but the food was delicious so I guess it was worth the wait. Waitress misheard us on our order and brought out the wrong pizza at first, but apologized sweetly and brought out the correct one within a few minutes! Nice place for lunch and I would definitely come back for dinner as well. Also the ranch dressing was phenomenal! Thanks!

HyMgmUU4jgn427LNdEkhXw.text: Let me start by saying I've only eaten the pizzas here. Because I found one I like and I'm sticking with it!  The Autunale Pizza In the winter months (from September to May I think) they come out with this seasonal pizza, which has caramelized onions, prosciutto, fig jelly, toasted almonds, sweet potato ricotta, arugula and some other toppings. It's the best pizza I've ever had. From anywhere. The only problem is that it's seasonal and not available year-round. UUUUUGGGGGHHHHH.  They cook the pizzas in the hot stone pizza oven. The crust is almost always perfect (there have been a few times when it's been a little under or over cooked, no big deal.)   There's a yukon gold potato with gorgonzola pizza that's really good too. Be prepared: the BBQ chicken pizza is a little spicy! But honestly, nothing compares to that damn Autunale.  The price of their pizzas reflects the specialty creations that they are. 8" is $10, 12" for $16. This is not Papa John's guys. The ingredients are premium and the pizzas burst with flavor.  Staff have ALWAYS been friendly. I've eaten in and, more often, I've taken to go.  Love the style of the place. It can be a little noisy when it's busy, but I really love the casual ambiance. I always ask for the quieter patio when I eat in.

FsXUvWpdPjXsMDw2Q_neBw.text: Just wanted to give a shoutout to Kat who was a GREAT waitress! We needed help making decisions (when everything on the menu looked good!) and she gave very relevant and helpful recommendations. Did not give our group any problems with separate checks which we really appreciated.  Of course I'm sure you can guess from all the other reviews that the food is amazing! We got a few pizzas and loved them all.. another standout for me was the mozzarella in corrozza salad (a big crispy ball of mozzarella cheese in the middle.... drooool). Cheese lovers unite!  Come during happy hour 3-6 for great prices on beer, wine by the glass, appetizers, and pizzas (only $7!) :)

jMIKii5EiZRYJjDg8W5z7w.text: I'm pretty obsessed with pizza, especially unique personal pizzas. My boyfriend and I made a stop here on the way to Sedona - Thanks to the help of my fellow yelpers.  Unlike many of the businesses we saw in the area, this restaurant was busy! I really liked the modern design, decor, and classy feel of the Parlor.   We ordered the Duck club and made our own pizza. The pizza was really delicious!  The ingredients were so fresh, and I love the rich taste of the oils and cheesy crust.  I almost ordered one for take out! 5 stars for food, but 4 stars for service. The waitress gave us attitude when we tried redeeming our free yelp desserts, and wasn't too friendly to us throughout our visit.  Luckily the food was superb!    I would definitely come back if I'm ever back in the area.

Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My masterpiece: pepperoni, feta cheese, olives, peppers, basil, cilantro, garlic, and sundried tomatoes!

qrwiFi-nQlvOIBT5YbHBUw.text: Duck club is legit.  Roasted duck, applewood bacon, red wine tomato jam, aoli.  The Mine That Bird cocktail is strong but delicious  I'll be back

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mind That Bird

pAVywIoYrXijvT7xkmL5WQ.text: Very cute interior and patio! Great happy hour and most importantly delicious pizza!! We usually try and split a new salad and a new pizza and we've yet to be disappointed! The service is nothing to write home about but it's a convenient location and always has great atmosphere!

qQ2sB0RZA10FhW4-uNz9QQ.text: Although it's my first check in on yelp, i have been coming here for the past five years. Great wood oven cooked pizza, yummy salads, pasta is made here and the Bolognese is just amazing.   They have daily HH with a great selection of beers on tap, great wine selection and specialty cocktails rock!   Service is impeccable whether you sit at the bar or a table. Just love it here.   Favs: parlor insalata, all pizzas, pappardelle bolognese.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sauvignon Blanc, mt beautiful. 2 bucks off for happy hour! HH is 3-6, daily bAby!

DyRAZyJB2XjsnVjZ0KWSdQ.text: I read about this place a long time ago and it was stuck in my head that it's a pizza joint.  But it's so much more!  Interesting cocktails and unique salads and sandwiches make up the eclectic menu.  The pizza IS really good though.  The margerita pizza was fantastic.  I was bummed to realize that I left my remaining portion there.    Yet another fantastic option on the Camelback Corridor.

Q-WbRxR99J68ZAcE_iKUvA.text: Great beer selection, especially if you're into Four Peaks brews.  I had the Pesto pizza and added garlic. It was absolutely delicious.   The only thing that was bothersome was we were sitting at the Pizza bar which happens to be next to where the food comes out of the kitchen and some guy that worked there kept complaining to the cooks/pizza makers about the food. It's like, if you don't like it so much why don't you get behind the counter and make it yourself?  So besides the whiney man and semi-attentive server the food is absolutely delicious and the atmosphere is great.  I would definitely recommend The Parlor to anyone who likes awesome gourmet pizza.

FqnMD7yaplDG3Ux-x9UT-w.text: Yummy nummy weird pizzas! If you want some delicious pizza and don't care if it has lots of stuff like goat cheese and pine nuts this is your place! You don't have to know what the ingredients are. The waiter suggested the funghi pizza, it was a pizza covered in mushrooms and was really good! But, I'll be back to try other flavors,  because I'm a meat eater at heart! Very reasonably priced and a nice experience.

YwIvlW6LrZ2LD8t05ulWWw.text: Top choice for pizza in the Biltmore area for sure.  So good!  The ambiance is great, perfect for a date or small group.    This is the kind of place where you want to order a bottle of wine and an appetizer, hang out for a while, get and share a pizza, hang out for a while, get and share another pizza... you get the idea.  I forget exactly what we ordered, but I do remember getting the night's special pizza and being absolutely blown away.  The service was awesome, the type where you want to become friends with the staff.  And the food top-notch.  Free valet parking, great atmosphere, great wine... although I take no credit for choosing.  That's my job when it comes to pizza, and I can do my job quite well here.

xTAQwSPoMnVSBC0EY43blg.text: Went here with JD's parents on a Sunday night and at 6pm the parking lot was packed. We dropped the p's off and finally found a spot in the parking area for the Armadillo (I felt bad b/c one of their waiters was outside having a smoke and saw us, but there was so much room there!!) Anyway, the place is cute, nothing fancy, but not trying to be super cool makes it pretty cool to me! I had the beet salad and wished I could have turned it into the chopped salad- looked much better even though I am a beet freak. I had the puttenesca pizza, even though the server didnt highly recommend it (she didnt like shrimp). I loved it! It was spicy and cooked perfectly- not too tough but still crispy.  The bar crowd looked like a fun bunch, so I will most certainly be back again soon!

0jo4_BkxLIU_YQruiVfWRw.text: Great Pizza, it definitely lives up to the hype. Easily one of the best pies n the state and a hip spot.

A2Np3sERNNKn_z1fzOeo9g.text: Nice spot. Great bar and happy hour. Good is great and innovative. I've met the owner as is a really nice guy with a great vision for what he wants the restaurant to be.

ZCwgFpUzK1_uk_PKM29TkA.text: I love The Parlor. I have been there many times and everything I have ordered has been great. The pizzas are awesome. The salads are fresh and flavorful. I've tried a few delicious wines.  Service is good without being obtrusive. I'm the sort who likes my server to be my server, not my best friend. They're there when you need them. No more, no less. This scores big points for me.  It is so rare to find a place that is all hits and no misses, and The Parlor is that place for me so far. You must go if you haven't yet.

baBghVIezYZvZyueOE_A5A.text: Love this place!  Culinary treat! This visit I tried the Mescolanza and Bruxelles. Both were so flavorful.  Some thought was put in to this menu!  I can't wait to try the pizza on my next visit.  I also love garden out front.

RiaV1S2uiGL5LgySvrgOEQ.text: It's a good thing, when what I have to say negative about your restaurant, has nothing to do with the actual quality.  The parking sucks, and its not easy to get a table in there.  I have really enjoyed bellying up the bar.  The bartenders were great for a conversation, and would leave me alone when need be to eat my pie.  The staff has been hit or miss though in general.  Sometimes they are great and warm up very well to my conversation, laugh at me when I am funny, and generally enhance my dining experience.  At other times I question if they are even earthlings.  The food here is wonderful.  I started off with a sausage pizza (I forget the technical name of the pie, but it had sausage).  It was very good.  Thin crust, which usually isn't my program in terms of pizza.  I enjoyed it.  Thank you once again to Schreiner's for the wonderful meat products.  The secret on the menu, however, is the burger.  It is one of the best in town.  It melts in your mouth, and is extremely enjoyable.  Welcome to the new and ever changing midtown, uptown Phoenix rotation.  I am a fan!

gfGcGRwTW8jjGY7B3DnS3w.text: Im not a pizza lover so I cant tell you about that. Im a pasta and seafood lover, and this place does a great job of that. I always get the seafood linguini which is home made. To die for! The texture of the noodles is so much better. The sauce has a little kick that makes it double worthy. The clams and calimari are perfect. No rubberbands there. There is one downfall. The shrimp is always dried out. Not sure if its how they cook it or maybe freezer burned. Id like to say its happened once, but its always the same. Sea food linguini still rocks! I guess I should have them leave the shrimp out.

quP8B50P-lFrAnVLveW24g.text: From hair parlor to pizza parlor -- I found The Parlor to be a unique, high-quality restaurant, and a welcome addition to my Phoenix neighborhood. Here's my take:  What I liked:  - The food:  There are plenty of pre-conceived pies on the menu, but where this place shines is the emphasis on build-your-own.  You can choose either a 9" or a 12" pizza, which link to per-item charges for proteins and veggies.  I asked for my pizza extra-crispy, and it came out perfect.  The salads were also fantastic.  - The drinks: a decent wine selection and a nice variety of signature cocktails.  I ordered the Basil Gimlet, which was refreshing and a drink I'd love to replicate at home.  - The service: friendly and attentive enough during this visit. We didn't wait long for anything (except for a table, which was understandable on a Saturday at 7PM).  We waited 25 minutes, but those a few minutes behind us were told 45 minutes.  - The ambiance: The Parlor is in a building once occupied by a barber shop, and the proprietors chose to keep the spirit alive vis-a-vis the decor.  The artwork, props, and even the bar stools are reminiscent of The Parlor's past days as a salon.  I'm just hoping I never find any hairs in my pizza.  What I didn't like:  - While the cocktails tasted nice, the sizes leave much to be desired.  My basil gimlet was 11 bucks and looked like about 5 sips.  I was disappointed when I watched my bartender discard the remaining beverage left in the cocktail shaker after he filled my glass -- which reveals the problem: the small martini glasses must go.  Perhaps the owners can do a benchmarking study at AZ88 for proper martini glass sizes.  - The bar: a bit small for a place this size.  The Parlor has True potential for a great bar scene -- they just need to devote more space.  All in all a great place and I'm looking forward to going back.

wu-eMDx-N-jMU6Nww1_g5Q.text: Tried this place for weekday lunch.  We arrived before noon and good thing since they have a big lunch crowd.  (not to worry, plenty of parking in back and seating outside w/ misters)  Kudos to Aric and Monica for stopping by our table several times to make sure service was great or they fixed it.  We started with the Bruchetta, which was piled high.  The we had the Smokey (arugula & smoked prosciutto) and the Marg pizzas. Almost had the Pabst on tap, but went for the Dunkel since its harder to find.  As if the food wasn't enough, the decor and ambiance was over the top.  The herb garden as you walk in and the bar with the salon chairs was a nice touch.   Can't wait to go back.

etJyBUjshFX4FGEPv9Mpiw.text: Loved this place!  Up scale pizza place.  It used to be an old hair salon with some of the memorabilia still there.  You have to try the Cauliflower Gratinata (I don't even like Cauliflower)!!  All the other food we tried was great too. The waitress was awesome.  My friend and I were there catching up and definitely outstayed our welcome but she was so nice and keep telling us to stay.

rMWwyVroKv3g2ckh2jUXuQ.text: Trendy, urban atmosphere with soft music and low lighting-perfect for a mid evening dinner or drink.  I found the food to just be ok... But I'm not that adventurous either.  Outdoor eating was fun and staff was attentive and fun.  Not the greatest ever.. But a good stop.

jbW8J_h5ToMgRJp31WPgXA.text: We were talking about the bologense for days......whatever is in the horseradish spread on the pulled pork sandwich is magic.  Only wish the calamari was double the size. Sue me, but I love the stuff.  Chose The Parlor for date night a few weeks ago after a brief chat about another favorite local spot that recently added valet (seriously, this is Phoenix) and had zero open spots for us to park our own car (novel concept). "Parlor it is."    This vibe in this place is cool and unpretentious. Wait staff was friendly and service was good.  The modern decor is awesome. And, believe me with a boyfriend who has a career in visual merchandising, we talk about these things everywhere we go.   His eye kept noticing great little details like the wood plank ceiling in the bar and the stacked wood blocks making up the hostess stand.  Love it.  We sat in the bar and managed to snag a hightop table to ourselves among the community seating concept even though it was a Saturday night and BCS weekend!  The warm glow of the ovens, the low lighting and buzz of people had us wondering why we hadn't added The Parlor to our list of spots before.  Can't wait to get back to you, Parlor.  You're now on our list.

NhOoOGHSnhou_Wx1RWG1RA.text: Mmmmmmmmmmmm the pesto pizza. MMMMMMMMM!!!!! The only two things I have ordered here have been the 12 inch pesto pizza and the spinach salad. And every time it has been just as delicious as the last, which is why I keep going back. I usually get both when I go (I split it with someone unfortunately). The first few times I got a stomach ache after....but that's probably cause we eat the whole entire thing. I don't blame the pizza(wo)man. I went there for my 21st birthday a few days ago and they brought me the most delicious piece of chocolate cake. I am not sure if I would try something different just because I know what I love. I can't imagine it getting any better than my usual order. I highly recommend The Parlor for any pesto lova out there. I also have to comment on the cold beer. My family was so impressed by how cold the beer was.

epuqxC2WCJoBvilk3VgLQw.text: I enjoyed the pizza. The bar area is a great place to meet new people because the seating necessitates sharing tables.

vjD4qcDDPFublA_7VZMwvg.text: It's a great spot for lunch or dinner and they make a mean burger. I had mine with caramelized onions and provolone with their fabulous fries, truly to die for. I have yet to have a signature pizza but I love their salads and sandwiches. If I try their pizza and it's great then I will upgrade my rating to 5 stars!

5DcMRvM9qaTm905gWjx_AQ.text: I love coming to this place!  The pizza is always very good and so are the salads!  The one thing I love about this place is that they carry a Cabernet Frac and by the glass!  The service is so-so, the waitresses really don't pay that much attention to you but the food and wine make up for it all.  Oh and I dont like the complementary vallet either, it is a small parking lot and kind of annoying for those who do not like to vallet.

dQfnPvHzp1UhIMO9zrlaFw.text: Delicious!  I had the pepperoni and can't wait to come back to try more!  The crust was perfect and the sauce was very fresh.

AQBVcmg38BBd9eDFgDXHoA.text: I come here often but today....my waiter really sucks. I was at my table for over 15 min before he finally came over to get my drink order. When he gave me the wrong drink, he just shrugged and took my drink away. No apology, nothing. Came back and just dropped off the correct drink.... Let's hope my food arrives right. No tip for him!

sD1HqCoE0khldynA3Vvijw.text: The farm greens salad - simple yet so good! I come here quite a bit and never disappointed.

2OOtl5vivIyGmTRCjLcK-g.text: I thought The Parlor was okay. From the outside, you can't really tell what kind of place you're going into. I liked that. They also have an herb garden outside.   My co-worker and I split the small caesar salad, glad the dressing wasn't overly fishy. I went basic, and ordered the pepperoni & basil pizza. It was good, and the mozzarella was homemade. My co-worker ordered the fungi pizza and raved about it.

P0ZJoo6ktDc9efhnibeEQQ.text: We went here for the first time they did brunch. We were so excited! However, let me just let you down easy - the Bloody Mary with all its hype and photos with delicious garnishments is a mirage. It arrived at the table with a lemon and lime. No prosciutto, no pickle, no peppers. I was totally bummed. The actual drink was good. I ordered the breakfast pizza. This place has fantastic pizzas, I just think we should keep them lunch/dinner affairs. My hubby ordered the parfait which was okay but if we had the pay the full price of $10 that seems like a bad deal. Also, this is my biggest pet peeve - they brought our food first and my three year old had to sit there asking "where's my grilled cheese?" For like five minutes. Not good. Overall, I would say there are better brunch places - lets just keep this an evening joint.

-Jki_s43vxpj1D9PNSrNTQ.text: The food is great!!  Any of the pizzas are a great option but my favorite is the margherita and the funghi.  The tiramisu is to die for.  Now, about the service...super slow.  I wouldn't recommend coming for lunch during work.  Also, at this visit, I had a dirty fork and a hair on my plate.  I'm hoping this is an isolated incident as I really enjoy coming here.

RxmfCgVDyWC26eHDpTLnjA.text: Who loves this place?  I do!  I do!  From the funghi pizza, to the spinach salad and any of the burgers with those perfect fries, you just can not go wrong here.  The staff is clearly on the hipster side of life which can be good and bad.  In this case, it is a good thing.  Very helpful and friendly.  Sit on the patio no matter the temp outside.  Misters make it very comfortable, even when its 110 outside!

XHk7R_q3P9GwqkBmrdCApg.text: I had lunch there the other day with a friend and normally I don't have a desert.  I love the vibe of this place and it has a nice menu...well enough about that....the Banana Cream Pie (served layered in a dish) was the best thing I have had in a long time!  I seriously can't quit thinking about it.  Highly recommend!

fA4f7a6XJ_jGw9dKwZxJ4A.text: Leave it to me to order a sandwich in a place known almost exclusively for their pizzas. Typical Bacon Boy. So, while Ayesha S ordered the 8" Funghi and Robert M the 8" Margherita, I was drawn to the Duck Club sandwich. Not just because it has bacon on it! Okay, maybe largely because it has bacon on it. Thinly sliced smoky duck breast topped with thick strips of bacon and an interesting sweet sauce were the perfect marriage for a sandwich, although it seems almost insulting to classify this as only a "sandwich."  They have Guinness on tap and two seemed like a great start to this meal.

vHXemkbFR3W7-atHArJ4FA.text: My girlfriend and I always come to the parlor for date night. The pizza is the best pizza We have ever had. We always get the bourb (bourbon lovers out there have to try this) olives to start which are warm and melt in your mouth, and the margherita pizza with their house made mozzarella. The service is also outstanding. We have never had to wait longer than 20min. Even if we had to wait an hour, it would not matter, the food/ambiance is worth it!

XrwyuXHX5Sjbp7SKfQY5kg.text: Love this place. Classic Italian dishes. Also some more complex creations as well. This isn't my favorite pizza spot but they do a great job. The bar program is amazing and every time I end up here I leave happy and satisfied. The polenta was delightful. Love the goat cheese and beat salad. Michael Brian and Libby are my hero's. Go to the parlor and leave with a smile on your face and your belly full. Also one of the best wine selections in Phoenix. Love it.

80KCSVkbRjmYB58TXp7dlw.text: I love this place! I've been here multiple times before, but there was a big drought between the first couple of times I was here and the most recent times I did go there. This hits all my buttons- chic, urban decor, excellent, unique, seasonal food, friendly wait staff and reasonable prices.   This place is known for their pizzas. They do a great thin crust, and have well mastered even the basics like margherita (absolutely delicious). They also have cooler, more uncommon options for those of y'all who are like me, and are addicted to the new and the different. I've had the Funghi (sucker for mushrooms and truffle oil), the Speck (ricotta, olive tapenade and speck) and the Yukon (potatoes! On a pizza! Too cool!), all of which are great. And this is across 3 or so years, since as mentioned I went there a few times a couple of years ago and then just recently twice in a short span of time. So they're very consistent in their quality as well.   I've only just recently tried their pasta. And lamented why, oh why did I wait so long?! The one that truly wowed me was their seasonal item, the vegetable gnudi. It had soft, fluffy, quarter sized gnudi/gnocchi, swimming in this incredible sweet potato and squash broth, that had brussel sprouts and a couple of other vegetables that I can't remember. I wasn't entirely keen on getting it- after all, their version of the carbonara sounded so much more tempting! But I'm working on losing weight and so went for the healthier option. And O.M.G. It's sad they don't have this all year around, because both me and my husband were blown away. This was sweet and savory and silky and rich, and had just enough gnudi in there to really fill you up. No sharing this puppy, no sirree. (Well, maybe with the husband, but I love him and he's paying for my meal.)   Their appetizers also are pretty great. I've had the Arancine, which are deep fried risotto balls. They're really awesome, crispy and rich all at the same time. And their roasted brussel sprouts were to die for. It had bacon and caramelized onions and I practically inhaled it all.  Cocktails are great too. I wish I could remember what I got, but I'm looking at the menu now and I'm positive it's not on there, so the cocktail menu is seasonal and does change, which is awesome. They're very unique combinations, and if you're stumped just ask the wait staff. They haven't steered me wrong yet.   So yeah, the food is great. Couple of cons- Parking. It's iffy. I would say bring a bit of cash and be prepared to take advantage of the complimentary valet. It's better than attempting to find a spot, failing, and having to go back and try to navigate the Camelback Rd traffic. The place is also a bit hard to find. If you're coming from the west, always watch out for the Data Doctor's sign. Then get into the turn lane right away! It's riiiiight after that. They also don't take reservations. I've not had a huge issue, but for truly enormous groups it can be a bit of a pain.   Fairly minor though, considering how great this place is. Definitely on the rotation of places I love to go to.

4kd6FKm2ZLD2ohTFzlPc5g.text: Yum!  A friend brought me here to celebrate  my birthday, and it was wonderful!  We had the Yukon gold potato pizza, and it was incredible.  The spinach salad we also shared was the best I've ever had.  It was a beautiful day, so we enjoyed sitting on the patio.  What a great place tucked away where I wouldn't have found it myself!

eN1XANh1XZA0uvLOYnhI7g.text: Nice ambiance and great service!  The food we ordered was a bit hit or miss. In hindsight, we may have missed the boat by not ordering their specialty, pizza.   The roasted cauliflower with cheese sauce was a bit salty, but very good. The roasted beet and arugula salad was ok. A bit under seasoned with dressing, and the arugula ratio was a bit much. The bone marrow appetizer was bland. The mussels in chorizo both were very flavorful, but a bit too spicy, the mussels were a little overcooked. I wasn't crazy about the cheesy thick focaccia-like bread served on the side with everything.  My mojito was refreshing and very good. My friend ordered a burger and enjoyed it. She ordered a drink that she had on a previous visit and said it tasted completely different. She told the server, but in the end...wasn't able to figure it out what was different.  I liked the ambiance and overall service, so I'd give The Parlor another try and order pizza and drinks next time.

cHBbn36OSO_nfmXTIaoSSA.text: I had high expectations for the Parlor, and I've been told to go here for the two years I've lived in Phoenix, but the stars didn't align until tonight, when my wife and I were able to sneak away for their happy hour.    First, the decor is comfortable and modern, just like any number of restaurants in Phoenix--think Postino's, the Vig, Windsor, etc.  We asked to be seated in the courtyard, as the weather was close to perfect.  Hostess was friendly. So far, so good.    A waiter arrived at the table that was seated a couple minutes after us and he enthusiastically told them about a fresh salad that had just been picked from the owner's garden, and it piqued our interest.  Our waiter arrived a couple minutes later and offered drinks, but nothing about specials.  I would describe our waiter as cautiously friendly.  I waited tables in college, and I remember waiters seeing certain patrons come in and wanting to shuffle them off of someone else...I felt like that patron.  I had a nearly identical experience at FEZ a couple years back, and I've only returned once.  There are too many restaurants in Phoenix to bother with mediocre service.    So service was a little chilly.  How was the food and drink?  The freshly-picked salad was excellent.  Bitter greens with fresh-made croutons and a beet vinaigrette with beets picked out of the same garden.  Simple, fresh, wonderful.    Ordered two of the happy-hour pizzas: the Margherita pizza and a pesto pizza.  They were both decent, with the pesto being a bit better, but neither were spectacular.  I still prefer Pizzeria Bianco for this kind of pie, and no one in town, maybe even the state, can match Pino's Margherita.  It just felt average.  I've also eaten a lot of pesto on trips through Liguria, so I know what I want.    Had the cherry zeppole for dessert.  Good, but not inspired, and probably wouldn't spend the money again.
