photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Summer Fling shandy and the lovely Yuko H. She said I wasn&#39;t Elite material because I wait to post my pics after dinner. T_T
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tiramisu! The toffee made it too sweet.
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Market Pizza: Beets, beet puree, walnut pesto, spiderella, feta cheese, and bacon. Sorry so blurry! My allergies are getting to me!

s_L8sd0ZaMIRVmk-B5Zehg.text: This place is insane! So good! Definitely an order anything kind of spot and it will be good! Pizzas are insane so was everything else. Amazing good cocktails too! Definitely come here the Yelp reviews are legit!

VuRGNdiof6oKYFRVkzpmFQ.text: A friend of mine introduced me to this place a few months ago and now I am here every other week. I can't get enough of it I even opted to come here for my birthday meal.  The cocktail menu is sound and if you like old fashioned this is one if the best you will taste. It has a VERY smooth taste with not so much of that bite from the bitters. I like a strong bitter OF but the smoothness really is amazing.   The pizza I order is the best I've tasted in Arizona... I get the Spicy Florentine and then add sausage, flipping amazing with the Ricotta cheese. I feel like getting in the car right now *drools*  We had a big party of about 15 for my birthday so I tried to call in advance and reserve a table. The manager called me back and told me that you have to pay in advance $40 per head which I was not willing to do myself. It actually pissed me off a bit but honestly... The pizza and cocktails are so good I couldn't possibly rate less than a 5.

YBgOadkD4_PGU5vruT-itg.text: The service and food exceeded my expectations. Everything is farm to table fresh and full of flavor. The pizza crust is crunchy with the smoke flavor of the open fire oven. The people here are genuinely friendly and helpful. We will definitely be back and can't wait to try everything on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy Florentine Pizza
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Farm Greens Salad
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vine Ripe Margherita Pizza

SRPONfSHfa7WrxrQUAM1XA.text: Great spot for date night. Nice, retro vibe with soft lighting. I had the white Sangria (they make this in batches so by the time I had a glass it was too strong for me) and my husband had one of their craft beers. We shared the fried shrimp and calamari appetizer, which was delicious! Then we shared the margarita pizza -- yum! Overall, great place, food, ambiance and fantastic customer service!!

OADaxnoVOUgg6s69WUSeGQ.text: I found this little place on my business trip to Phoenix last week. It was amazing and I stopped by twice!  Drinks were top notch and the food fabulous from the salad through dessert. I recommend trying this joint!  I'll definitely stop again if I find myself back in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Camelback (vodka) Collins, caprese salad and pepperoni and basil pizza.

xG1jKYi7b9vQr4bUzB0MMw.text: After Yelping for hours we decided on this place over Spinato's because this place had Coke products which is a big deal to me.  We started off with the Caprese (12.00) and an additional 3.00 for bread, it was very good, just thought the bread should be included.  I ordered the house made tagliatelle noodles with the classic marinara and I have to say it was amazing.  My hubby ordered the pepperoni pizza, he said it was an 8 on a scale of 1-10.   Overall next time we are in the area we will definitely stop again.

8H6d1rQYu1HsGM-T1UEj4Q.text: This was my first time to the parlor and I absolutely loved every part of my visit.  We came here for my close friends birthday and it was such a great experience. We were immediately greater which is great to me. Our server shortly came over and took our drink order.  I love wine and the selection offered is huge and awesome. We tried a red blend from Washington and wow was it good. We ordered the mozzarella salad (forget the official name) but was it so good. When they brought it we were weirded out because it looked way different but never judge a book by its cover, man was it good! After our salad we ordered the pesto pizza add chicken and maaaaan was it good. I was nervous because I'm picky about pizza but wow I'll be back soon.   Everything about this night was great. Super friendly service. Amazing food. I looked up their happy hour and wow I'll be back soon. Pasta and bottle of wine for $35 on Monday Tuesday's! Wow! I'll be back soon.   I can't wait to come back. Some restaurants have good food and bad service or vice verse but not at the parlor. the service was stellar and the food was deeeelish.

CyLovG1vccJbeG7YKwhb6w.text: This is my favorite restaurant in all of Phoenix. Extremely fair pricing for how absolutely delicious the food is! My husband and I took our son there and it was the best family dinner date out that we have had in awhile.

WG2-uZSdhTko5vLahFqm6Q.text: My compliments to this establishment for both quality of food and service. Usually I'm quite selective when it comes to pizza but the Parlor, is on my top ten list for now on. I had the smoky and my friend had the puttanesca. Both delicious. Thin crust, full of flavor. Ryan was our waiter, he did a great job. I'll be back!

EbvzKoP8fluCWpaSvTCy-A.text: One of my favorite "go to" places . Consistently good. Great cocktails. Attentive service. What's not to like?

ftguvEKop-iajAZe5YHP5Q.text: After about 4 hours of traveling, we settled on dinner here as it was still open at 9pm on a Wednesday night (and also because of the 4 stars.) The pizzas looked good, but the hubs and I were in the mood for some Italian.  We were seated right away and waters on the table almost immediately. We put in our drink order for a refreshing pinot grigio and the fritto  misto. The wine went well with our meal. The fried calamari and shrimp were well seasoned and crispy. The dipping sauce was a step above the average cocktail sauce. The husband got the large Cavatelli Porchetta and loved it. There was a good amount of pork in the dish and the house made pasta was like biting into a good cheese. That sauce though. Man it was flavorful! Just the right amount of kick. He killed the dish. I ordered the spicy seafood linguine. I loved the spiciness! It definitely had a Louisiana seafood boil taste to it. The small plate was enough food for me. I didn't even finish all of the noodles.  Service was solid. The server was knowledgeable and descriptive about the menu. I could see us coming back, especially to try their happy hour.

g1KaAlSkjJz8Zudun3d8Lw.text: When we stayed downtown Phoenix for a week we ate here 4 out of 7 days!! That tells ya something. The salads are fresh and dressings are unique. Pizza is crispy and wonderful tasting. Service is great too. This will be our go to place when visiting Phoenix!!

8a1dISQ4ptcjbUC8EJJpdA.text: I had only been here once before, and that was for takeout.  Me and my friend decided to head on back for a little happy hour action before our baseball game downtown.  We asked where we wanted to be seated, and we chose outside.  Turns out, that was a bad choice.  Choose inside...you will see why later on.    The Parlor has a great happy hour.  $7.00 pizzas and $5.00 appetizers.  We each went with a pizza, and an app. I went with the "House Pizza" and the Fritto Misto for my appetizer.  My friend went with the "Salsiccia Pizza" and the Cauliflower appetizer.  I had a Coke to drink.  Here is how everything was.............  Fritto Misto-  This is a mixture of fried calamari and shrimp.  It was excellent!  The breading was perfect, and both the shrimp and calamari rings tasted great!  It was served with a little cocktail type sauce and everything worked well.  For $5.00 during happy hour, this is a great appetizer!  I would definitely get it again!  Cauliflower-  Surprisingly, not bad!  Its baked cauliflower and cheese.  I ate a few pieces and it tasted pretty good.  My friend really loved it and took about half of it home to eat later on that day.  I would probably get it again.  House Pizza-  This pizza is described as, "Bacon, kale, giardiniera, mozzarella and garlic."  It sounded pretty good, but unfortunately I was not impressed.  When they say giardiniera, they basically mean "a shitload of bell peppers".  This pizza had WAY TOO MANY toppings on it.  The crust was super thin and could not hold all these toppings.  Even after scraping off about 75% of the veggies, it still wasn't that easy to eat.  The bacon was fine and the kale was just ok.  The mozzarella on this pizza was all wrong, too.  When it first came to the table, it looked like it was a ricotta almost....the cheese was real creamy and thin and almost looked like a white sauce instead of a cheese.  The crust was pretty plain too.  In my other review, I stated that the crust was flavorless.  Pretty much in the same boat this time too.  I LOVE pizza, and I only ate 3 slices of this pizza.  I gave the rest away to a guy down near the stadium.  I think/hope I just chose a bad pie.  My friend ordered the Salsiccia, and I ate a few slices of her pizza.  That one was much better and you could actually pick that one up and enjoy a slice the way it was intended to be enjoyed.  Service from our waitress was on point.  Every staff member I encountered was nice.  I do have one last beef though...and it comes from my first paragraph.  We chose to sit outside on the patio.  I DO NOT recommend that.  Reason?  FLIES!  It was disgusting.  We had our hand in constant motion shooing away flies.  There were a group of 5 flies that would just not leave our table.  It made our meal feel rushed and kind of dirty.  We should have probably asked to move inside....live and learn, right?  Next time, if there is a next time, I will definitely sit inside.    Overall, it was an ok dinner.  The price was right, the apps were great and the service was friendly.  The pizza was just average though and their crust is not my favorite. Those damn flies were really a buzzkill, too!  Will I be back?  I think I might give it one more chance to try out a different pizza or two during happy hour, but that might be it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The House- Bacon, kale, garlic, mozzarella and giardiniera.  Meh...not that good.
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cauliflower App-  Cauliflower and cheese..pretty tasty.  $5.00 at Happy Hour.
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fritto Misto-  Calamari and shrimp.  Great appetizer!  $5.00 at Happy Hour!

LY-ikoaGmHMyJo-uGdZvwg.text: We've been going here for years and it has always been TOP NOTCH!  I love the seasonal hand crafted drinks, wood fired pizza, amazing charcuterie boards (get the olives, totally worth it) and the complete opposite of a chain restaurant.  Service is personable and friendly...maybe that's why we go here at least once I month.  A gem of the valley!

8XlWIV-fh5hzhbEbi3Skgg.text: The Parlor not only has some of the best pizza in Phoenix but also sports a relaxing ambience and insanely good beer menu. As a craft beer enthusiast and pizza lover, I'm not sure there is another Phoenix restaurant that I am so pleased with.   Make sure to come during happy hour (I believe 3-6, Monday through Saturday) to get $2 off pints and discounts on pizza.

ZBUQNQt-AGc4eNPDEPl_kQ.text: Warm atmosphere and great facility. I have been here three times now. I am not a fan of their pizza. The wood fired oven is great but it does not really make their pizza great. The cocktails and service were good.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7AIYWg1OEtIecK1Zr9LFoQ.text: Exemplary service -- I ordered carry out and the guy on the phone went above and beyond and asked the manager to accept a dine-in only coupon because it was my first visit. Wish I had dined-in. The venue looked amazing. Once I got home, I got to enjoy their amazing pizza and tiramisu! Definitely will return. Thanks Parlor!

MrqNRwhJMfKLg8s27IcdGA.text: Great menu choices. It was difficult to decide what to get. Atmosphere is awesome. Staff was friendly. We got the fungi pizza with prosciutto and it was delicious! Good selection of beer and wine as well. I'd recommend for a nice family dinner that won't break the bank.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tiramisu!! Yummmmm.

y4Oi3Z_F4PEPLg-k7luBsQ.text: We have been coming here for over a year now, and the food always leaves us full and happy!!! We always walk in and leave with a smile! The food is amazing and the price for the food is great! The appetizers, course meals, and desserts are all unbelievably great! The waiters are very nice and attentive everything is great about this restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YNi_TLWHi27GjBT-1ZdROA.text: My favorite place to eat and I admit I am a picky eater. Great wine selection and fresh food !! Aric and his staff knows what they are doing !

Vh-mjPvqSP_1fTV5wIPCMw.text: If you want some of the best pizza, pasta and outdoor seating available in the Valley then check out The Parlor! I love enjoying their outdoor patio seating, especially during the great weather months - of which there are too few. Try the pepperoni pizza or the steak panzanella salad - both my favorites! The ambience is super chill and the wait staff are always friendly. The restaurant gets super busy on Friday nights and weekends dinners (rather commonly) so just keep that in mind as they only currently do reservations for larger parties.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Aged white cheddar burger - add bacon - with fries!!
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The BEST pepperoni pizza in Phoenix!!!!

Y5SD-WuWukoNCRHjHUdkRA.text: Just left a lovely lunch at The Parlor. I've heard from many that this is a must eat place in Phoenix. I had the Puttanesca pizza with the shrimp & calamari. I personally had the 8" pizza & it was a great meal for one. My favorite part of the pizza was the spicy tomato sauce. I would love to go back to try the seafood linguini & the duck club. So many great options. Only giving a 4-star because even on the slow end of lunch on a Friday our service seemed to be really spotty. But would definitely go back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The 8&#34; Puttanesca. Loved the spicy tomato sauce

Wwrk2M2Zbj4d9ep8vpziqw.text: I have always been a fan of The Parlor. Their Duck Club is one of the best sandwiches I've ever eaten, the beet salad is super tasty, and I've never been disappointed with any of their pasta. But, until a few weeks ago, I never really gave the pizza a chance. Dang, I've been missing out! Their pizza is so good! I was in Italy a couple of months ago, and this pizza is on par with the pizza in Italy. The crust is thin and crispy, and the toppings and sauces are stellar. I am generally just an extra cheese kind of gal, but my boyfriend ordered a pizza with pepperoni and mushrooms, and now I am hooked. The toppings are just so much better quality than I've had at any other pizza place. We will definitely be frequenting The Parlor from now on!

rik30e8N36UpDoIFPvAjAQ.text: Very good food and service. Try the bolognese pasta! Good salads, too. The only bad is limited parking...but they do have 2 parking spots for takeout.

jspEOdpGe4GqLI-1X5srJg.text: This place was a fun find near the Camelback Colonnade! Came here with coworkers on a weeknight so we were able to catch happy hour that goes until 6 pm on weekdays. From the outside, this place looks super tiny so I was a bit worried since they unfortunately don't take reservations, but it's actually much roomier inside once than it appears.  From the happy hour menu, we got $2 off white and red sangrias which brings down the price to $6 each. I enjoyed my red sangria very much. We also got the famous cauliflower gratinata (MUST TRY), and their 8 inch pizzas "the house" and "vine ripe margherita." The pizzas were good, though not my favorite, but for the happy hour price, I was happy with it. Next time, I will definitely opt for one of the pastas or the burgers.   For dessert, we got the tiramisu. This was soooooo good. If you check in for the first time on Yelp, you get 50% off one dessert so make sure you take advantage of this special!  Parking in the back was small but there's maybe 30+ spots. The customer service was excellent and I truly enjoyed my night here. Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

WZM1J4f9vf93A45GaDjlbQ.text: The fungi pizza was to die for. The staff was super friendly. It was crazy loud and people everywhere. This was around happy hour time. Next time I'll do takeout or early afternoon to avoid the chaos.

Cqvudzn8blz9_v_gdz9zgA.text: The Parlor!  Our food was absolutely delicious. My husband had the Duck BLT and was practically licking the plate. My grilled vegetable sandwich was amazing and their french fries hit the spot. The wine list is great and reasonably priced. My only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is the server and dessert. Our server (don't even know her name since she didn't offer it) seemed annoyed by us. During this particular dinner venture, we were actually well behaved so I'm not sure what her deal was. Also, the cheesecake was atrocious, cheesecake should not have dark edges and dark top.  But oh well on that. We'll go again but seek different/better service.

PR2zrPG-TOGsZ6rS865-Hg.text: After moving to a nearby community, my husband surprised me with a date night and "cheat meal" here. The ambiance was comfortable but modern and fresh. The service left nothing to be desired. The beer and wine selection offered plenty of variety. We ordered a house-special pasta with bacon in it and pizza for dinner; they knocked it out of the park. Pasta with bacon didn't sound appealing to me but it was really good. The pizza may be my favorite in Phoenix. We got chocolate cake for dessert but it was underwhelming and kind of dry. Their other dessert options looked good, so we'll try another option when we have another cheat day. If they offered a Keto crust, I'd be begging to go there every week.

TuBlNXfBMtP44IApudXJPA.text: This restaurant is so cute! It was pleasantly surprised when I friend of mine suggested it. I was able to try one of their pizzas which was delicious as well as a salad which was very fresh. I would recommend The Parlor to anyone who is looking for a trendy place to eat with great service and something to eat for everyone.

v6UPTkYuIlzjHRd1xftLYw.text: Amazing pizza!!!! Wood fired brick oven. One of the best pizzas in phoenix. Easily top 3.

3JloVE_j8U1DImphjoJvNA.text: Love this spot. The staff is AWESOME! Beautiful gardens grow as you walk in. Dynamite food! We love their salads and the cauliflower cheesy situation is on point. My favorite is the creative cocktails. Five stars for sure!

WahPfG2NC1PIwD_5r42Qmg.text: Ordered the tortelli piccata on postmates and received something I don't think you could even consider an appetizer for $16. Comes with 6-7 miniature dumplings and a few cherry tomatoes...I called the restaurant to ensure what I received was correct as I thought my delivery person ate my food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TihbXSH6X_lAMLNTZghw4Q.text: Postmate'd a pepperoni pizza and the parlor insalata. This was my first time ordering from The Parlor and the food was tasty.   I'm particular about pizza, with that said the crust was flavorful, as well as the sauce. The pizza was topped with house made mozzarella which was salty and creamy. The pepperoni had a lil kick and was crispy on the edges just how I like it. Not anything to dislike, it was all to the good!

IVL7SmiNzj1Jr9kWlckjQg.text: Great ambience, great food, and friendly staff. We came in to get a take-out spicy florentine. The staff were so friendly and helped us place our order. Our pizza was ready under 15 minutes.It was absolutely delicious! The pizza is pretty spicy, but I loved it as a vegetarian option with lots of ricotta cheese! My only slight criticism would be that the dough was paper thin toward the middle. I am used to thin pizza, but this was exceptionally thin. All in all great experience and we will be back for dining in for sure.

QSrA7FLlCBGuf0CC5M-89w.text: My friends recommended.  Place was busy at 11.30. . We were seated promptly and served water . They gave us their specials .. we ordered their salad with steak and a margarita  pizza. Then an order of chicken florentine soup . The soup was lukewarm and tasted just like  mushrooms.  The salad was very good but on the skimpy side.  The pizza was good but took 50 minutes.  Realizing the issue  they comp the pizza . Tomatoes on the pizza were cut into too large pieces.  Mixed feelings about the restaurant.  Not sure that I would try again

fX_TYTYVZIBAYEko_k_7Bg.text: Small but cute restaurant with a patio and bar. There's a bar top area with cool "salon" chairs where you can watch the chefs cook. Servers have always been friendly and prompt. All the pizzas are awesome. My favorite is the Margherita pizza but the Summer corn is unique and definitely worth the try! Spicy with red and green peppers, roasted corn, spicy crema, and cilantro. These pizzas are wood fired and so good I eat the crust. The house dill ranch is so good you could drink it. Great beer and wine selection. Had the modern times fruitlands and rose' gose. If you're a sour lover like me, get the rose' gose the perfect summer beer!

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

kaQjKfU3_rIJW7sYi8I8gg.text: Easy to find location, they do have two doors though, which was a little confusing since the street entrance brings you in through the dining room.   Ate alone and sat at the pizza bar, which was an excellent experience. I had checked other reviews and tried the cauliflower, which needed some more salt and felt the sauce was a bit runny. Overall a decent dish but wouldn't come just for this.   I had also ordered the sausage pizza, which was great. I didn't notice the daily specials board, otherwise I would have ordered some dishes off of there. Loved the crust on the pizza but felt there were too many toppings on the actual pie and weighed it down a bit. By the time you get half way done, the pizza is soggy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sausage pizza
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cauliflower
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pizza bar

KF7SAh3MH7rp5l0kRIa9jQ.text: Thought we might have to be put on a waiting list at 9 pm Saturday night, but thankfully they had an open table. The table was located on their patio which turned out to be a covered patio with heaters....very cozy indeed!  The waitress came to our table immediately to take our drink order. She was helpful in offering a sample of two wines we were interested in, which helped us make a decision.  We ordered the funghi pizza which was very delicious! The roasted mushrooms were so tasty, the crust was just the right thickness and the goat cheese gave it a delectable taste.  We weren't rushed and was able to have a very pleasant dinner.  Parking is a bit tricky at night, you have to pay attention to where the driveway is but once behind the restaurant there seems to be plenty of parking.  I'd love to return to try other items on the menu!

8unC3ucfPoZDc3mfz93TiQ.text: I'm obsessed with this restaurant. The pizzas and cocktails are delicious! We had a few pizza pies and pasta during our last visit. The spicy bbq pizza is the only bbq pizza I ever want to eat again. The bbq sauce was not overwhelming and sweet, it was almost melodious with the other toppings. We had another pizza with ricotta, it was some of the best ricotta I have ever had. I love that they have seasonal pizzas as well, some thing new and fresh always hits the spot. The cocktails are fun and refreshing. The old fashion was one of the smoothest I have ever had, I find myself comparing it to every old fashion I have had since.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Z2kLW8a-mNQLix1wo6Dmbg.text: Wow...where has this place been all my life? Or at least since I moved to Phoenix :) By far and away the best pie I've had in the Valley. At Yelp's suggestion, we tried out this joint with another couple and we all had a great experience. Our wait on a Friday night was only about 15 minutes and during the short interim, we hit up the bar for some drinks. After being seated, our very friendly server explained the specials and took our orders. Between the four of us, we ordered olives, Caesar salads, funghi, BBQ chicken and Yukon gold pizzas. Holy schmoly were they good. It is difficult to find crust like that and you can tell they have the right type of oven to make an amazing pie. The large pizza is plenty big for two people and the pizza my husband and I split (the funghi) was ahhhhhmazing. The flavors were bold, rich and oh so satisfying.   The quality of food at this restaurant warrants much higher prices than what they charge. Affordable+delicious+great service = a returning patron.

s_PN_NUr48wn6lQdQnL88g.text: Awesome beer selection, cool decor, helpful bartender good food. Came in for happy hour and they had some really good deals going on. Got this dish of cheesy cauliflower and it was GREAT. Got the pizza of the day and also really enjoyed that. I got a Odell Mountain Standard and they filled it to the brim! I want to go back and try more things on the menu!

W9iBhgRbdNaf7dVel3URSA.text: My boyfriend and I love to go out to eat in midtown.  Great vibe in a very cool building. All the food was amazing.  He had a custom pizza and i had the beet salad.  We split a cheese board and had a couple cocktails. The service was excellent.  We will be going back again soon.

6G30YAWDk2iUywmB4RSdUg.text: I jump at the chance to share a meal whenever I dine with a friend who is also willing to do so. It's not only fun but helps me control my portions and is way easier on the dinning budget. I usually ask the server if sharing a meal would also be filling enough to satisfy us and I usually emphasizes...we are starving!  Our server was eager to help us select our dishes.  The Parlor Insalata was a great starter and more than enough for us. It was a large bowl of Mixed Greens/Salami/Feta/Olives/Cucumber/Tomatoes/ Crispy Chickpeas /Red Onion and an Oregano Vinaigrette.  We went with the 12" Margherita, he wanted pepperoni added to his side of the pizza. He tried one slice without pepperoni and I tried one with. We both agreed all pepperoni next time. Washed it down with a couple beers.  Nom nom tasty.   We were both very pleased with our meals with 3 extra slices left over; I was gifted the take-away box.

Hq53rvOYasiNHedlAj4uAA.text: Great beer list with lots of microbrews. Pizza is to die for. Parking is a hassle. Service is excellent and the herb garden out front is a nice touch.

bguwmk2J29MsS6xK_QvEyQ.text: This is the second time we've been here and it was just as amazing as we remembered. The service was great and fast and the food was amazing! We got a meat and cheese board and the soup of the day which was a tomato bisque. The meat and cheese were absolutely fantastic and the soup was mouthwateringly delicious! The autunnale pizza was amazing as well! It was the perfect blend of sweet and salty! We are definitely coming back for more!

Mv0CmilTwxVaYDNA5NJnxw.text: Food was great! Atmosphere was nice along with our server! Will defiantly be coming back!!

TGfjGTz-GRCF9ah8Bq11aw.text: Best craft cocktails in Phoenix - yes.  Creative dishes full of local ingredients - yes.  Great pizza - yes.   To avoid the crowds on Friday night, visit on a Tuesday and take advantage of the bottle of wine and a pie special for $35. It's enough for two. But, if you're extra hungry, get a salad or the delicious cauliflower appetizer.   Sit in the bar area and let Michael make you the drink of his choice.

BpK92dlhpoWmEkrxgXr5PA.text: The food and atmosphere here have always been good. Fun spot with a cute patio. However the service has taken a MASSIVE turn for the worst. It takes a lot for me to write anything negative about service as a former bartender, understanding the wide variety of people and situations wait staff have to deal with daily. Besides being promptly seated, the rest of the service was terrible. The lady attending to us made it her duty to let us know how busy she was and that she really didn't have time to answer questions. She scowled the entire time at our table and made us feel like our mere presence was lowering the quality of her life.   When my friend asked for some olives before dinner they were never brought out. When our entrees arrived he asked if he might still have them and she brought 4 martini olives on a napkin, dropped them on his plate and walked away. We all laughed because it was just so ridiculous. When our pizza was dropped we noticed our utensils had been taken away with the salad and asked the expo for another fork to which he responded "I see enough forks for you to share on the table." We decided to share a fork because that's how rude the staff was.   Again, food and atmosphere is good, but the wait staff make the experience totally not worth the money. Would much rather go to Cibo, Pomo, or Federal than deal with this sort of service again.

OZyBC2Yb1T0tAOsN1J6F5A.text: I've been here about a dozen times... Staff is always on point. Food is always fantastic. They create a good atmosphere. We keep coming back. And there's something to be said about that.

QszK9DmkTFWGyUbmvuaJDg.text: I think I just had the best roasted beet salad of my life ... and who'da thought a pizza parlor, ahem, The Parlor, would have blown me away after a so-called fabulous dinner at a fancy new American restaurant in Houston during Yelp Eats? The Parlor, beet salads across America should bow down to thee.   In town for a Yelp Elite Event, the awesome Gabi K suggested this somewhat new (three months old) pizza place that's garnered such raving reviews on Yelp. Since we're both "dieting," she noted that they have a great selection of salads. I'm in!  The Parlor is a beauty and architecture and design fans will admire the simple clean lines, woodwork, and natural but modern essence of this former beauty "parlor" which it still holds True to if you look closely. A lot of the wood (bar and tables) and other pieces were reused from the former beauty salon and reworked into The Parlor. Way to stay Green! This bit of info was given to us by bartender Chris, and yes, Amber W is right. What a cutie. But more importantly, attentive and friendly.  When you walk in, you can choose to go left and sit at a dining table, or go right into the bar area, grab a seat there or at one of the high boys (which seats six). The bar area is where all the magic happened for us on this glorious day...  No one should miss out on the cauliflower appetizer. Forgive me if I get the details wrong, but all I can remember is a steaming hot plate of the healthy vegetable covered and swimming in an Alfredo-like, creamy cheese sauce and sprinkled with more cheese (Parmesan?) and baked to a slight crunch. It's served with toasted focaccia. Yumz.   And the roast beet salad ($9.50) that is *this* close to moving me over to the 602? Think large quarter cuts of orange heirloom beets (which I've never seen before), fennel, avocado chunks, onions and walnut-crusted goat cheese--a generous portion of goat cheese I must add. For $4 more, add the roasted chicken for a protein boost.  And The Parlor is more than just pizza, salads, sandwiches and friggin' good apps. I was also happy to find a cheese and meat menu. With a bottle of red, this would be a perfect date! (And in cooler weather, you can sit out on the patio and snuggle up to the fire pit with your sweetie. Til then, stay inside!)

xcIvHTPdKSX2VmWDdbEnvg.text: AWESOME! First time visitor and was not disappointed at all!!  I love it when older buildings are re-purposed. This mid-century modern building used to be a beauty parlor - and is now a pizza parlor! Of course they have other offerings in addition to pizza, but I love how they've kept the 'parlor' theme alive. Anyway, I digress. It was a beautiful evening so we sat outside. I kind of wished we had sat inside because the atmosphere looked great - that and we had a very loud man sitting next to us which was a bit distracting. But I digress.  We started off with the roasted beet salad which was very yummy. I was expecting red beets, but during this visit, they were golden beets. No matter - delish all the same. Practically licked the plate - now that would've been embarrassing! Although the pizza offerings looked good, we created our own. Fresh tomatoes, garlic, sausage, basil, spinach...and it was downright good!  Our server recommended the Paraiso Pinot Noir and she was spot on.    We are anxious to return and try one of the pasta dishes...and more of the Pinot Noir. Great place - and the complimentary valet parking is a bonus.

qHKqAACH5cWWgSTKxO1MkQ.text: My wife and I really enjoy coming to The Parlor. We really like the ambiance and the pizza is delicious. They have a good bar menu and we've never had to wait too long for a table. My favorite is the Yukon Gold pizza - highly recommended! As far as drinks go, my wife raves about the St. James.

Et5gBPX-lC-UM_7yBJBLeA.text: Had a great lunch here yesterday.  Just the simple meat and cheese board, but the best we've ever had!  To top it off, the bartender made an old fashioned in an ice ball that you crack with a little hammer to drink.  So creative. Great food, great service.  We'll be back!

KDZgE-KnTgTmnbiCYtujxQ.text: Pour me a glass and bake me a pie, cuz I'm gonna be here for a while.  Though humble and almost unnoticeable on the outside, Parlour has a beautiful interior with great acoustics. Lots of bustling ambient noise to make you feel like you're part of a scene but spaced out enough that you don't have to listen to your neighbor's conversation. Relaxed enough that you can stay a while as well. They've done a terrific job with the design and decor, which contibutes to it's "chill" factor.  The food has always been excellent. Even without cheese, these pizzas are stellar. Anything with those roasted wild mushrooms piled on top is worth ordering. They once had a vegan appetizer special that was to die for and I've been waiting for it's reappearance. The wine and cocktails are very enjoyable - and I'm not a cocktail person. These bartenders know what they're doing.   That last star didn't quite make the cut because of the spotty service. Not terrible service, just somewhat inattentive and aloof, though I'm starting to think that's a trend in hip Phoenix restaurants. Overall, I love it here. For the price and the atmosphere, it's a terrific place to spend a few hours chatting up a storm.

YP4ppkMHu5ERiICt26JKOg.text: Amazing food! Beet salad was wonderful ($10.50), pizza ($16 and big enough for three of us to share) and pasta ($31 again big enough for three of us to share) were incredible. We had to wait a little bit but without us even complaining the manager gave us a free dessert! Friendly service. We would definitely come back here.

H5S_PW1pt8rOiH_YAJxb6A.text: In this day and age of many pizza concepts around the valley sometimes it's tough to figure out which one you actually want to visit. For me it really has to be a complete package for me to sit down and spend my hard earned money. In my years of package peeking I think I've become quite the expert and can quickly sum up if it's worth exploring or not.  One part of this package is coifed, bobbed, styled and blown; Salon de Venus was making women beautiful for 58 years in the same location on Camelback and 19th Street.  The star shaped bricks along Camelback are unmistakably Phoenix and remind me of being a wee package peeker growing up in the valley. The new owners Dan and son Aric Mei deserve so much credit for preserving the wall and repurposing many of the items used in the old salon space. Every time we turn around there is something being ripped and bulldozed over to make way for the new with no respect to the old, hats off to them for their thoughtful redesign. What has been done to the new space is simply amazing. The sheer volume and proportion of the main dining room while open, has a sense of coziness and interest with the use of wood and other recycled materials. You can tell that the building is special and well thought out with so many details you can discover something different on each visit.   Since the space is so well designed and inspired, what about the menu? Created by two local chefs, Jared Porter and Jerry Alday, the duo has seemed to have created a delectable menu based on their own experiences using fresh local and seasonal ingredients. There is definitely a sense of this commitment walking up the path to the entrance. They have many of their own herbs, vegetables and citrus growing right there in planter boxes. I even noticed several eggplants growing which I hope to be lucky enough to try on an upcoming visit. While the menu is pizza centric, there is also a varietal of sandwiches, salads and pasta. For the kid-set there is a section just for the younglings to choose from. Aside from Mac and Cheese, this part also includes a B.L.T. for the more sophisticated baby-foodie, how cool is that?  Looking at a great package I like to allow myself to enjoy other more subtle parts of the package, in this case the balls. Arancini ($8) which are big and satisfying balls of creamy risotto, deep fried then served on a bed of pomodoro sauce. These are some of the tastiest balls I've had in ages and are a must when ordering. Having a similar impact is the Cauliflower Gratinata ($7) that uses cauliflower mixed with aged white cheddar cheese and topped with breadcrumbs then roasted. Basically a cauliflower au gratin, it's a delight to scrape some of the baked cheese off the side of the dish and spread onto a slice of grilled bread. For something a little bit different, the Eggplant Cannelloni ($8) uses slices of tender eggplant in place of pasta. The slices are still stuffed with cheese and served on top of Parlors wonderful pomodoro sauce sans the heaviness usually associated with pasta dishes.   On the lighter side, salads are done very well and almost all come in 2 sizes depending on your appetite. On one visit Parlor was actually offering a salad special that was composed of shaved cabbage, Queen Creek Olives, sliced cucumber, cherry tomatoes and cubes of fresh avocado with a refreshingly addictive oregano vinaigrette ($9.50). In a similar preparation, the on menu Parlor Insalata ($6.50) showcases some of the freshest veggies with the addition of crispy chickpeas and salami which both add a heartier dimension to this robust salad.   While the heat coming from the wood-burning oven couldn't be felt, you can imagine the waves of sultry wind as your face closes in on the best part of the package.  Coming in at 8" and 12" sizes, you can have it a few different ways, your way or the chef's way. Though why limit yourself to just 8" when you can have 12", right? The 12" is plenty to share between 2 diners with decent appetites since the crust is light and thin. The wood burning oven and the chefs do a great job of combining the perfect yin and yang of slight char and crispy golden perfection, Parlor has some seriously great crust! Yukon Gold Potato ($10/$14) is so simply built its near perfect. Roasted potato, gorgonzola cheese, leeks and pancetta has that sort of down home accessibility you might actually finish a whole one by yourself.   Desserts are treated with much thought here but are kept simple and satisfying. Seasonal Fruit Skillet ($7.50) was much like a fruit crisp that mom would make. Made with the tastiest fruit then topped with a layer of pastry and baked until just right, was only made better with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.  Taking my time with each bite, savoring the quality and preparation, it's the smaller moments in life that can be so memorable. So when you get a chance go ahead, take a peek at that package, you'll never know what you might find unless you look.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cabbage Salad Special
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chocolate Cake
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fruit Crisp just like mom made!

trfFLH83oFZ-XN2SbzpLBg.text: We've gone to this restaurant a number of times and always have a terrific experience.  We are always seated right away, with water brought almost immediately.  The service is great, with the servers at the ready to answer any questions.  Another thing about every server we've had here is that they keep their eyes on the table and notice right away if we're motioning for their help.  Very attentive service, to say the least.  This last time, I had my usual, which is a Funghi Pizza:  Roasted Mushrooms/Goat Cheese/Truffle Oil and Chives.  Crispy and delicious as is always the case.  My husband had the Spicy Barbecue Chicken Pizza:  House Made Barbecue Sauce/Provolone/Cilantro/Grilled Scallions/Serrano Chilies.  We shared both pizzas and both were very good.  The crust is so good and is thin and crispy.  I must mention that their salads are delicious as well.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

RiqnrgqO1Asle_Rv7UtLjg.text: Well, I really can't comment on the food as we were never served. Waited at the front for ten minutes while the hostess sat a group of eight. She was obviously flustered and when she came back to the front desk did not even acknowledge us. This place must do really good business to be able to completely ignore potential customers.

IzWZIc5fvkr7CQBBcbcqQA.text: After a long roadtrip through the desert, my boyfriend and I stopped here at the recommendation of a friend.  We we really hungry, and decided to give this place a shot.  I highly recommend the meat and cheese plate to start.  We got to choose the items off of a small menu; we decided on  speck, calibrese salami, fenugreek gouda, bratta, and roasted olives.  This anti-pasti was excellent!  Not only were the meat and cheese selections delicious and unique, it came with warm, fragrant flatbread, savory pesto, and sweet pepper compote.  Very filling.  Shortly afterwards, we received our entrees.  I ordered the mushroom ravioli, while the boyfriend got the venison sausage pasta dish.  The in-house made mushroom ravioli was perfectly balanced and savory, with great texture because of the minced chesnut and goat cheese filling.  It sat atop a cheesy bechamel sauce with a watercress garnish.  So good.  The bf wasn't all too impressed with the venison sausage pasta dish, mainly because they broke the sausage into bits, and burned the crap out of it, only to sprinkle it with some breadcrumbs over the handmade pasta.   The portions and prices were just right.  The decor is modern, hip, and cozy.  All in all a good place to eat.

8_ym6K_-0LXYXNUrQp-RaA.text: all their pizzas are unique and tasty!  lots of photo ops inside a former hair salon place!

mggecIqSuPR6CXx26TtV8w.text: Honestly this place is over rated. It has a atmosphere but the pizza is not a good as everyone says it it. The pizza looks cool, and have cool options to choose from, but the pizza it self is just OKAY. I might go back if I get invited but I would not suggest this place.

gNi0UU3El0FLRdfUilvx_A.text: Loved this place! The cauliflower appetizer is delish and the pizza was very good. Our waiter knew the menu including the specials like the back of his hand and made lots of suggestions. Very friendly! Maybe a bit expensive, but I didn't mind as we had such a good experience and our food and service was excellent!

3FQgR4QWdRBiNMyfHT2xhg.text: Had lunch here with a co-worker today and really liked it.  Good atmosphere and we didn't have to wait for a table but wasn't dead either.  Had the Funghi pizza which was amazing.  The crust was awesome.  Had the Cesar salad but we both agreed that the dressing was very bland and there wasn't much of it. Lots of menu items that I still want to try and would definitely reccomend.

gSBx555tqXAp_jf2C3jAJw.text: The dinner club selection for August was The Parlor.  Since Im writing this review many months removed from our outing, Ill spare everyone the specifics and just say, we loved this spot. Our second highest rated DC spot in over 1 year of Dinner Club (at 2 restaurants per month, thats quite a few).   While we will all admit The Parlor isnt perfect (the potatoes on the pizza were undecooked for example) its strengths far outshine the problems. The cheese plate was fantastic, the pesto was fresh and perfect. The pizzas were scrumptious, and the ambiance was fantastic.  We all cant wait to go back....  PS - we have it from a good source that the burgers here are even better than the pizza.

GRo_H4tkqkSCQH3AQdvKoQ.text: Tried this place last weekend.  Good italian food.  Fresh and tasty.  Had a pizza and some fresh pasta.  The octopus was also very good.  Service was a little slow but they were very very busy--so overall it was a good experience and I will go back

524xEHM3rX89n2MAnofLoQ.text: Love love love this place!!!  From the decor to the delicious utilization of local food, this is a place that I highly recommend to everyone!  The Funghi pizza is heaven.  Goat cheese, mushrooms and truffle oil!? Yes!  We often come here for a full meal, but there have been more than a few times of coming just for the chocolate cake.  The owner comes into my job a lot and I asked him what was up with the chocolatey delight.  Apparently they spent three months working on the menu. Time well spent sir:)  We have tried a wide variety of their menu items and haven't been disappointed once.  Great wine at competitive prices, tasty house cocktails and a really fun use of space.  They even have a cute little garden outside.  Oh, and free valet!

-o_pf97VtzJf8AOrWejLXw.text: I love the parlor - it's my new favorite place!!!    I love the mid-century modern decor and love the fact that it has really honed in on what it wants to do (instead of trying to do too many things at once) - with a small menu focused on freshness.  I have been there now 4 times in the past month.    For appetizers I've tried their: Cauliflower (a cheesy, perfectly cooked gratin of sorts, very simple and AMAZING!!!), Calamari (Good), and these fried risotto (I think) balls on a bed of marinara sauce - crunchy and hot on the outside and oozing with cheesy goodness in the middle - AMAZING!!!    The only salad I had (which was a special) was a Herb/Goat Cheese/Melon Salad that was again, AMAZING!!!  I even tried to re-create it at home.  It had watermelon, cantalope, honeydew and  cucumber along with a bunch of fresh herbs (including mint), goat cheese crumbles and slivered almonds in a light watermelon vinegrette.  I know, it sounds a little strange, but was light, summery and absolutely wonderful.  It's a shame it's only a special.....  Regarding pizza: I have tried the Sausage pizza (excellent - with a great spicey sausage - very simple, but delicious), the Ricotta/Arugula pizza (I forget their name for it - but it is really good - I've ordered it twice).  They also have special pizzas and the last time I went there (for my own surprise birthday party) my best friend ordered their special Peach pizza.  I know it sounds weird but it was AMAZING!!!!!  I need to go back when they have it again - white cheese (no tomato sauce) with thin slices of fresh peaches and their wonderful charred crust - it was wonderful......  As for their sandwiches, I've tasted the chicken salad sandwich - really good if you love chicken salad.  With great fries, too!!  Haven't tried any of their desserts but I heard the tiramisu is amazing.....  One negative thing I will say is the service needs improvement (hence the 4 out of 5 stars).  You have about a 50/50 chance of having a good service experience.  My brother and I went there and had a horrible server - my brother even wrote the manager to complain (which meant it was pretty bad).  The guy was good at the actual service part - refilling our drinks, etc., but his attitude SUCKED!!  It's like he was blaming us for the fact that he had to be at this crappy job with these crappy people, etc. (or at least that's what it felt like).  And another time, while the service itself was just okay, our girl didn't seem to know a whole lot about the menu, etc.   But, I've gone there twice and got excellent, friendly service.  So, hopefully they'll work on it.  The food will keep me going back.....   LOVE IT!!!

ScITej-FmPuJTwPKoBkFMA.text: This place has the best pizza in town. The corn pizza is amazing, it's my favorite thing on the menu but it is seasonal so if you see it be sure to order it!! I have never ordered an item that I didn't love. Also has a great patio and super cool vibe inside.

_id56KiCoDLG-4_ClIh_fg.text: When it comes to higher end quality pizza and pasta in town this is up there on my list. It's mainly getting 4 stars for food quality and lack of wait time. Unlike other well known pizzerias, my wait was just about 2 minutes. Of course if I had opted to eat inside it would have been a bit longer but not by much. I chose the patio, completely shaded and equip with misters I didn't mind not being in the air conditioning.  After looking at the menu for a good while, I decided to build my own pizza, choosing the wild mushrooms, locally made sausage, garlic and spinach. Just having the option to personalize your pizza is nice. The crust is done well and not soggy. I also ordered up their house salad which comes dressed (while good in hind sight I would ask for it on the side) and especially loved the garbanzo bean garnish, such tasty morsels along with several other fresh ingredients.  The worst thing about The Parlor is the parking. They offer a complementary Valet but it still ends up being a mess as these guys run all over trying to move and park cars while other people are also trying to find parking, which is limited.

_DjagqZ0qAgGBTpgQH3F_A.text: great food...great pizza. this place is also kind of a mixologist gem in central phoenix. these folks make killer cocktails...cab it. they also will modify things like the apps to help staying gluten-free

iSqzbFNRaoHpVT6Wt9lfqg.text: I decided to give Parlor a shot for a mid-day rendezvous with my boyfriend and was pleasantly surprised.     It was noon, the parking lot was full, but we were sat at a booth immediately.   The atmosphere was similar to that of the Vig Uptown, modern but inviting.  I had the Fungi pizza (Assorted Mushrooms, Goat cheese and truffle oil), it was fantastic!  My BF had an Italian sandwich called the Grinder, it was essentially Italian meats and cheeses with giardiniera.   He thoroughly enjoyed it... I'm a vegetarian so I didn't try it.  We also started with some grilled olives from the Queen Creek Olive Mill; they were very tasty and only $2, perfect snack while we waited on our meals.   Definitely give this place a try, it's nothing fancy but a great spot for a casual date or meet up with friends.

LF6aUpdc2KUkbk4Y9SOKsA.text: I have been here a few times for lunch and have had nothing but good things to say about this place. The ambiance and service are outstanding, they have a diverse menu and a good location. Everything i have orderd here has been great but a few things stand out. The salcissa pizza is delicious as well as the duck club. I still have to get out here for dinner one night to try the pasta a sample a few draft beers out of the impressive selection the offer here.

1TQ7FCZoIt_Dy3OVMxFEVw.text: Wow this place was awesome.  We ordered three different pizzas and all were great. but the classic pepperoni beat out them all by just a hair. The salad was amazing. Will definitely go back!

q-NUFTq1nAScWt7ZkoEBJg.text: We went there one week ago, the place was packed, I'm sure because they just received an award from Food Network. We didn't wait too much, after 20 min we had our table. We order procciuto and asiago cheese as appetizers, they come with some bread and some dip, it was good. For dinner we ordered the pizza w/ sausage and sage I don't remember the name, it was pretty good. The food came quick, the staff was friendly. Highly recommended.

3mm-Dmz3NKTD4KHxNYYqyg.text: We went here today for a "last day of internship" lunch for one of the girls at work.  The atmosphere is really great and it's really easy to carry conversations.  Two of us ordered salads and two ordered pizzas.  Everything was delicious!!  If I could give a separate 5 star review specifically for the Roasted Banana Zeppole I totally would.  Definitely treat yourself !

DcPzFvBeVRfeZiGrSzdItQ.text: Just got back from our first visit to the Parlor.  We were celebrating my 4-year-old's birthday - what better way to celebrate than to introduce him to blue cheese, calamari, and cheesecake all in one night?!  He already knew exactly what he wanted to order, and our sweet waitress was super accommodating and offered to put in his order right away.  She clearly knows how to keep kids and parents happy.    We were surprised by the quality and quantity of the children's spaghetti with meat sauce.  It was fantastic and my son gobbled it up.  Soon after, our order of calamari and rock shrimp arrived.  The grilled lemon was a great addition, and the accompanying sauce was delicious!  Our entrees were the Yukon Gold pizza, sausage/radicchio pizza, and the evening's pasta special: Spring Pea ravioli with a garlic cream sauce and pancetta. Oh MY.  Husband nearly inhaled the sausage pizza, and the one slice I managed to steal from him was full of flavor.  It had sage and a very slight drizzle of balsamic - a great compliment to the other flavors of the pizza.  The Potato/Blue cheese/Pancetta pizza was also good, but not quite as spectacular as the first one.  We were thrilled with the ravioli.  It was light, bright, and spring-y - YUM!  My Mother-in-law couldn't get enough of the sauce, and used her pizza crust to sop up the remainder... no drop was wasted!  We ended with pistachio gelato and the cheesecake with pistachio crust and macerated strawberries on top.  The cheesecake was good and tasted homemade.  I liked the berries and the addition of balsamic.  I was not a huge fan of the pistachio crust however, especially after crunching down on a piece of shell.  All-in-all, the visit was a huge success.  The remodeled interior is lovely, and the inside-outside patio is beautiful.  Our service was spot on, and we really felt welcome (even with a 4-year-old in tow!).  The visit was topped off by our waitress bringing out dessert with a candle in it - obviously having heard our conversation about the boy's bday.  It was a really sweet touch.  We'll be back!!

eaVEx4z_7Vxf2__zH3__HQ.text: The parlor has good pizza and you know what you get is always consistant. Service is friendly and the patio has a nice feel to it. We like the specialty drinks in the bar area

pB_ScGQ543xewL-m3Y9ABw.text: Great food but the bartender Michael sucks! Totally rude!

gzHhv2rxIyhhHgsCUbiwww.text: Wish we lived a little closer...Really like this place.  Because of the design of the building you can't hear all the traffic out on Camelback, which just adds to the ambiance.  I think it's really neat their herb garden is on premise as well.  My fav is the grilled veggie sandwich with the pesto spread.  This is also a great place to lunch with a friend and split one of their pizzas and a salad.  The service is good too.  It's a little loud and some of their items are a little pricey, but the food always tastes fresh.  Way cool that they kept the old barber chairs and pictures of the building back in the day.  Definitely need to check this place out!

VS_8vG5kliY8kf9ZOn9DDw.text: Every time we dine at the Parlor or introduce family to this fine establishment we are so pleased. They are consistently serving delicious pizza (Yukon Gold is our favorite) and drinks. We have tried many of their seasonal salads and appetizers! Always delicious.

wNjoERpbbjmYdBW-mjo6Kw.text: I love this restaurant! There's such a great neighborhood feel and atmosphere throughout. The menu choices are plentiful with tons of options under each category. I love that you can order the pasta for 2 and share. Also the pizzas have a great amount and layout of the toppings and the crust taste so fresh and is perfectly cooked.   It was nice they were running the $20 additional to $100 special at Christmas. I love places that give back to their guests ! I can't wait to go back and try and sandwich if I can ever say no to pasta.   Recommending the classic Bolognese pasta (i get it with spaghetti noodles) and the pizza with fig and prosciutto...name's slipping me right now. I died over their watermelon salad all summer, can't wait to see it again next season. Service has always been up to par each time I've dined.   Thanks The Parlor for being a great go to!

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. :)  Thr best !

QESmE6JW2M-PaCqiGbTVCA.text: Great pizza, pasta, salads. Mellow vibe. Awesome service. Seems like a local gen, but I'm new to the neighborhood. Will definitely return. Try the seasonal corn pizza with bacon.

1uNMHDZCyfyjCJR5o-uz0A.text: The Duck sandwich is wonderful.  The fries are crispy and flavorful. I finished every last one!  Staff are nice and friendly.

RrD6fUtDBtxUprUyUo5eoQ.text: Great customer service! We ordered pizza not realizing that all build-your-own pizzas come with cheese standard (which we don't eat)...however, they were apologetic of the error--although the fault was our own--and they remade both our personal pizzas! Will definitely return Delicious and so customer focused!

OZUK4Lllc24__ChlrUBBZQ.text: Service was amazing.  Server had great recommendations for beer and dessert.  My mom was thrilled with the pizza selection.

dDs02Cd2Uo1tF_N8hOpRwQ.text: We found this place on Yelp while vacationing in Phoenix and man were the reviews "spot on".  We tried the cauliflower, spicy chicken pizza and the presto spaghetti .  They we all off the hook!

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fUEKaR0a-h2uy6wfwibGGQ.text: Love this spot! GF and I got an 8" pizza, only $7.50 but the best part was the cavatelli porchetta. All pastas made in house. Will be back!

b1tYwYP272JWPv-2NDNdrA.text: The pizza is amazing! Salads are great too. Highly recommend their homemade ranch dressing with fresh herbs from the garden. Cute place too. It would be 5 stars if their service was better...but the servers seem to have an attitude. Drinks and pasta are just ok, but the pizza and salad are all you need here.

vbWnVmYCFMT1yWp58TIqmg.text: I met the owner. He is an amazing guy... the place has amazing food and incredible service! 100% need to try this place

EtQ4tZcUDqZM-_HhrVnZxA.text: Delicious concept. Fresh, clean dishes with amazing taste. Loved the cauliflower starter, and found my funghi pizza so yummy! The ahi salad was flavorful, but definitely on the spicy side. Don't discount their label of a Chile vinaigrette as a mild side sauce. It has a kick! They have a great wine list and an atmosphere which is wonderful for a good date night or a fun time out with some friends.  The menu left me wanting to try more. I will find an opportunity to come back and do so!

YPrM9tjuRzznDZhdtN340w.text: Top 3 must have pizza in Phoenix. Fun and friendly staff. Food is amazing. I always get he fritto misto ( fried calamari) and you Must try funghi pizza

cD5qR-yXNDIx-cQWVfHV9w.text: Oh man. The food was insanely good. I've eaten here twice and both times I have been blown away. Holanda was our server this time and she did a phenomenal job. It's always such a treat to go somewhere and have mind blowing food and service. I would put this restaurant in my top three in AZ.

edI48-Jr6_If6pmdFr925A.text: It was called the "Puttanesca". Translate that from Italian into English and you'll come up with "whore's style". She may be a whore, but this whore has got good taste.  Rock shrimp, calamari, capers, olives, fennel, spicy tomato sauce on a really good thin crust doesn't sound much like a working girl's version of a pizza to me, but I will be hard pressed to order something else when I come back.   I would be kicked out of the club if they hear that I approved of cheese with seafood, so don't tell anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. the Puttanesca to go

BpV-pss9f9cDTrNlPehM4Q.text: Great atmosphere and easy parking due to the valet. Woodfired pizzas are the best and there are lots of options here with lots of wonderful appetizers and drinks too. If you're looking for pizza in the Biltmore corridor area The Parlor is the place to go!

rmC-yKa4bP_NsVrHvvsDHQ.text: So i've been multiple times now. I wanted to really like this place because so many people do! The pizza is mediocre, at best. With pizza like Pizzeria Bianco, Nook, and much more, I think they are decent, but surely not the best option in the area.    My biggest concern is their service. I seriously can't remember who this guy was but I have had him twice. He is just sarcastic and has an attitude that I can't even understand how a server like him has a job. I worked in the service industry for years and couldn't imagine being as full of myself as this guy. I hate to throw people under the bus like that but it's just unfortunate when you go to a place and expect to at least have a good server and then you put up with a dude like him.  Either way, I am not sure if they have also stopped serving The Alcatraz but this was the only saving grace for me and I've asked for it once and got it. The lady told us that they always serve it on weekends in the evenings and then the guy who was our server the next two times who is listed above, told us that they "don't do that anymore". It was delicious and if this is True, I'm not sure I'd ever come back if it is gone.   I'm wishing I could give a better rating but unfortunately, I've been let down.

WRZCyjpnj9i0t8xuZmkR-A.text: This is special: In addition to the usual yumminess, there is a new dish for the summer! It is a ravioli with lamb and it is so delicious. You must, try this fantastic dish!   Thanks for making last Saturday so frigging special and as usual, the staff was delightful and helpful.

7C6Yqw6Wu9o1EQ6M1imE-w.text: 2nd time here.  Had a house salad and my spouse had a Caesar.  The regular size is huge. Built our own pizza which was delicious. Great service at the bar.

3oI2DtF4Afkya73hfjB0gw.text: We tried this place out on a Saturday night during Happy Hour.....received really amazing service (and that is hard to come by nowadays).  We ordered the Cauliflower app as recommended by our server.  It was good but not great.  The pizzas, however, were delicious!  We had a BBQ chicken, pepperoni and sausage (can't remember the name but according to our waitress it was voted the 5th best pizza in the country?!).  They were all very good.  Happy hour prices are awesome on drinks and food!  Will definitely go back.  Highly recommend.

GiSoPMHtJ5KbDFrtusa40w.text: We've been here on several occasions knowing that we'll receive great service as well as some delicious, fresh food without breaking the bank! On this particular evening we were lucky enough to get the server Ryan who was not only extremely personable but also well beyond knowledgeable with some great suggestions! The hubby & I always appreciates a great server that is really passionate about his job. After we decided on our choice for our bottle of wine we chose to start with a small sampling of some meat & cheese which the salami & prosciutto was so so fresh, also the pesto sauce was very delish my fave! For my entree I chose the small portion of the freshly made pasta with the perfectly cooked seafood that had just a hint of spice, the dish was perfectly prepared that melted in the mouth. My hubby chose the ricotta cavattelli with the slow roasted pork cooked in a pesto with a touch a spice, can you just say OMG. To finish our meal I couldn't leave without having their to die for moist chocolate cake that's so light, with a berry reduction & some freshly made whipped cream. To go with it we had some limoncello that's also you guessed it, freshly made topped with some Prosecco. What a great evening with our awesome server Ryan & some fantastic food, definitely one of our fave spots for some simple yet freshly made food that never never fails us!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The board always leaves us speechless, burrata spreads like a soft butter &amp; the meat is fresh every time!
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nice wine selection, all is very reasonably priced.
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The to die for moist chocolate cake with a berry reduction &amp; to wash it down some limoncello, yum yum!!

UdI4sz06aby5t3sA4biZUQ.text: Ok so after driving past this place a zillion times, my girlfriend and I went for lunch here before a much needed mani/pedi. The place has a modern look that includes a lot of the original "hair parlor" pieces. I guess the host stand is even made from old wood recycyled from the o.g. buliding. Anyway......we ordered the Parlor Insalata and it was great. It has crispy chickpeas and the smaller size was more than enough for the two of us to eat and have extra. We also ordered a pizza with a mix of toppings and it was great. They would not do a half and half and my friend had to pick some things off so that was the only not so fab part of the food. Service was good. I am def going back in the near future.

EbxFU3QoLRHPKoR2HXOvqw.text: I love the food and atmosphere of the parlor!  The servers are really friendly and provide great service even when they are busy.  I had the pesto pasta which was really tasty and the budino for dessert which was delicious.  My only complaint is that I think the drink prices are a bit on the high side compared to other similar restaurants in central Phoenix.

BT7tTQwBGn1wIUhMIoH0ug.text: Yum. Most times, I've been able to get a spot to park and sit fairly easily. The food is excellent. Sometimes it is a little too loud for my liking. #Phoenix

CyARgyArDP9u4IbXsuU64Q.text: The parlor was a fun, energetic atmosphere and a great simple pizza with a salad. The waitress was really attentive and pleasant so I would give this place 4 stars.

GjiQb9gryIb5iZttmGj70w.text: Closed on Sundays.  FYI.  So.....never been there.  I dont know about you, but I like to eat pizza and watch football on Sundays so WTF would they be closed?  Who goes out ot eat on Sundays?  Me.  Who likes pizza on Sunday? Me.  Who is closed on Sunday? Parlor.  I wish there was a star rating for "not sure".  Im not going to be like some people who give 1 star when they dont like one little thing about a place, so I will give it 3 figuring nobody will make a decision to go there or not go there based upon a ranking of 3/5.  I will be happy to update this review when I make a successful visit to The Parlor.

LV50ouXEhmZQuK-VTikvNg.text: The Funghi pizza (with mushrooms and goat cheese) is outstanding.  The warm olives are also great to snack on while waiting for your pizza.  The buffalo chicken pizza was a bit underwhelming, but the Funghi and the other pizzas provide plenty of other strong options.  PBR's available at a good price.

mKNmFVZlq8F_ibb4uLUX1A.text: This place is just ok.  It was raved about to me before I went there so I had high expectations.   Likes: really fresh ingredients (they picks herbs from their own garden for your pizza), great atmosphere, we had a good server- My pizza came out wrong and he was amazing about making up for it.  He brought us a complimentary dessert and took $6 off which was awesome.  He didn't have to go that far- I'm pretty understanding on mistakes but I'm glad he did. Dislikes: serious lack of cheese on the pizzas- I'm a cheese lover though, I tried the pesto pizza and the BBQ pizza and both really lacked flavor in the sauces.  The BBQ was more like ketchup- I would not consider it ketchup.  Some of the server's outfits were shocking.  One of the girls was wearing a hot pink bandana-ganster style and wearing neon hightop sneakers with cut off shorts- I love hip hop more than most but The Parlor is not the place for it. It was just ok I probably won't return unless it were a group thing.  There's better pizza places.

sBq38WFbk8aUuciCufJ1vg.text: We gave Pizzeria Bianco the old college try since we were visiting from New York, but seriously - nothing can be good enough for a 2.5 hour wait.  Next on our list as a backup was The Parlor.   I'm so glad it was.  We tried three varieties of pizza, all were great.  The atmosphere was fun and the beers were flowing.  We had the arancini appetizer (fried rice balls with cheese in the middle) and some tiramisu for dessert.  Everything was excellent.    I will definitely return the next time I'm in Phoenix.

1uj79B5JhK8PtC8UZJN44A.text: blanket statement- i've done a lot of things for really good food-waiting in line, traveling, bribing maitre'ds... but I'm not waiting 4 hours for just pretty good pizza.   I've been watching the parlor go up for a while, intrigued by the construction, but hadn't gotten there to eat yet. SO happy we did- cancel your plans for bianco. this is better.   First, the service was so attentive, which was wonderful. We loved the space, which was mostly reclaimed from the original building, as we were told. Its warm, and cozy, and perfect.   We did the smart thing, asking our waitress what to order, and based on her suggestions, split the beet salad and funghi pizza.   Best. beet. salad. ever.  Better then even delux, which was previously my fav. Same for the pizza. You know how artisinial pizza so often falls flat on the crust? I don't want cracker like crust, and I don't want limp dough.   The parlor's pizza dough is perfect. Thin, but doughy and bubbly, baked to a golden perfection. Our pizza featured these fabulous wild mushrooms- it was covered in them, they had great bite and taste. Goat cheese and truffle oil made the flavor mellow and lovely.   The rest was such a success, we couldn't resist dessert- tiramisu. It was scrumptious.   Can't recommend the place enough. I'll be back.

p6acRkR-a1k2UBaCstFStQ.text: This place is just a Meh in my book. The mixed drink selection is amazing, and better than the food, in my opinion. The food is good, but the portions are tiny (and I'm not a big eater), and the wait for a table, even during the week, can be frustratingly long. Not the best pizza in town, but not terrible either.

nUXE-J7DrlY0WfIuqqlO7w.text: Great beer on tap. Delicious pizza, appetizers, and food. Small parking lot so you usually valet at peak hours.

1zpXYb1L9nLRK5Wfu7ch2A.text: I have enjoyed the Parlor for quite some time now, and I can't believe that i have not written a review yet.  We have always received great service and food here.  My two favorite pizzas are the Salsiccia sausage, featuring Schreiner's local sausage,  and the bbq chicken pizza.  They've also always got a seasonal risotto on menu, which is always cooked PERFECTLY, which is a good sign that someone in the kitchen is on the ball.  Go to the Parlor.  Enjoy.

580Rdgk8piuqxDi5Ok5gYA.text: this was such a nice place to go, First date idea or anniversary haha... the food is so good, the atmosphere is exquisite, the drinks and the service so good. is a must go here in Phoenix.

oI4I97_i4TA4hnF69GsEKA.text: Nice place for lunch with a friend or with a small group for dinner, been here many times for both.  Great salads!  Expect to stay a while and relax.  Have not had anything from the menu that was less than expected.  Good service.  Decent prices.

DrD08dQPayhbP_nN982w2A.text: I have eaten here a few times.  The ambiance is wonderful for a pizza place and the restaurant has become a staple of Biltmore residents.  Calamari is good...not a fan of the tiny shrimp included in the basket I would rather pay double and be served larger shrimp...but the preparation is solid.  Fungi pizza with truffle oil is very good...I wish they would offer actual truffle shavings...just a suggestion.

B7bVmJXS-iTDRY_32JxFNg.text: You know you're in for something a little different and special if you walk past an herb garden on your way into a restaurant. The parlor has said herb garden outside and a very cool vibe on the side.. We sat in the bar because the cafe part was packed with a mid-week lunch time crowd. I wouldn't call this place a pizza parlor even tho the thin crusted wood oven smoked plate of heaven that my lunch partner ate was some of the best he said he's had in this valley...Me on a diet as usual opted for the roasted beet salad, I would have like to have seen a little more flavor coxed out of those baby beets but all in all it was a great light refreshing lunch. OK so I'm off the diet and can't wait to go back!!

xM8isvPhTXy-c925SoDVyw.text: went for drinks after dinner.  TRES COOL place.  love what they did with the place.  drinks were great, service was too.  the dessert was ok.  will be back to try the pizza on mashed drinks, they looked and smelled relaly good..

SXkAVrnpI6CU4Mxbrul-cg.text: A creative look at gourmet pizzas.  The menu is creative and the fact that you can build your own with 20+ possible toppings makes the possibilities endless.  The cheese and meat plate makes a great starter, and the decor is sleek and fresh that draws a cool hip crowd.

EVZ1JzLRwSBLEwsyca80hg.text: AMAZING!!! Discovered this place couple months ago and loved it! Just got back from my second dining experience here, and the feeling is still the same. LOVE the Agnello, Fungi and Pesto pizza - very decently priced. BUT, all good things come to those who wait.. hence the long wait times to get a table. As long as you don't mind waiting for 30 minutes to get a table for dinner, it's totally worth it.

fG7-bGxNnkmJKGEjFpX6Ng.text: I finally made it out to this cute place. It was a wonderful meal and a great atmosphere. They were pretty busy so the service was a little slow, but i am not one to let that get in the way of a good review. The waiter was very friendly and offered a lot of information about the menu. We had the margherita pizza with was pretty good. However the cauliflower gratinata was an AMAZING appetizer. I have never tasted anything like it. I loved it and highly recommend it. We also got the Risoto which had a summer corn in it. It was incredible. Very flavorful. For desert we had the tiramisu and it was delicious as well. All in all it was very affordable. There were also some seriously good looking people working and eating there. I will be going again soon!

OttEzbwLMsACdMS8jY8pog.text: Love the salad more than anything here!! Amazing!!! Pizza is great too but I keep going back because I crave that salad!!!

N-5bPRzoWKQmMVNBctuR9Q.text: Awesome pizza. The basil is always a nice touch on the pepperoni. Cool cocktail drinks. Perfect mild/low lighting for a date atmosphere.

3cqFUSS_t-Qm5W6SqvyhlA.text: This place is my latest favorite in Phoenix.  Great food and great service.  Everything was fresh and delicious.   Loved the beet salad and the pizza.  The banana trifle was amazing.

ERt0qaGmGFhDxZ6JN76sxA.text: Really cool spot for a casual Friday night date. They have primarily pizza, sandwiches and pasta. The wine list is pretty extensive and diverse. It was refreshing to not just see California wines on the list. The waiter was awesome and helped to pick out some apps for us.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

BIMsV5cELUi7SQw1vEsiZg.text: The parlor is our perfect date spot and favorite place for gathering with friends! Their bar area is great for parties (I think we had 30 people) and it's also cozy enough dates! Great ambiance! Their fungi (foon-gee) pizza is MY FAVORITE PIZZA EVER and their mixed drinks are always changing and always surprisingly delicious!! Their garden mojito is the best mojito I've ever had!! HIGHLY recommend this place!!!!

joI7A1XYbFYMfcoxUuNhHg.text: We love this place! Such a convenient location in close proximity to our apartment complex and various shopping locations. Pizza was delicious! And the staff were all really friendly and helpful. Our waiter took the time to explain each item on the chefs board menu to ensure we got what we wanted.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

DWAB6aPsNClSqCK9xPMdyw.text: Great pizza options and plenty of vegetarian options. You can choose from the menu or create your own pizza too. Great wine selections and atmosphere is perfect for any vibe.

0xR16gtZQsIFNWViiPG15w.text: This is one of my favorite places for happy hour! You can't beat 8" pizzas for $8 with a glass of wine that's $2 off! Not only is the food excellent but the ambiance is extremely relaxing with great service! Definitely not my last time here! Cheers to the Parlor!

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

V9X2-m9NqvPS_8iLHnrNGw.text: This pizza was incredible! Also, it's strange but this place has the BEST garlic parm fries I have ever had.   We came in with a party of 20 out-of-state visitors (a hard task when places aren't reservation-friendly) but the staff was extremely helpful and made our experience great. Special thanks to Brent for his incredible service - nothing was incorrect for a party of 20+ all on separate checks (business deductions amirite). If I'm ever back in Phoenix, I will for sure come back!

5HcWPQAoene-uTkanvxl5Q.text: We've been coming here for years and it still remains as one of our favorite pizza restaurants. We like to sit up at the bar because the bartenders are always friendly and attentive. They have a great happy hour menu so it's a great spot to hang out for yummy food and drinks. Our fav pizzas are the Calabrian or Salsiccia and the farm greens is a great choice for a salad.

yX0ZW-aRejnXaqiWUoMFVQ.text: The fungi pizza is my favorite pizza I've ever had. I brought my family here and they were just as pleased. They have some great happy hour deals if you go at the right time.

OfzpXRIpaWSyYI9PcI0qQg.text: I like this hiding gem love the mushroom pizza, great deal for Two on Monday and Tuesday nights the pasta bowl with wine for $35 is awesome

iWYL6BKnzOYlCpbqi21ODw.text: This place was Amazing for Happy Hour...so I can only assume the same for the rest of the Menu!  I started w an Old Fashioned and ended with one for Dessert   Roasted Cauliflower  it is a Must!  In a Creamy/Dreamy Sauce that you just want to lick right up !  I did the Make your Own Pizza with Pesto for the Sauce, Goat Cheese, Grilled Calamari, and Calabrian Chiles...I would highly recommend that recreation to anyone looking to venture off Menu!!!  Servers and Bartenders were very attentive and food came out quickly for a busy Bar/lounge area!
