JlBf50UC9ckqchCEDpvJMQ.text: Everything is so delicious. The pesto pasta is my favorite and the mozzarella appetizer is amazing!!

iBdE7M2YyRsT_r0Hc4jIXQ.text: Best pizza I've had since I moved to Phoenix. Variety was incredible and the Margerita pizza was my favorite. Service was excellent and the strawberry blond lager was amazing!

4INx93zy9SE--haQ0_8TZw.text: The Parlor's pizza was amazing the one time that I ate there.  Would recommend the arugula/fig/goat cheese pizza but I don't see it on the menu anymore.  Will definitely dine there again.

6NHpTMbMWOg6AhSVF5MvyA.text: Heck I'll give a 5.  Can't really fault the Parlor on anything.  There pizzas are pretty darn good.  I did just go with the basics though, pepperoni pizza a salad and a couple of cold beers.  I prefer IPAs and they had about 4 or 5 on tap.  It seemed like they had a good crowd at happy hour so I wasn't the only one who liked it.

9VgXANYtUz4keZhOhc4ubA.text: Since recently moving into the Downtown/Central Phoenix area, my boyfriend and I have been trying new restaurants every chance we get. There are so many great places around here, but I felt like we hadn't been anywhere super impressive until we came to The Parlor :)   A friend of a friend had recommended this spot as one of their favorites, and I'm so glad we took that advice, as we don't choose Italian/pizza restaurants as often as others. For an appetizer, we ordered the Fritto Misto (crispy calamari & shrimp), and it was delicious. Perfectly cooked, and a great portion size as well. We also ordered the Pepperoni pizza for dinner, and it was one of the best pizzas I've had in forever! Huge pepperonis, and yummy chunks of mozzarella all over (I wish I had photos but I was trying to play it cool lol).  In addition to the food I thought the atmosphere was great, The Parlor is a very pretty restaurant! We sat on the patio and I loved it. Our waiter was great as well, he even brought me a sample of a beer he thought I would like when the one I asked for turned out to be no longer available. My one piece of advice would maybe be to skip the drinks all together, though - I thought the food was well priced, but drinks were very expensive so we could have cut our bill in half by just sticking to food!

wexRmNu3Ch67a6IPzN2XMw.text: Every time we visit Phoenix we make it a point to eat here. The pepperoni pizza is AMAZING!!!! Don't be discouraged if there is a wait, just grab a drink at the bar to help pass the time because this place is worth the wait!

jkv1WYCaXoIV31oz_UdUGw.text: I've been coming to The Parlor for years and it never disappoints! This last time I had the cavatelli porchetta.. so good. I'd order it again. The only eh part of the evening was our waitress... she lacked personality and wasn't very attentive. That being said, it didn't ruin our evening and I'd certainly come back again.

OT1E6JbdrSL3U9r3Aux2sw.text: I have been back to The Parlor a few times since my last review, and, I must say, it is pretty flippin fantastic. I LOVE the make your own pizza sheets and I LOVE that you get basil and other fresh herbs at no charge...that is how it should be. The perfect pizza (for me) is basil, garlic, bacon, goat cheese, roasted veg, and arugula. Ohhhh yesss! So wonderful. Just thinking about it right now makes me want to go there immediately. The best part is you can make a small pizza just for yourself and don't have to share with anyone AND it is big enough to have leftovers the next day.... love the leftovers. I think of all the pizza places in Phoenix right now, this may be my absolute favorite....I mean....this place is terrible.....please don't go here so I don't have to wait in line :-D

V_7xXMzfBUIOrjhxN_oFcw.text: My husband and I LOVE the pizza. He went with the mushroom & ricotta pizza and I went with the build-your-own. For dessert we ordered the tiramisu, it had a pine nut brittle. FANTASTIC. We can't wait to go back.  Our waitresses personality was a little lackluster, but the food more than made up for it.

gt4kJWMZFfDLmrC2HAeEKA.text: Amazing pizza, drinks and salad. Very affordable. And high quality ingredients. Our pizza was super fresh. And the drinks were strong. Highly recommended.

0uPpgjwC3g9zhV1Cd2_NZQ.text: Love this place! My favorite salad is the insalata. They have great pizza, drinks, and atmosphere. Love the design and never disappointed  I go. Always busy but worth waiting if needed.

L-iwDoSQs3THpRohh832sA.text: I guess I am lucky with the places I'm being invited to because The Parlor was a nice place.     My party received great service from our server.  Food was hot. Drinks were cold. The server was knowledgeable about the menu and could make recommendations. I was satisfied.   However, you are gluten free...you get to eat salad while you friends eat pizza that smells and looks WONDERFUL.  So brace yourself.

4jy-D0KsHPZWrsGT8uS8MQ.text: It's a nice atmosphere -- refreshing and welcoming but also casual. It's the kind of place for a meal out with friends or low pressure date. Service is friendly and mostly attentive although a bit infrequent (checked on us when we didn't need anything, but when we did was nowhere to be found).  Good wine selection. I got a Bordeaux that wasn't too heavy but with a nice coating in the mouth-feel and paired well. The pizza, though, isn't anything that special for an "artisinal" spot, and I get the feeling -- with the soft atmosphere and vibe -- that the place thinks it has better pizza than what it actually does. It's not bad. I got the Margherita pizza, and it was pretty good. It's light and mild but a bit bland, especially the crust. I was expecting a little bit better given that it purports to have the house "homemade mozzarella."  Can we talk about the weird mandatory valet parking? What? Valet for this casual pizza place? I can understand parking getting to be an issue, particularly on weekend nights, but when I tried to park in a lot full of spots on a Tuesday night was told I needed to use the valet service. It gave me a bitter experience heading in. Valet is only needed on peak nights, not ordinary weeknights.

00qZ4BUngfrI-qJfoyAYtw.text: 1 small sized salad with grilled chicken added, nothing to drink, 1 slice of bland chocolate cake? $22. Think about that. 1 small salad and slice of cake $22. Thats before the tip, which was $5 ( she was very nice, no issues at all with service or the place). It isnt just here. Prices to eat out have become outrageous and shouldnt be blindly accepted. Its why I rarely choose it over cooking anymore.

3EyhrlQojDk5RN7_qOZ3ag.text: Julie was my server and was so wonderful! She helped me decide on a pizza and I was not disappointed. I loved the spicy barbecue chicken pizza. The sauce was delicious and the chilies on there were a great touch. It was only $7 for an 8" during happy hour. I ended it with a tiramisu and it was heavenly.   Great environment - I cannot wait to return to try more items on the menu!

136D7UgUmgieyFHKY-T2kQ.text: Best vine and pizza in town!! Don't get me started about their meat and cheese board!! Delish!

IUZgi4zplnYdF-hCA7nqbA.text: I love the parlor!  Everything was perfect.  Well there was one thing wrong.  Before I left for the restaurant I got in a huge fight with my girlfriend.  She says  that there really are aliens.  I say that aliens are here but we cant tell what they really look like.  I got so mad at her also because she took sooo long to get to the car.  She has a broken leg but thats no excuse.  Oh and the air is pissing me off right now.  I hope everyone that reads this sures up there beliefs in aliens and goes and has a pizza and a beer.

3_Qdf-NqpAbBBtZOtQyBrA.text: OHHHHHHH, Parlor. How every second of every day I yearn for thee. The duck club is something of a dream. The pizzas, they deserve not too be described by a self absorbed heathen as I, with such a poor vocabulary. For these cheesed breads are actually compasses disguised as pizzas that point to the gods, old and new! Salads, with their beautiful greens and the fullest flavors. Topped with salami cut from divine swine, but be careful of the chickpeas! When you consume those chickpeas you will never live the same, life will become bland if you do not strive to cook better in your own abode. If you are a man who does not drink booze, then I am most apologetic because you will never know what it's like to suck the froth of a Parlor Star right out of your mustache! Then, Lovage, a test of grit for any True Arizonan! Fear not though, it is a delectable, delicate balance of salty, sweet, and spicy! Cauliflower gratinata, cauliflower gratinata, I do not need to explain one of those most popular dishes to you.  If I had to pick one of each to be my favorite. App: Cauliflower gartinata Salad: Parlor salad Pizza: Calabrian Sandwich: Duck club Try it all with a meat and cheese board.  RIP summer of 2013 and your the ribs on a bed of green beans.

YUXM_EV_gDXgVMAaAKAoxw.text: Went in with a few friends the other night.  Our server was nice but I wish he had been a little more enthusiastic when we asked what his favorites were on the menu.  The bruschetta was the best thing we had and we had four courses.  The food was good, don't get me wrong.  My issue was not with the flavor of the dishes (the toppings and seasonings were great) but more so the foundation of the food.  The crust of the two pizzas we had and the texture of the two pastas.  Just was expecting a little bit more of an approach that would set them apart.  Although dessert definitely satisfied my sweet tooth.  Overall I think this place would be great for happy hour and some girl talk and plan to do so again.  The patio is inviting and the ambiance is vibrant.  However, if you are looking for authenticity in the Italian dishes offered, I'd recommend they work on getting back to the basics.

M3sufs63biyHLqs9_4blxA.text: I've been going here for years, it has a casual atmosphere with the food quality of a 5 star restaurant!

p04p7xaAZhcjMG1znUmX9A.text: The Parlor has easily become one of my favorite pizza places to visit in the valley.   Pros: As mentioned by other fellow reviewers, the ambience is just perfect - a great place to bring a date! With all hype about the Funghi pizza, I knew I had to try it out myself. If you're a mushroom lover, this pizza is perfect you. The goat cheese and truffle oil perfectly balance the sweetly seasoned mushrooms.   If you're a meat lover, I'd also recommend the Salsiccia. The flavors blended together so nicely, and the sausages had just the right amount of sweet vs. savory. Also, the fact that our waitress was super nice and helpful was a definite plus.  Cons: I don't have much to complain about here. We did try the Tiramisu for dessert, and though it was decent, I don't think I would order it again. The pizzas were the highlight of the meal.  Overall, you should definitely give this place a try! I had a very enjoyable experience here.

OicxVuG8qXSs1n2afHznGQ.text: We went there last week. Food is in fact really good, but service not even close!  We ordered appetizers, salad and main course.  Well, they brought everything all at once and dumped on our table! There was no room on the table, as a result, and they had to take our water glasses off the table. I call that a poor and unprofessional service. I've been there before though, and theydid not have this problem. So, I think it was incompetency of our server (which by the way took no measure to correct the problem or anything, just said she was sorry!). So, it was probably an isolated incident. I will try them again.

el_QZSPu0K0QykxGBOf9jQ.text: WOW!  Going to make this short...  This place is awesome because...  1.  The pizzas are truly gourmet BUT you can get other five star dishes that have nothing to do with pizza as well (superb cheese/meat plates, duck over quinoa, wild fish etc.)  2.  Even though this place is called "The Parlor" and a pizza place automatically comes to mind, the atmosphere is nothing like a "pizza place" - very nice bar, dining area and garden patio.  I'm not a big pizza fan but this is the best pizza I have had AND their other signature dishes (that have nothing to do with pizza) are excellent.  Great wine list too!

-ljFx27y5Kv3daVb-aL5uQ.text: This Italian Parlor is pretty good. I like to get the Alfredo Pasta and it is always pretty. They have good desserts and good service. I would recommend getting a reservation and getting there early because the parking is very small and it gets pretty busy early. I do recommend it though!

AFODBBykHzilFR5a8bjRcw.text: The Duck Club is better than the pizza!  Everything I have ever gotten here was good - cauliflower, risotto, pesto pizza, make your own pizza etc.  Attentive staff and great happy hour prices.  The only down side is the parking which is limited to about 8 parking spaces so you'll need to use the valet..

d3zT39i4T0xcGJ6DGPrtNw.text: I went in for my boyfriends bday dinner last night and had the worst experience! We were quoted 30 minutes for a table which turned into an hour of waiting. When we were seated, our waitress didn't even say hello, or asked if we wanted any drinks/appetizers. She just dropped off water and left to go make coffee for 15 minutes. We got our drinks 20 minutes after sitting down. When we ordered appetizers, which included a $35 cheese board that wasn't very good, it took another half hour for that. We ordered our food which we didn't get for almost 2 hours after sitting down. Since we waited an hour to be seated in the first place, we were already starving. Since we waited so long the waitress brought out flatbread to tide us over until we received our dinner entrees. Then, come to find out the flat bread wasn't complimentary like she said it was. We asked to speak to the manager which at this point, my boyfriend walked out because he was so outraged by their customer service. The manager (short blond hair) came over to our table and immediately got defensive and told us (the customers) that we were wrong. She also told us "we don't do bread service here, so I paid for your flat bread out of my own pocket". The manager then proceeded to call a member of my group, conniving which instantly pissed us off even more than we already were. I explained that customers are always right no matter what and that once we leave she can talk as much crap as they want. I couldn't believe how rude and hostile the manager was towards us. I have never experienced such horrible customer service in my entire life! Also, the food was only mediocre....I wouldn't recommend this restaurant if my life depended on it.

AwWnLmTjIws8TKzeHG0p-Q.text: This place gets packed and for good reason. Great crowd, great menu, and the food is outstanding. They're known for their pizzas, so we went ahead and ordered the first one on the menu - the roasted corn. A little birdie told us to order it special with bacon and blue cheese, and holy crap that isht was GOOD!  Our bartender Tony was also really cool and, despite the place being crazy busy, he was great about letting us taste some of the wines before selecting which ones we wanted. I suspect it might've been because my friend is super hot and was feature dancing while we were in town, but hey, I'm not complaining!  Seriously though, It's the kind of place I'd love to come back to and try the rest of the menu. If for some strange reason I ever end up back in Phoenix, I'll definitely be back at The Parlor.

reN3VoCNt23RXMiCDaTx0Q.text: This place has been our go-to for a few years. Food is consistently fresh, tasty and filling. The best part is the happy hour menu. The staff is always spot on with service.   Cleanliness abounds, including the bathroom.   Cold beer, tasty personal pizzas, fresh local veggies for garden board and homemade tiramisu with a twist of pinon brittle.   Overall you get good food, historic atmosphere and wallet friendly prices. What else can you ask for?

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wine at The Parlor.

mlBFVuPuOG1uRmm0IIHf7g.text: Great service! Great food.  Would not have guessed but once you get inside such a great experience and ambiance.  I would recommend.

7aRckXoDxCRGAnRK4F5cFw.text: I have two new favorites, the cauliflower app and the pepperoni pizza (add ricotta). YUM!   Service and quality continue to be outstanding. Monday's they have amazing specials on pasta/wine or pizza/beer combinations.

DYGpXgaJzCA2bOTiiG8UuQ.text: I know this place calls itself a pizzeria, but you're doing yourself a disservice if you don't try all the other amazing dishes here. Their pasta is unique and incredible and their salads would sway any meat-loving redneck. You can tell that ingredients are of the utmost importance to these guys and they clearly focus on quality over quantity... which makes their price points that much more amazing. I think this is one of the best affordable meals in the city. And if that's not enough I'd put their by-the-glass wine list and cocktails as the absolute best in the city.  Go. Here. Now.

q3rEQFIZ9D_U7jErO5Hzxw.text: First off, great service. Our server was very knowledgable in menu items and drinks. She made great suggestions. Her name is Rebecca and you should request her!   Also, I'd suggest the St. James drink and the Pesto pasta. Delicious recommendations suggested by our server.   Excellent service and and all around great experience. I'll definitely be returning.   A must stop!

2r4AfpmKYqiPpHu2T_o0cQ.text: Our waiter was the sweetest kid, gave us recommendations on pizza. Got our order in and our food out right away. Guys, let me tell you, this pizza is fantastic. The crust is perfect - thin but sturdy enough to hold the sauce and toppings. The sauce, cheese and toppings were delicious and definitely did not taste like your neighborhood pizza- I'm Not knockin them, pizza is always good :) the crust was thicker than the rest and was perfect! I literally cleared my 8 inch pizza by myself in no less than 15 minutes ( I stopped to breathe, drink water, and have a conversation with my friend so I didn't appear rude) otherwise pizza would have been gone in 5. Definitely going back to this spot!!

ZoJB8LJ-JfPUWrsKI26XXA.text: Stopped by here a few times and I always enjoy it. I stick to pizza here and wine. The pizza is good and the ambiance is great! I love their outdoor patio. Great place to go for date night!

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fritto misto

oTzMNJzN1uDMBePr4DN_8w.text: I went here with my family and was quite not sure what to expect.  My aunt told me about the history behind it, and how they grow their own herbs, and how it was once a beauty shop... so I was kind of excited.   We had a party of 9 so I expected a wait, but an hour and a half is extreme in any circumstance (especially when you're quoted 30 minutes) Apparently they had another large part of 16 who  continued to order round after round of after dinner drinks. That's cool, no need to blame the restaurant, I was excited to give them a fair shot.   First things first, call me old, but this place was LOUD.  The music was about 2 notches above comfortable which caused the drunken party next door to scream, which meant a majority of my family was just silent.   I ordered a glass of Pinot, and I could tell he finished a bottle, and opened another, and mixed them both in my glass. I could take the stale mixed with the fresh. I was disappointed. Also, there was some cork in it. Talk about bad form. They waitress told me it was my imagination. 0_0  My husband ordered the Duck Club, and I ordered the Pesto Pasta (I'm sure they had fancy names, but I did not commit them to memory)   I will hand it to The Parlor, the duck was amazing. (In fact, One of my stars is based completely on the duck!)  Truly spectacular sandwich. The pasta was nothing special. In fact, I was a bit disappointed in the pesto.   The barber Chairs, and vintage photographs were interesting... but the experience felt very... forced. Like they were resting on their Hipster reputation to carry them along.   I might give them one more shot, maybe during lunch when it's quieter, and order the duck myself.

T3Iakpis3AnZWYm--udh9g.text: If I was giving a rating on the Auntanell pizza, it would be a 5 star.  Honestly, their pizza is not like any others in town.  I've had a lot of pizza in town, definitely different and worth it!  They also have, for me, one really good beer on tap.  The others don't strike my fancy.  I like the outdoor seating personally.  Overall, a nice ambiance.  Happy hour is 3-6 so that is the time to go, beer and pizza reduced price.  Service is good, not over the top good but good.

06JvCW880WC1JrqkfYP8uA.text: Absolutely delicious! The sausage they use is some of the best I have ever had on a pizza and the make it in house. They have a variety of creative pizzas but I am stickler do my meat lovers style pizza but they have pizzas where the ingredients seem better in soup than on dough but it looks delicious! Must try if you are near the Biltmore area

jDgtdV9C5tSRLKuTd3Q7bA.text: This was our first stop once we reached Phoenix and it was amazing! The pizza and duck burger we got were delicious but what made this place even better was our bartender Brian! He not only was a great bartender but he went above and beyond to give us suggestions on where to go and where to eat in Arizona. He also helped us decide which ones not to go to. It's friendly places like that which make it worth it!

h-3PQT4F1yVgIYUdSn3MPQ.text: Yesterday was my second time here. Great and comfortable palce. We ordered pizza, pasta and salad that was so delicious.

wIiepHzQBtPGAuvDIUo0Uw.text: I haven't tried Pizzeria Bianco yet, so I can't compare yet.... so I was torn between that place and The Parlor Pizza...but ultimately I am very glad I chose this place! My boyfriend and I were celebrating our 1 year anniversary, and this place helped to complete a romantic and delicious date night for us. The food here is just superb. The service we received was great, and we got our free dessert with no problems through Yelp by checking-in.  We are pizza lovers so I highly recommend this place!  The ambiance,  the food, just everything...loved loved loved :) def goin back again

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious food!!

Q2bIlOaMEhdA3NsPRu83Yw.text: Yummmmmmmmmm. The Parlor's gourmet pizza menu is heavenly for the pizza lover in you... I'm specifically speaking in regards to their 8" Spicy BBQ Chicken Pizza with a side of ranch. Absolutely unique and delicious.   The restaurant was hip and trendy, but so is the area. A little too dark inside for me, but on a Friday night it's the perfect atmosphere for a first date.   Our waiter was on top of our refills and checking in on our needs-- but not in that annoying way most servers are. She had a good balance of taking our order, drinks, refills, checking in, and bringing our bill in a timely manner.  Oh! They have complimentary valet...  Which is nice, because their parking lot is small and a mess.

CPrggh6egEy2qkl2bjnx0Q.text: I don't know why, but the service was very sub-par. The food was excellent, but out server Joshua was unfortunately not very friendly towards me and a friend. We thought we were polite. He didn't introduce himself, didn't respond when we would say thank you. When he dropped off the bill he said nothing. Kinda pissed me off to be honest. We still tipped fairly, but not sure what his deal was. Also, get the cauliflower appetizer. Bomb.com.

1ObP587UWhgyGaS3ty4AhQ.text: From the moment I walk in to The Parlor, my love affair with this place begins. Love the atmosphere & decor.   A good friend and myself decided to stop in this evening for a lite dinner. This evening we enjoyed the Summer Corn Pizza and Heirloom Tomato Salads and made sure to save room for a shared dessert. Another great evening with a great friend & memorable conversation. Cheers***

0-gBtOlCq4QneXVnQovqNw.text: Pizzeria Delfina, Mozza, and The Parlor. All pretty amazing restaurants!!! 3 of Americas greatest spots for the tastiest pizzas I have ever had, and I live in the town of Pizzaria Bianco and Humble Pie. I have made thousands of pizzas so I feel qualified to say that The Pizzas I had tonight and other times at The Parlor are the very best!!! Not only are the pies amazing but the Creamy Cheesy Cauliflower, The Panzenalla Steak Salad and any of the Fresh house made Pastas are always spot on. Tonight I dined with my favorite out of town foodies, 2 of which have never been to The Parlor, and I must say that once again everything we ate, touched, drank or spoke to was perfect. I was informed Alice was on her first day of vacation and I must say she left the place in capable hands. The only draw back was half way home we had buyers remorse that we didn't order the Olive Oil Cake or Tiramisu. I hate to raise anyone's expectations this high but I always expect excellent and have always received it. This is still my favorite restaurant in the world.

cBxnO2dHC9BTZh2y_D7mBQ.text: Close to home.....great pizzas! The happy hour looks like the time show upThe dining area is separate from the bar so you could bring your kids but it'd be better for hanging with friends.

46u4b_Z4mp7BV5JF1vxMgA.text: Went to the Parlor, for my cheat meal. Had a delicious pizza - their fennel sausage is SO tasty and absolutely loved their cauliflower app and my favorite thing was the tiramisu... just an FYI, i am a tiramisu fiend, and when I find a good one- I rave about it. If you want fresh craft pizza, tiramisu that is on-point and an atmosphere that is unique- I highly recommend The Parlor.  They have a great Happy Hour with cocktail, wine, sangria and beer specials, along with food specials for small pizzas, appetizers ( like their yummy calamari).. but what I liked most is the story behind the place. Employees grow a lot of the seasonal herbs in their own gardens and the place itself is a reconstructed 50's hair salon ( if my memory serves correctly). I thought it was so cool that they reclaimed some of the original wood and created the tables and I loved that they put their background story on the tables. It's the little details that made my visit so nice. Keep it up!

X_KSHeKOb4C627A4K-1FdA.text: The margherita and pepperoni pizzas are the best. While I prefer red wines over white wines, I do enjoy Albarinos.  This is one of the few restaurants that carry La Cana.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Not as good as it looks.
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Caesar salad with steak
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sunday funday

hL06WQQ-GH8tILp4TK8UmQ.text: This is one of my normal hangouts on Friday night.  However, instead of sitting at the bar, I sit at the barber chair right next to the pizza fire pit.  Regarding the pizza, they have one of the best sausage fire pit pizza's in the valley.  They rival Pizzeria Bianco but its one of those nicer places which you should really eat the pizza with silverware instead of using the traditional hand method.  For this reason, it just doesn't feel right.  I normally order the steak panzanella with spicy pecans which is delicious.  The romesco sause, NY grilled streak, and greens is just a perfect fit.  Regarding the environment, its a nice place to relax after a long week at work.

6WYR0CzeaPdg_s9vaekrng.text: I LOVE this place... The pizza is awesome and the deserts are even better.  I would recommend the Turtle Budino which has: Dark Chocolate Pudding / Salted Caramel / Spicy Pecans / Pizelle Cookie  We celebrated my birthday there and they gave me a coupon/gc to come back.  Nice surprise.  Loved it!!!

0GxCkFjlnRwIAyfzyvQ3Eg.text: Great service as soon as you walked into the door, as well as when you leave. The decor was very cute, wooden beams and exposed steel, for those who like contemporary (me!). There were three of us, and we each got the soup special of the day (salmon chowder). I was skeptical, I like my salmon either smoked or sushi raw, but this was delicious! My the soup was served with a slice of foccacia bread.  We split the beet salad and the pesto pizza. The beet salad was refreshing. The only thing i would do differently is have the goat cheese ball (served on the side of the salad) warmed up. Nothing beats warm goat cheese! The pesto pizza was great as well! Had that nice brick-oven-taste to it (thin crust -not burnt, not too thin). This would be a great place for a 1st date luncheon, business lunch, etc!

IdfxiCH78-QW5ENGUjweIQ.text: If you know me you know I adore anything pizza.  Coming here was just another excuse to try another pizza place.  I was not disappointed at all.  They can put together some great tasting pizzas.  The autunalle is one my my favorites! Prosciutto, caramelized onion, sweet potato ricotta, fig jam, almond, arugula!  They also have your basic Margarita and pepperoni both are amazing as well.  If you come during lunch you'll be waiting a while to sit in the dining area.  I recommend grabbing a table by the bar area.  They are usually not occupied.

B2nGB7LPGG4U2GuGXLhnMg.text: The happy hour pepperoni pizza didn't blow me away.  It was a little too small and a little too oily, and I didn't care much for their crust.  Maybe my expectations were just too high?  Or is the happy hour reduced price pizza "lesser" than the full price one?  Service was quite good for our very large group.  Not having to valet at the time we arrived was a relief.  I'd be willing to give them another try if someone wanted to go here though.  Personally, though, I'll be sticking to Federal (drive-through pickup!)...or Bianco (on Camelback) or North (ugh, parking) if I am feeling fancy.

_asZKhtOh4rTUh1xRtgYjg.text: Living in walking distance to this place, I often overlook it when choosing a restaurant for dinner. Living in Phoenix it's easy to get caught up in the new restaurant hype and forget about the good standbys. Luckily for me, my sister was in town and asked to come here for dinner since is was 5pm on a Friday and neither of us wanted to sit in traffic just to try something else. When we got to the restaurant we were seated immediately which surprised us since it was happy hour on a Friday. The patio doors were open so even though we were sitting inside we were able to enjoy the beautiful spring weather outside.   We started off with a couple glasses of wine which were each $2 off for happy hour and the Fritto Misto which was $5 for happy hour. The wine was very good. They have a decent wine selection and it's not a terrible deal at $2 off.  The Fritto Misto was lacking in a little flavor but it wasn't bad. For dinner we ordered the happy hour pizzas which were $7.99 each. This is definitely the best deal for happy hour. You get a full sized pizza that is more than enough for one and almost big enough to split depending on your appetite. We ordered the Pesto Pizza, The Pepperoni Pizza, and the Cheese Pizza (for my son). They were all very good! And not just good for being happy hour. I had forgotten how well they make their pizzas! In fact I'm kicking myself for not going here more often.   The service was also excellent. Towards the end of our meal it was starting to get busier but the wait staff seemed to be keeping up with the demand. The restaurant is also very kid friendly. I noticed quite a few people had young children so if you're looking for a child friendly restaurant, I would definitely recommend The Parlor. I will definitely be back and look forward to trying more of their menu items.

AZuGvXo4uiUITcNnKrmyDw.text: every pie i have had here is fantastic, the butcher board has amazing options and the happy prices on appetizers are top-notch. plus i dont really eat desert most of the time but you should save room here!

SbUd1-9m-k6wOIBxD1PvlQ.text: I love this restaurant, it might be my second favorite Italian restaurant. The decor is elegant and they even have their own garden with fresh ingredients. We sat outside and it was beautiful and cozy. We ordered bruschetta, which was untraditional but delectable and our pizza had the most delicious crust. I would go here again in a heartbeat.

oXclHXrDRRGGK0QiM93_Mg.text: Had a great food experience. The wood fires pizzas were perfect .  We had the roasted Brussels sprouts and the cauliflower dish as appetizers.  Soooo good.  The sweet potato gnocchi with braised beef was the bomb.  Very inviting atmosphere and decor.   Highly recommend.

_TiE_KWsVu1MBRBsXEIgRQ.text: Delicious pizza! The price you get for a 8" or 12" pizza is great. love the pesto pizza

NAOUExPuFs0wWWFVqcxO2w.text: Came here for our anniversary this pass weekend. Lets just say it didn't live up to the hype. I was actually dumbfounded by the poor service. After being seated outside on the patio, it took a good ten mins to get our waitress(we had to ask for).   We started with the "soup of the day" (believe it was potato cube soup" and shared a 12' Salsiccia pizza - The food was beyond great! Nice thick crust.  To wash down the delicious pizza I order my favorite beer(kilt lifter) and she had a cucumber majito.   They have such a nice romantic patio dining area with a fireplace. Great place to bring someone you care about.   Note: in my books - Great Food and drinks don't make up for the poor service. Poor service for me kills restaurants.   KCYE

lpXbz5Il8A8gwbBBcYQW0g.text: I've been wanting to try the parlor for months and I finally got to on Friday for date night with my girlfriend.  I've heard so many good things about this place so I was expecting greatness, but worried I would be disappointed due to all the hype.  I was not disappointed.  I am going to rank The Parlor fourth on my favorite pizza places list in the Valley of the Sun, but I can see it possibly moving up a notch or two after more visits.  I'd like to give The Parlor 4.5 if I could.  I had a sausage pizza with garlic and basil.  My girlfriend had a pepperoni pizza with garlic and basil.  Both were outstanding.  The sauce was great and the cheddar and mozzarella mix was very nice.  Next time I think I'll get a pizza with pepperoni and sausage with garlic and basil.  Another nice thing, they don't charge for the fresh garlic and basil (or any other herbs), unlike some of my other favorite Phoenix pizza places.  The overall prices were very reasonable for a 12" pie.    I definitely plan on becoming a repeat customer of this fine establishment and it won't take me months to do so.

lTm7RbglAlzUJHjPTdlDgA.text: IF heaven came on a pizza crust, The Funghi pizza would be IT!  This is only my first visit, but I anticipate many more visits in my future-there are just too many yummy things on the menu.  I'm guessing that this 4 star review will get upped to 5 in short order (pun intended there)  Anyway, we went on a Thursday night right around 6:45 and the restaurant was a beehive of activity-but in a good, happy vibe kind of way.  As usual within a 5 mile radius of my house, there was no parking and the valet was the only option.  I'm getting used to this, but it still bugs me a teeny bit.  As you walk in, you walk by a raised  herb and vegetable garden that looks AMAZING.  Then you get inside, and the ambiance is somehow perfect.  Relaxing, yet modern is how I would describe it..  The patio seating is lovely, but this is one of those restaurants where there really isn't a bad seat in the building-there is even counter space at the kitchen so you can watch them cook.  So far, without tasting anything or going to inspect the bathrooms, it's looking like a 5 star experience.  It's SO nice in fact, that I start seriously worrying about my wallet and whether or not I can afford to eat here.  I found myself trying desperately to remember what 2 dollar signs means in actual money....  So the water and the menus came, and I got a lovely surprise.  An 8 inch specialty pizza for $10?  Great!  A house infused lemoncello for $6?  Good!    We ordered a margharita pizza, the funghi pizza, the bruschetta, some olives, and a couple of the lemoncellos (actually I had the grapefruit 'cello) for $44 plus tax and tip.  For the quality of the food, I actually think the prices are very reasonable.  The bruschetta tasted amazing.  It's embarrassing, but we were moaning and mumbling while eating it-luckily, the tables aren't crowded together and no one heard us.  The olives were local and rosemary infused, so no complaints there either. Then the pizzas came. OH. WOW.  'nuff said.  if visit 2 is as good as visit 1, this place is 6 star pizza nirvana.  I'll keep ya posted!

Te17pkxrPknQC2pNAVko4g.text: Awesome cocktails and food! Love the vibe and friendly staff. One of my fav neighborhood spots.

ZGABy610dInPV2-RlvbNPA.text: My friend and I went to lunch here on February 3, 2016. We were very happy with the food and the service. A shout out to Morgan who gave us excellent service and went out of her way to get me a sample of the "soup of the day".  We will definitely be back!

pezIyM3adAyYN13UOcq0sQ.text: Love the happy hour. Delicious pizza. Our waiter, Ryan, was one of the best (quite possible the best) waitstaff we have ever had. Knowledgeable. Had great suggestions for food and drink.

FXXUOt9SKel0I_mViHkZ9A.text: Modernized pizza and dining out spot...I am a fan of this place. The bar is crowded for the most part, but it's a good sign. I crave their wonderful selections of the pizzas...Most of the pizzas here have a fresh and clean tast - which is really good with their wines and cocktails selections. You can get in with a reasonable waiting time. I choose this over Pizzeria Bianco since it doesn't have the ridiculous waiting time - it's simple yet offering a great ambiant for dining experience. If you really like heart-warming and traditional pizzas, try Spinato's. Yummiest of all pizzas, by far.

_0WIZTvt5hcZ7aHkx4m4Cw.text: Such good food here!  Great happy hour food specials too!  Great chill but chic vibe and the servers are always great. Love The Parlor!

bKwGABilNSMRtMJ5o2UaOA.text: this place straight up rules.  it definitely possesses all the requirements i have for an awesome restaurant: a mile from my house, delicious cocktails, cool atmosphere, friendly staff, and amazing food!   this is an all around great place to take just about anyone.  seriously-take your parents, kids (if they aren't loud jerks), date, or friends-everyone will be happy with the selection.  i've eaten in the restaurant many times, but usually i opt to just sit at the bar and throw back some drinks and enjoy their meat and cheese plates.  they have an awesome selection of both so you really can't go wrong with whatever you choose.  their beet salad is also killer; it comes with walnut crusted goat cheese, avocado, and fennel-yum!  oh and check out their daily lemonchello!

YxmAA46zcqppq-14llvQLg.text: This place has such a cute atmosphere, we sat on the patio near the fireplace. The food was great! Ordered the calamari to start off with, excellent choice. For our entrees we ordered the Margherita and Salsiccia. I wanted to go for something different and both were delicious!! Id love to try their sea food pizza next time.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsiccia Pizza!
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margherita Pizza

y30dsQCc8qiUc5XYAn0jrA.text: A Wonderful Afternoon Happy Hour at The Parlor.  Happy HourZ a-z  If you are in the mood for Italian eats, then make your way to The Parlor for Happy Hour.  This restaurant has been in operation for a number of years.  Did you know this location originally housed a beauty parlor named Salon de Venus?  For that reason, as you might guess, the name evolved.  In addition, the atmosphere is friendly, warm and inviting.   Of course, the food is delicious.  The happy hour menu is limited, but the items are just right for an afternoon snack.  The Arancini was done just right, the Fritto Miso was excellent, and the pizza was really good.  Add in a glass of your favorite wine and you have found your Happy Place.  So if pizza, pasta or burgers are on your social hour list, give The Parlor a try.  One of our hobbies is trying out various Happy Hour venues in Scottsdale and Phoenix.  We then put them on our Happy Hour website to help others find Happy Hour venues in the area.  Check it out if looking for Happy Hour venues.  Find Your Happy Place!  Happy HourZ a-z.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kitchen Bar with Salon Chairs
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wine Display
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wine at Happy Hour

dfqtn4qvwkU_EmK6iCUxQA.text: Solid restaurant close to the airport in Phoenix.  It looks a lot sexier at night.  I came just as the sun was setting, but when I left in the dark, I was very impressed with the look and feel of the restaurant.  I came for a business meeting and although the restaurant was a tad bit loud, I didn't have to shout at the clients I was hosting for them to hear me which often happens at restaurants in the US.  Not being from the area, and basing my decision purely on Yelp reviews, my fellow yelpers didn't disappoint.  The server wasn't very knowledgeable on wines which was a tad bit disappointing, but was otherwise very accommodating and knowing we were in a meeting, was courteous and only interrupted at pivotal times to take our order, bring us our food, etc.  I was very appreciative of it.  The clients both ordered a pizza for themselves and did a pretty good job polishing off nearly the whole thing.  Between the two pizzas ordered, they only had 3 slices left.  I had a small plate spaghetti pesto pasta dish which was extremely flavorful and just the perfect amount for it's size.    Prices are completely reasonable as well.  Is it the number one pizza place in Phoenix?  I don't know.  I didn't actually try the pizza, but what I like is that they weren't the American standards of veggie, meat lovers, ham & pineapple, etc.  These were rustic pizzas with new ideas for toppings.  I'm not opposed to coming back and trying, but for now, Pizzeria Bianco in downtown Phoenix still has my heart.

YX-zHSO4qMH2jP1Md69xiA.text: This is a first for me. I am not rating this based just on my experience but on my group  I got a pizza here that was bad. The crust had no flavor to it, it was a bit over cooked, the sauce didn't have much flavor and the taste with all the toppings was very bland.  Not a good experience  Those with me seemed to really enjoy themselves and truly liked what they got. With myself I would have rated two stars but I increased it because everyone i was with might have rated 4.  So don't get the pizza.    The service was excellent.  They really did a nice job of taking care of us  But no

O7dMlmJOmDQBKmKxTBGiVQ.text: One of the best, if not the best pizza joints I've ever eaten at. Absolutely outstanding. We had a big party but it was worth the 45 minute wait since we all went to the bar for drinks waiting to be seated. Bartenders were extremely friendly. Our server was great and always checked on us. We started out with the meat platter which was outstanding! My daughter got her spaghetti immediately which I thought was such great customer service! Hungry kids should eat first! I had a small spicy bbq chicken pizza and it was bursting with so much flavor I couldn't wait for the next bite! And then the tiramisu for dessert...probably the best I've ever had!!! Sorry dad ;)

LeL8GLyiXf0Qo0GxjMcX3Q.text: The best meal i've had in Phoenix! Please be warned that they only have one section in the restaurant for a group of 8+ to sit together indoors. We had to wait almost an hour because the big party before us sat there chatting with their food all boxed up for 45 minutes, but this is in no way a reflection on the restaurant, just a warning! The food was amazing, our waitress was very nice and gave me a super good tip about the squid ink pasta being overly fishy so I avoided getting something I definitely wouldn't have liked. I got the pappardelle bolognese instead (not a big pizza fan) and it was absolutely incredible. I spent 3 weeks in Italy this year and the pasta from this restaurant rivaled some of my meals there. The kids' meals came out quick and the drinks & desserts were to die for. Plus, the atmosphere is really nice! Will definitely come back here the next time I'm in Phoenix.

tr_wNePdyW9LS1DE2b7BoA.text: Love love love! We were seated immediately on a random Tuesday night. Very comparable to some really good neapolitan pizzas I have had in NYC. The bruschetta and drinks were also amazing. Love the decor and ambiance. Will be back!

smdNAvwHNHKDGPtUh_gPpA.text: Excellent pizza and appetizers. We ordered everything off happy hour and were pleased. I'm eating Keto and they made me a plate of pizza (no sauce or crust but all the toppings. It was great!    We ordered 8 pizzas, 5 apps, 3 desserts, and drinks. It was a home run.   The service was excellent also.

1MEyhZC-0qoIKxlHFc_naw.text: It's been awhile since my original review of The Parlor and I'm excited to report back how consistent this place has been over the years.  From the warm inviting atmosphere to the friendly service and especially the fresh and delicious food, you can't go wrong with a visit to the Parlor.  On a recent visit, we celebrated my father-in-law's 71st birthday, so the age range in our group was from 5 to 71 and everyone was able to find something and had a great experience.  The Parlor's kids menu offers pizzas and pastas and there is plenty of variety on the main menu from fabulous appetizers (do not miss the cauliflower), salads, pizzas, pastas, an incredible farro dish, and plenty more.  They also offer a solid wine and drink menu and desserts too.  I recommend the banana pudding ;)    Looking to save a few $$?  (Who isn't!)  Plan to visit between 3 and 6 during happy hour.  Excited to return soon and often... just wish they took reservations!

rBzDarj7Xxo9upBQnqutlA.text: Very good food and the bar drinks are amazing. Service was also good thanks I'd recommend to who ever likes good food and service   Tastey

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pepperoni and garden mojito with tequila

LUV-37Ril6weqjHPXw-uHA.text: Their seasonal corn pizza is THE BEST. I am not a big fan of pepperoni pizza. However, I changed my mind on it after I tried theirs. Spinach salad is good. Two Risottos I have tried were good. Tiki drinks are great.   Nice environment and great food. You guys need to try this place.

FWtQIEYZTVCpMGSrifZReQ.text: Weird night tonight. I come here often , sit at the bar, drink my wine while my togo pizza cooks and I go home happy. Pinot Grigio and pepperoni pizza with basil and drizzled pesto sauce. After travelling a lot, I'm home for one night tonight before a flight in the morning and have been craving Parlor Pizza. Was acknowledged and sat at the bar for a bit in front of a stack of menus before water was offered. The bar was wet and I was given a wet menu. I wiped everything down, ordered my wine and put in my pizza order. Bar wasn't busy but got the 'closing soon' feeling. Closed my tab, got my pizza and started on my 5 minute ride home. When I grabbed the box to get out my car, my fingers were greasy then noticed so was my car seat!!!!!!! Grrrr..... Grabbed Starbucks napkins I had in my car and it soaked thru 3. Opened the box and the pizza was so greasy and so was the entire box. 'Napkined' the grease off of two slices , ate them and tossed the rest. Disappointed and dissatisfied. The Parlor was off their game tonight ... boooooo.

3gqHkzGz-8q5tsu9sMVjiw.text: Another hip place to go especially if you don't care to have a conversation. This place is loud inside during dinner service. The food is great, but it is loud inside at dinner service. What was that? I said it was loud in here.

4oTqyV84-HupV00_LQCzlQ.text: I only come to Phoenix for work trips and when we get an opportunity to eat out I have to find what is an exciting place my hometown do not provide. I have to say this place is super flavorful and fulfilling! Luckily, my colleagues and I came on the Monday/Tuesday specials. Pizza plus a pitcher for $25 or pasta with a bottle of wine of $35. My gosh! That's a steal! Our waitress Amanda was great on providing us what is most satisfying and non disappointing to customer satisfaction.  I would definitely be back the next time I am in Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RAqulreD20mdq-5zUVZhFA.text: I probably would have rated my food a 3 BUT our server Brent was amazing and we appreciate the good service.   The margarita pizza was pretty good but could have been better if the crust was good a bit longer. The kale sweet potato salad was really delicious and had awesome flavors! The tuna melt was blah- I've never had a tuna melt but I love cold tuna salad A LOT. It lacked flavor and was only cooked halfway through, so the middle was cold ... not exactly a melt but the fries were bomb! Our service noticed we didn't eat the sandwich and even though we said it was fine, he took it off our bill which was really great customer service and we appreciated it a lot. THANKS BRENT!

X4wHbkOSsBZVLbNosDeDgA.text: If I were to grade this on food alone, I would give it 5 stars but the service left a lot to be desired.    First, coffee refills are not free and we were not told that.  We ended up spending more on coffee than beer.  That wouldn't be an issue, except our waitress wasn't the most attentive and took almost 10 minutes to bring back creamer.  So when we drank the coffee, it was both luke warm and had grounds at the bottom.    The salad portion is small.  Don't order it as an entree.    I ordered a pizza with mushrooms and goat cheese which was great.  All of the pizza on the table was delicious and some of the best pizza I have had.    We gave the waitress a 10 minute limit.  Between the table, we said we would order dessert if she came back in 10 minutes.  However, it was nearly 15 before she came back so left.    In short, the pizza is great but we did have a poor experience with service.

3VmY_JJ3PJMlM7eX_SQ1qA.text: I enjoyed each of the three items we ordered. The Calamari and shrimp appetizer was amazing!! Flavor and cook were on point! Bolognese and cake were also on point. Service was good and atmosphere was great as well. Perfect date spot!

fUY4xBKOyWlaA3gEKh7TtQ.text: Not the best pizza I've had, and not the worst.   Was disappointed though since I've heard so many amazing reviews. Service was fine, but the pizza itself wasn't amazing. They put too many toppings on their thinner crust, so even when the pizza is cool, the toppings and cheese just fall off. Hard to eat and lackluster seasoning. Probably won't go back TBCH.

wmbQcbS9fIrmIxILg8yg8A.text: Love the food! Prices are a tad high I think and they have no lunch menu which sucks but the pizza is great and the atmosphere and restaurant Is great.

krErCtBhqexK52c7faNGvw.text: LOOVVVE This place!  One of my absolute favorites.  Hubby and I have been to visit sooo many times both dining in and pick up.  I like the cauliflower gratinada, the parlor ensalada and the pizza!  These are usually my go to dishes.  I went last Sunday with a friend and we spent 2 hrs there visiting  and eating.  We tried the white sangrias, I've never had a rum sangria and it was unusual but my friend liked it.  Whenever I'm in the area it's hard "Not" to stop in.

AkgXAnKLjLNISl0KrYFIKg.text: Food: Perfect  Drinks: Perfect  Vibe: Perfect  I cannot say enough good things about The Parlor.

d4Ja0zdUeL6rizJxKaqRIw.text: Good drinks. Excellent salad. Incredible flavor on the pizza. Reasonable prices. Fun atmosphere.

3MctRFeT4yikfTFDcrFY4A.text: We really love the food here because they are fresh and have tons of flavor. Our favorite pizza is salsiccia. For a meaty pizza, it doesn't weight you down and the fresh sage is always a nice surprise. As for the pasta, we usually get the spicy seafood linguini because the housemade sauce is simple and light, allowing you taste the seafood. I can go on and on but most already. Parking is tight but it's worth getting good service, food and atmosphere.

zd44H5SlXu1u1Rfmyb25eg.text: I came in with friends over the weekend and was so excited to finally try! It's so easily missed I never knew it existed!   First, this place is so spacious. I love that there is plenty of room to walk in between tables and while you're eating you're not overhearing everything that's going on next to you. The staff was very friendly and helped us sort out the customizable menu and what to choose on our chef's board.   To start, we shared the chef's board with a spicy meat (I forget the name) and a spreadable lighter cheese (also forget the name). This was super delicious! I loved what we chose and what it already came with (bread, dips, veggies). I also got the Margherita pizza which was great! I got the smaller size and I still had a couple slices to take home. I wish I was up for the dessert check in offer, so that means I'll have to come back ;)

pLUOTGdhh_nvlXS660A76w.text: Excellent food. Risotto, boulangise, and a couple of different pizzas. Also a chef's board that you and pick your meats and cheeses. Everything was great.   Went for a Saturday lunch at 11:30 and while the wait staff was under staffed, service was good. At about noon the place was packed. Another winner.

igYDmcLdZ9yqXk-gNylCKw.text: I would give this place 10 star if I could.  Always amazing food, great atmosphere,   friendly and knowledgeable staff! One of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix!

q9D9h5LVdpmVGcxI-gtqQw.text: For the love of humanity: this place is amazing! Have the burger and fries (you can get the salad as the side of you hate yourself). Save room for the carrot cake fritters. Seriously.   You're welcome.

0p3lta34N-VJA9u7X6g4zg.text: I used to enjoy the Happy Hour at the Parlor. Great deals all around. Not so much any more... 5.50 ($2.00 off) for a Happy Hour beer? There are so many other places to choose from... you guys are good but not that good Parlor. 3 stars because staff always awesome!

Plenty of craft beers in the back also and great salads to choose from. Wasn't crazy about the apps but the staff is always friendly!

UHW3DMtMkK4AdK6ORdm7VA.text: Royce is the master of drinks and good service! He is one of the many reasons I come here about once a week!!! The new teddy and the pizza!! Everything is fresh and you can't go wrong with a good pasta either. I like the classics. You won't be disappointed. Except for the deserts. Skip those and have another slice or drink!

obKDEbskxVPKS4BjDQqJaw.text: Haven't been here in 3 years. Met a friend for lunch and it was as delicious as I remember. Fresh and tasty. Won't be another 3 years til my next visit!

79EIDUVF18z3i5HJ9mZgew.text: Used the wait list option on here, was told to check in at the restaurant  by a certain time.  When we got there was told it was a 2hr wait...very few people waiting, parking lot not full.  Hmmmm, something not right!

pTd5RvP2WmPVjLtqDz5_gA.text: Everything was delicious. Service was good, price was good. It feels fancy but is casual too.

kuXjoS7f_hEIY_EwrY98yw.text: We came here and were told we would be sat in 30 minutes. We were a party of 11. So we expected it to be somewhat of a wait. So we wait, about 30 minutes later we ask the hostess how much longer she says about 30 minutes more. So still being patient we said okay, mind you nobody else is waiting. Just us. After an hour and 15 minutes of waiting a server comes out to tell us he can't sit us all together after waiting this long. It is absolutely ridiculous. If you plan on coming with a big party, don't because clearly they don't know how to manage their seating, or wait times. Thank you for the awesome service.

kwmxYnQPtbFEYFHcGRzMQg.text: Surprising that Phoenix is a pizza city. The parlor is the top amongst the top. They never ever ever disappoint.   Obviously the pizza is next level, but the Cocktail list is on point! Can we get Bryan on a Best Bar Tender in Phoenix list?? It's ridiculous what this guy can come up with.   Get there. Make a trip for it. It's worth it. Business lunch is always a favorite for me. Quick, reliable, excellent service.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary

wNs5ObbyemhfMV0Ps3UI_g.text: For a stab in the dark while visiting Phoenix, we hit a home run.  Calamari and shrimp?  Never thought about it on a pizza before but I will now. The wine selection is awesome and to call their cocktails unique would be an understatement.  While I was the responsible driver, my wife had the Camelback Collins with mango and habanero.  Above all, the staff is great, totally attentive. The price, for the quality of food, is a steal.

lTZj3xovAoD0tCEOwFbIAA.text: The food was great, I had a signature pasta dish, that was amazing, and I split a salad that has a chicken schnitzel on the bottoms..Outstanding. We also spilt a banana desert that came in a jar, was not impressed with it.  Overall, very good, pizza looks amazing, will try that next.

6aW8F18R6N6DfaYbH7q0_w.text: I had pasta (which is homemade!) and my fiancee had pizza. Both were AMAZING!  They have an extensive wine list, too that I did not get to enjoy due to being on call for work.  Looks like we will need to go back soon!  Easily a 5 star meal. The only thing that was negative for us was the time we had to wait for our server to take our order. Everything else was perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

71GfF-kAnMU8PSHIKZt0Lw.text: Visited this place during the week a couple hours before close. The low lit mood setting made it feel classy and intimate.  Came here for GNO and different items were ordered among the table. Pizzas, salad, burger, cauliflower app, and dessert.  The service was great, the waiter was knowledgable about the menu and pronounced all the food items well. The waiter was attentive and nice. The only thing I can think of was, my water wasn't refilled the whole time I was there. But the great service made up for that. Everything we ordered was full of flavor and unique! It was nice to go somewhere and just order new things. The summer corn pizza was amazing!! Full of spice and flavor and different that any pizza I've had lately.  The dessert was yummy with a delicious lemon curd sauce on the side! This place is defiantly worth a try!!

Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Summer corn

iIrodZIsd5DUIdjLUP_Vsw.text: Pasta wasn't that good. Dried out, flavorless, and just not that good. Overpriced. Gets 4 stars for the ambience and service otherwise it's 2 stars on the food.  Probably should've tried the pizza.

wNR5xTj4W3sgYfLWUc0YCA.text: Food was delicious and service was awesome. Steak salad, market pizza and a tiramisu for dessert. Best pizza ever! Brent was an awesome, friendly and informative server. Will definitely be back.

OVGkDvus5FU8xvtjL5t5qw.text: Had a really great lunch here. The place is VERY unassuming from the outside, but the food AND service is spot on. We split a salad and a pizza- with 2 glasses of wine... it came out to a very reasonable price. I definitely recommend this spot if you're in the area!

yDUJF7lQXR7kkJwWWcYn-A.text: Like this place. Great vibe and ambiance. Had the beet salad which was good. The beets were good. The dressing was good. The presentation was nice. My only criticism is that the salad was a bit small for an entree salad and could have been a little larger for the price.

v0Z4F3Jh5AT629DOMYObwQ.text: What a great place especially if you like great pizza and beer. I got the mushroom pizza and paired it with the Short Hop Session IPA from Four Peaks. The decor is great there too. They used reclaimed wood all over the bar area. A really nice touch. Brian was my bartender and took great care of me. Check this place out.

gXN4WUBNCtYI1IcmMlInjQ.text: Awesome pizza. I'm from the SF Bay Area and we have good pizza there (toot toot). Pizza was fresh, local, and delicious. They grow their own ingredients and make everything from scratch apparently. Very good prices too. Definitely get "The House". Nice atmosphere too. And complimentary valet.

9EFMN4k6LZY0VxtJIDTCLQ.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants! The food is unique and fresh! They have a garden and grow some veggies and salad greens right there on site! The Yukon Gold pizza is a family favorite, and be sure to have dessert!

ACAYpB7u0za8ulLhYMQ1ow.text: I'm clearly a New York kinda pizza guy and not a huge fan of those fu fu toppings and fancy small pizzas, but my date loves this place so I took one for the team. It was a Friday night just after 8pm, but because of the Holiday weekend we got seated right away. After we switched tables, we ended up on the patio where the active misters doused our table and the paper make your own menus and even gave both of us a somewhat wet head. It was the only way to go though and the alternative was shouting out to get to know this woman in the very loud interior room. Service was great, the waitress was very patient and since there was no wait, we were allowed to linger until closing. I had some refreshing seasonal peach beer at $5 a pop, while she went with the rather pricey $9 a glass wine. As for the food, we just had the arancini (rice balls) which were slightly above average, but resting in a nice semi spicy marinara sauce that was well seasoned ($9 for three). The make-your own pizza at $9 plus $2 each for toppings turned out good enough with artichoke hearts and grilled veggies and a blend of cheeses. Of course, NY'ers prefer just mozzarella, but had to roll with the punches. Good news was that it was foldable and even if it wasn't, no fork would ever get near my slice anyway. We just hit this place on a nice relaxing night and everything really was quite satisfactory, including my date for a change.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Make your own...veggies

VVSinLd5Qq2UNqDnBnJZlQ.text: I live in the area yet I never visit. I have been letting my good times go to waste! I enjoy the place. I like the design, my friend was apart of the design team so I am twice shamed for not enjoining my good times with sad establishment . I had a great pizza with a great drink and no hassle was involved. I may have found my next go to place. I hope they can handle the rabbi

DswP2Yz1a5v2RY4W2uZK0A.text: This place was really great!! We came here for late dinner Friday and we were seated right away. The ambiance is really chic and trendy- a little dark...as the new/hot places always are....but everything was super comfortable and nice.  We started with the lamb meatballs on a bed of lentils and other beans. Seriously, I have never had lentils made this good anywhere. I still have mouth-watering thoughts of it. We had 3 pizzas- the classic pepperoni (yuuuum), the potato-leek (amazing!!!) and the fungi (I don't eat mushrooms, but my friends thought this was great) Can't wait to visit Arizona again to come here again....especially for those lentils!

pLBJN5GdvM3kOmLVZ8wkzA.text: I really don't get how people love this place. My first time, I went with a group and we all ordered pizzas. Each person ordered a different pizza and I tried them all. Not sure what's going on with the oven but everyones crusts were soggy. I had the pizza with speck on it which was cool to have on a pizza but it was pretty pricey. Plus having to pay for valet meant more money to shell out!   I wanted to give this place another try so I went again with two friends who brought me the first time and needless to say, same old story.... I emailed The Parlor before to ask of they had any gluten free options and I received an email stating the servers were very well trained in guiding me through the gluten free options on their menu. Would've been nice to just be told what was available rather than making me drive there to ask. I joked around with my friends saying the waitress will just tell me they have salads (I'm not driving all the way there to order a basic salad) so I ordered a pizza again. This time I used the sheet to make my own creation which ended up costing me $25 for a 12 inch pizza and they were skimpy on the ingredients plus I didn't order anything fancy. My crust again was soggy like last time and so was my friends who just ordered cheese pizza. How can you screw up the crust of a cheese pizza?!? I asked the server after we got our pizza what their gluten free options were only to have her say, we have salads? Totally nailed it!   When I left the restaurant, I realized I forgot cash to tip the valet guy. When he dropped off my car, he put his hand out for a tip which completely appalled me. I grabbed my keys and left while he complained to his coworker about me where I could hear him. I still felt bad and ran to the gas station across the street and got cash back and brought a tip to the guy. Needless to say, I will never step foot in this place ever again. I can get a top notch pizza from La piazza locale or pizzeria Bianco for cheaper than the parlor, no valet needed and a real deal crust that isn't soggy.

LjVDxC7uL9bBEGyMEFLxnQ.text: the other reviewers aren't lying. the duck club is great.  also, the servers here were really great. like, at a point it almost felt like our waiter joined our group and was just hanging out with us talking, making actual good contribution to our conversation. it was kind of awesome.  great food, great service, not pretentious at all. i'd definitely go back over and over.

HodEdU1ovERmfibnPXVtlQ.text: The pizza here alone is worth coming for.  Stone fire pizza is always a yes in my book!  Everything about our pizza was good from the mushrooms, sausage, shrimp, and sauce.  We also ordered the duck sandwich and lasagetta.  Duck sandwich was a bit too sweet for me, nothing super special I can say about it.  Lasagetta ... turned out NOT to be lasagna as we thought..it was little sausage pieces that covered veggies and thick lasagna pasta.. no sauce, no go if you ask me.  I would definately come back for the pizza!

eqiTVqxg-bEatR_hV9getA.text: This place is fantastic! Love the pizza! Best in town?? Debatable...but very good nonetheless. Good beers on tap and a good wine selection. Wonderful atmosphere and great location. 4 stars!

VOHWQz8cpZ12h7V0MfVTmQ.text: This is a cool place to get drinks in the bar with friends, and definitely worth going for dinner!  The pizza is tasty and the specialty cocktails are sheik and delicious!  As a fan of architecture and design, the Parlor has one of the best atmospheres in Phoenix!

zxYRafzbOLQrh51TPnfBqQ.text: We had the Brussels Sprouts and they were delicious. Just a touch of spicy which was perfect!

8P0XhzBKxY17qu_7O4SmIg.text: Anyone who knows me is well aware that I'm a fan of this place!!  I've frequented The Parlor since it opened, and will continue going there until they kick me out!!  The staff is amazing, you couldn't ask for better people...and the food?  Well - lets just say I crave so many of the items on the menu it would seem like I was getting paid by them if I rattled off all the amazingness here :)  I will say that Michael hit a home run with the Parlor Star cocktail.  It's my new favorite!!  (and I never go for gin drinks...ever)  You have to check this place out!!  Happy Hour is great! The 1/2 price appetizers will get you hooked and the portions are so large will fill you up!  But be sure to leave room for the pizza!!  It doesn't matter which one you choose - they're all awesome!  Pair it with the Parlor Insalada and you're set!  Happy Eating!!

Si83192OQxQLj8erxBiFtA.text: My wife and I visited The Parlor for the first time this evening. We had the 8 inch pepperoni pizza and it was amazing! The dough is made with beer giving a light, fluffy, and chewy texture. Cooked perfectly, mozzarella was the right amount of salty and creaminess. The pepperoni had great flavor, not to greasy or salty. We also ordered the bolognese with fresh in house made pappardella! The pasta was perfectly done and cooked. My wife's sauce is better but they did a good job. Only getting three star because of the all around service. We had to ask several times for the wine chiller and the staff was not very attentive during the course of the meal. We finished off with pineapple Zeppole  and this came out piping hot with a delicious caramel sauce and side of whip cream. All in all we will go back.

NhlF6Gq-HfXURpcwPhx9FQ.text: My guy and I went last night, on a Wednesday, and it was packed - we still had a 15-20minute wait. Well worth it, BTW. It is a cute little place and like most places in the area the parking lot is TINY; practically minuscule so you have to get their valet or sneakily park next door. Just to let you know --I would not recommend that because I freak out that my car will get towed but ours did not. You run the risk if you try it though.   Now for the food. We split two burgers. I had the bleu cheese+bacon w/salad and Mr. had the brie+mushroom w/fries. OMG. I think I may have made an inappropriate face for the dinner table when I took my first bite. It was that delicious. The hamburger is juicy, the lettuce is spring greens (looks like its from the garden -adorables) the bread is perfectly toasted to accommodate the medium rare burger and there was just the right amount of bleu cheese so it wasn't overpowering.  French fries were surprisingly delicious - I don't know what seasoning they put on there but I ate more than I normally would in that department.   Ambiance: We sat on the patio and it was extremely cute, feels indoor/outdoor which I adore. Another place that I want to steal the decor/design from.

fV96WJ0cql4UcBBsdZ9psg.text: This place is bomb-diggity. I love that they change up their menu to keep it fresh and they aren't afraid to go all foodie on your bland palates either -- get refined and just try it! Everything on the menu is delightful. One time they had a spectacular tortelinni with wild fungi, absolutely loved it, even though it was a small portion -- I think that throws the average consumer off, and they're the ones you cater to, but bring it back! Get creative once again plsss

LH0Zk3nnDdabQnbe2OVfKQ.text: Ah-mazing food! On your way into the restaurant you'll pass by a fresh herb garden that The Parlor actually uses in their cooking. Wonderful options for building your own pizza or if you're a little more adventurous they have their own creations that are fantastic as well. My husband is pretty picky about his food but with the build-your-own he was able to  create a pizza he loves.   The atmosphere is so lovely esp. at night on the patio. We always sit outside whether it's January or July and have always been very comfortable. Great place for a one on one date or with a group of friends!

n1cIq5GhCdGWwJGwSfW46A.text: Tried this place for the first time.  I had the gnudi and it was really good.  It had lots of veggies and great flavor.  The atmosphere was nice too.  I'll be back!

AohXZSDTer_so1Z6xOv_Tg.text: After hearing all the hype regarding The Parlor, we decided to check it out for the first time last night. The place is amazing. Very clean and modern. With that in mind, the building is understated and does not feel overwhelming like some spots in the valley.   The service was amazing. The food was unbelievable. The drinks were stiff. What more can you ask for? I certainly recommend trying the funghi pizza with a fresh farm salad to compliment. With dinner, we shared a very reasonable bottle of Boom! Boom! and topped everything off with a table side french press for two.   I can't express how much we enjoyed our experience at The Parlor. They have made a customer for life!

AKDOWRIXHo542dvyYII6AQ.text: Food was amazing! I had the Calabrian pizza, which was both spicy and creamy. This was seriously one of the best pizzas I have ever had. I finished up with the banana cream pie trifle. Morgan was our server and was fantastic. I will go back many more times.

qBuev6914fwq_O_PQu947g.text: This place was amazing. It was a bit chilly out so we waited for an indoor table, about 15 mins. My only complaint would be that the music was a bit too loud to hear someone not talking over it. The duck burger was amazing. The drinks are too. Get the Old Fashioned.

xzm5tPpz2UuQ3UY5gEfgNw.text: The Parlor is a very cool place, good food...but nothing earth shattering in my opinion.  The style is very modern and sleek...I love the open-ness of the room, nice little herb garden as you walk in.  The food is solid - the soup was a potato/sausage when we were there, made with a veg stock rather than a cream base, which made the soup a perfect accompaniment rather than an overbearing, heavy soup.  It was delicious and still fairly light.    We had the spicy bbq chicken pizza, which was nothing like a CPK BBQ chicken pizza - it was great.  The sauce is not over-done and is quite light in comparison.  The spice comes from the peppers that are sliced up as a topping - really pretty light on the spice (I could've used more, but this was probably an appropriate for most people Level of spice).    Overall, service was good, food was good, decor was good...for some reason, I just didn't love it.

cnuhUqTUhlffWXdj11tqsQ.text: I heart this place.  Always busy; never a line and professional, courteous servers AND hostesses--I would say you rarely get that combination!  I recommend the Brussels spouts and the sausage pizza--you could probably split a pizza between two people but you wouldn't want to.    Like most lunch places on the Camelback/24th Street area it can get busy at noon.  I recommend going around 11:30 to beat the rush.

uq1akcHYKJWMVtQJuvWgqw.text: Went last night with a table of 6. Had a great time -- got to sample several different pizza's and were impressed by the quality of ingredients used in the toppings -- I loved the sage and sausage combo, and that fact that the pepperoni was actually spicy! Can't say we were blown away by the crust, but it's inauspiciousness allowed the amazing toppings to shine.    We were also impressed with the remodel of the space, in particular the desire to stay True to the mid century bones of the space, while adding a modern, yet organic edge. I loved the reuse of the salon chairs as bar stools, and the vintage photos of the salon next to the washrooms...   One last thing, not sure it was intentional or not, but we enjoyed the $7 pitchers ($2 pints) of PBR -- it brought back fond memories of college.

5VIuFr7Sig8EWzCac5utNw.text: This place reminds me a lot of The Vig, modern atmosphere with good looking people inside.  The parking to my surpise was plentiful and easy to get in and out even though the place was packed.  As this is within walking distance, I will deem it my new favorite Pizza Place.  Now on to the food, the menu is affordable, not cheap, I like the cheese and meat boards concept, although I realize when they say hard cheese, they mean HARD cheese, next time I'll go do something a bit softer.  The Peach and Gorgonzola special of the night was a fantastic parring for my Summer Ale.  I look forward to being back for many more samplings.

S2q-2A3VasdcJ1IKnTvFgw.text: The Parlor, I loved it in so many ways because they take care of you on all levels, food, service & it's a nice spot to hang with your friends. Thanks Yelp, I would not have known of this place if it was not for you & my fellow Yelpers. Yep, as good as it gets for sure.

tNUe2DF-Sy8alnG9XdQ3Ig.text: It's more like 4.5, probably a 5 if I had ordered something else.  Went with Amy and our server was so fantastic.  Very personable and so patient while we ran our mouths.  I loved the atmosphere and the way they maintained that funky brick facade facing Camelback.   Went for lunch on a Saturday and ordered the margherita pizza.  The toppings on the pizza were really good but I didn't like the crust.  That's not to say it tasted bad or was made incorrectly, I personally wanted (or "prefer" may be a better word) a slightly thicker crust. I'm not going to be an asshole and say the whole thing sucked because it wasn't my personal preference.  I think other people may like the thinness of the crust, and I'll just leave it alone.  I'm looking forward to going back to try the burger and some of their other items.

WkhQUtRa83c0whQIqhTv1Q.text: Wood fired Pizzas & Pitchers of Craft Beer.  I recently had dinner at the Parlor with a big group of friends before going out to a concert at the Rhythm Room. The Parlor doesn't take reservations, but we were quickly seated at a six top directly across from the wood fired oven. The atmosphere was hip but casual. As a big group, it was easy to share everything from the pizzas to the pitchers of beer. The  favorites were the pitchers of Four Peaks Hop Knot,  and the sweet corn pizza. All the pizzas were a knockout, but it's the sweet corn pizza that keeps me awake at night.   I'll absolutely go back to the Parlor.  Cheers.

e9aiZnzinirS-B1Q6R_8MQ.text: Love this place! Food is excellent, service was outstanding! The decor is great! Definitely happy we stopped by this place for lunch!

hPupBK6CVrKzhrHso-riFg.text: To those as sick of going to LGO Pizzaria as me:   It was so wonderful to walk into one of our small architectural treasures that hasn't been torn down, but actually adaptively re-used and re-imagined into a gorgeous, warm yet contemporary eatery.  I can't stop talking about the ingenious curtain wall of glass that allows the filtered light from the geometric concrete shade wall to gently glow into the interior.  On my first visit, I wasn't feeling very adventurous , so I ordered the pepperoni and mushroom pizza with torn basil, and as pedestrian as that sounds, it  was simply the stand-out of the evening.  I loved all of the salads, but thought the Cesar Salad too salty for my tastes.  The creamy fettucini pasta I tried was scrumptious!  I tried another creamy pasta dish, but it had some raddichio in it that overwhelmed the delicate creamy identity. The anitpasto (going backwards here) was super satisfying and diverse.  I appreciated the dipping sauces, and the hard to pronouncecured meats and delicious cheeses that our waitress was sweet enough to repeatedly pronounce for all of us approaching our 3rd or 4th glass of wine.     I love that the coffee came in our very own little red French Presses, and that our waitress, when hearing the despicably dirty jokes being tossed around the table, chimed in with a few from her own repertoire.  The 2nd time was at the bar, and the bartender didn't cut the muster for me.  He was slow, and we had to ask him repeatedly for simple things like silverware and water.  The food was just as excellent... my new favorite pizza spot for sure!

BW3DnRWO6CIsjqqATlGSEQ.text: Great little place, much nicer than I expected, awesome atmosphere and great food & drinks. Best mojito I've had ever! They pick the herbs from the garden, everything tasted fresh. The steak salad was amazing and the pepperoni pizza was really good too.

3VWQInAb5oWbBz8I4vqlnQ.text: If Heaven exists, what do I want to hear God say as I arrive at the Pearly Gates?  "...and we're catered by The Parlor..."  Have been there only five times now (or is five a lot?).  It's literally a mile from home, which makes The Parlor really too accessible.
