mHk7HcB6W-qRYX5Fht4Lag.text: Last night I went to the Parlor for the second time, I was waiting to try it again before I wrote the review, simply because I only tried a couple things and they were amazing. I didn't trust that it would be as good the second time. I was wrong! I went with my Brother (the Sommelier) and his wife, who drove in from San Diego for the weekend.  And Jason B. who clearly loves this place. We decided to start with a pizza as an appetizer. The Duck pizza, it was very delectable. The Squash puree was really well flavored and went  will with the pizza, which surprised me.  I ordered the Duck Club, oh my! It was one of the best sandwiches I have ever had. The Duck was so tender and the red wine jelly was so well flavored it really made the sandwich! I would recommend everyone try the Duck Club! My brother and his wife shared the beet salad, which was good but too small according to my brother. The Spicy Seafood Linguine, which he said was exactly what he had hoped it would be and really excellent. And the Spicy Barbeque Chicken Pizza (They were really hungry!) and they enjoyed the pizza as well.  I find my family hard to impress, and they were, so for that alone the place deserves 5 Stars!  Service was good, the pizza was slow, but then they can only fit so many in the oven, so we understand. The wine selection was okay, not impressive according to my brother, but they thought the prices were good. Over all a great experience and the perfect place to impress out of town family! Great job The Parlor!

oFGtOCPsSwYc0TLFL60_Mg.text: Delicious pizza, love the decor too. There are plenty of vegetarian choices. I ordered the margherita pizza and it was delicious, though a bit more basil would have been nice. Definitely recommended!

G3hnrpiOsBZpuu1AwEwEVQ.text: I have been to the Parlor twice and thoroughly enjoyed the food both times.  The ambiance is fun too, though the service could be a bit improved.   I've tried the smokey pizza which was very good, and the potato and pancetta pizza (forget what it was called) that was excellent!  Also tried the duck sandwich which was exceptional.  I'm not really a fry fan, but I have to say that I dove in with a gusto!  I have yet to try the fresh pasta, which I think is going to be next on my list...

WQcrH31cHV_XIjly0Hxcpg.text: Really good food, really good atmosphere. I had there wild mushroom pizza w/o truffle oil, and it was very tasty, and some goat cheese Tortellini pasta, that were beyond good. Can't recommend this place enough.

bQdOEiOPSxFaMygF8lLRLw.text: Big time fan.  Love the Cauliflower appetizer and I love the pesto and whatever the red sauce is that comes with the meat and  cheese starter.  Delicious.   Very solid beer selection on tap as well.    Have been 4 times and will soon be making it a 5th.

LpdZoyeQiMjO85Oqni7izA.text: I have eaten here four or five times, and the experience has been consistently good.  The pizzas have a nice thin crust, and the beet salad with goat cheese is probably my favorite item on the menu.  Wine specials, fun atmosphere and a nice patio round out the place.

8CEFEayg06Ld5mhE1bOW0w.text: Awesome, awesome, awesome....everything was fantastic. The innovative drink menu, the pizza was out of this world and the bartender was very personable. A++ I would definitely recommend this place to everyone. Ban't wait to return!

nceUnheFB_QoNUN3VUs0dg.text: Being a gourmet pizza fan, I had been wanting to try this place for awhile, but I was afraid that all the hype was unwarranted.  I was not disappointed.    We arrived at 6pm on a Friday night and the wait was 15 minutes as promised by the hostesses.  The restaurant was busy with several parties waiting and a trendy, happenin' vibe. The clients span from young families to seniors.  We ordered the frito misto and 8 inch Margherita pizza to share as appetizers. The frito misto was a mix of calamari and shrimp, with very thin breading and a roasted red pepper sauce. The sauce was tasty, but the portion was very small for $9. The pizza was better than expected - the crust was not as chewy as Cibo or Pizza a Metro, but softer and more airy, but stil thin. It was cooked perfectly and had a pleasing flavor.  We each ordered a pasta dish, me the pesto spaghetti (large - $18) and my companion the duck chiatarra (one size - $12).  I was pleasantly surprised that the pasta is fresh.  The menu says the pesto is seasonal, and that night it was basil pesto.  The pasta was a nice texture and the sauce was tasty.  At $18 for a large, the price was a bit high, but at least you have the option of ordering a large and not feeling unsatisfied with a small portion (as can happen at PastaBar).  The duck chiatarra with vegetable ragout had a very flavorful red wine and earthy flavor, with baby carrots and mushrooms. The chiatarra pasta was a little on the mushy side, but not terrible.  There was plenty of duck in the dish which made it a good deal at $12.  On the whole, the pasta itself is not as good as PastaBar, but the sauces are on par and the value is a bit better.   As a huge fan of fresh pasta, I plan on returning to try the other pastas, as well as some of the other pizzas.

T1KTG7wl8kedd5L74pOPeA.text: We had the mozzarella salad, very fresh and crispy with a nice sweet dressing. We then shared the bouginese   pasta, and we still ended up with a doggie box! !  We always enjoy it here.Funky, hip, and wonderful food.  A no brainer.

FjUZY1h-fialsv2dEZGAhA.text: Family trip from Jersey to Phoenix and heard a lot about this place. It did not disappoint me and the family. Had a great meal and really like the ambiance. Everyone was friendly and food was really good. Highly recommend.

mn-N75ZD5Ne0WkKOQnKq5Q.text: This place is terrific. We had the mare pizza and the potato pizza and they were both tremendous. I loved the variety of items on the mare pizza (clams, oysters, and a shrimp crema base) The cherry upside down cake we had for dessert was *amazing*. Salt mixed in lightly with baked sweets is a great combination. The mixed berry zeppole was merely ok - it was sort of like having donut holes.   We also had an appetizer with asparagus done a couple different ways that was delectable.  Absolutely go here if you're in the area.

-YFVt1o9710HrCVP9Ock5g.text: Love the Parlor! Great look and feel, amazing cauliflower and the pizza is even better for breakfast the next morning (cold).

wu7B80wQFpHiehg526Pv4A.text: The restaurant was neat, I ordered pizza to go and the flavors were spot on!!! I got arugula, smoked prosciutto and mozzarella. I wish they cut up the toppings so it was easier to eat and I really really wish my pizza was cooked slightly longer. I don't want a droopy slice of pizza, I want cripsy thin crust!!! If it was cooked lover I would give it a 5. But I will try other pizza places before going back to soggy slices

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Build your own: arugula, smoked prosciutto and mozzarella!

uvDCbCwbHxC3Hdn7XWoWuQ.text: I love this place, the pizza is very good and they have happy hour every day.  The happy hour prices are very good.  The only issue is the parking.  The lot gets very full and it is small.  They started blocking some of it off for valet which I was not very happy about.

DjVegXUCrb5wGJhKRgEfeA.text: What an amazing end to a really stressful day. We were there for Happy Hour (after being turned away from Upper Crust Pizza on 24th street for having our 19 year old son with us)  We were lucky enough to have Eddy as our server and he was attentive, polite and funny! We sat on the patio, which I believe to be one of the loveliest in the valley and thoroughly enjoyed every moment of our meal. We had the Frito Misto and Cauliflower Gratinata for appetizers and we each ordered our own small pizzas. I had the Calabrian pizza which was amazing, just the right amount of spice, my friend had the Fungi which I believe to be the best mushroom pizza in town, she loved it! We also had the Summer corn pizza and the Salciccia, two of the best pizzas on the menu. We all agreed that this was some of the very best pizza in town.The Parlor certainly knows how to do it right, we will be telling all our friends to go there and will definitely be back!

Z3zh5JbDtUfsLw1uqpZBQg.text: The cauliflower appetizer, the BBQ chicken Pizza and the sausage pizza (second to last one menu that starts w/ an "s") were all super good!!

ryL-6noAAwPauHEKJpA_WQ.text: Happiest and most delicious of happy hours. Killer 3$ craft beer options and outstanding pizzas. Cute bar..smidge hipstery but still casual/comfortable for all.

-B6r7dNzeE9SwQCOqtxGDQ.text: I love this place.  I always get a meat and cheese board (they rotate through offerings such as prosciutto, genoa salami, goat cheese, brie, etc.). Boards come with pita bread, pesto, and my favorite the peperonata sauce.  I also get the spinach salad- with avocado, egg, bacon, cherry tomato, and a tangy dressing.  I have occasionally added chicken to the salad, but I prefer not to- chicken is not their strong suit.  They have a decent selection of wines and I opt to get a white by the glass.  The atmosphere is fun, with remnants of the building's former life as a beauty parlor.  Great patio and bar as well.  Limited parking-valet available during busy times.

uczdVMDnxb0gb_v2reeQLA.text: The Parlor is such a cute restaurant.  It's rustic and homey and the patio seating is gorgeous!  I've had the salsiccia, funghi and then my own pizza with sausage, arugula, mushrooms and basil.  The pizzas listed are a better value than the create your own pizzas in my opinion, but they're all delicious!  One surprising thing about the pizzas here is how loaded they are with toppings.  They're all fresh, and definitely not skimping on anything.  Great pizza, and the fritto misto is a great appetizer too.  Parking is sometimes hard on a busier weekend night though.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fritto misto- comes out hot!

h8Gg76PkK2XACAjAPxHTHQ.text: Consistently delicious. Perhaps not as decadent as Pizzeria Bianco, but it really is on the same level. The last pizza I had was the Yukon Gold, which basically tastes like potatoes au gratin baked on top of a pizza. Absolutely delicious. I swapped slices with some of my friends and they quickly said they wished they'd ordered same as I did. Mind you their pizzas were also delicious, but the Yukon Gold was just a level higher.   Prices are very reasonable. An 8" pizza is roughly $10, but these pizzas are handmade and every 8" pizza I've had there was closer to 10"-11". I think of it this way: you're getting basically the standard of quality you'd get at Bianco but without the wait or slightly higher price. The Parlor is an excellent alternative, and I have to say that it's my preferred pizza spot in town.

da40deJV-kz3TEJXtk-djg.text: There must be something wrong with me.  I can see why why most people have given The Parlor four or five stars, but this place just didn't do it for me.  We showed up at 7:30 on a Saturday night.  The place was packed but the wait was just a few minutes.  I love the set up.  The parlor has a very modern ambiance with a fun and hip vibe.  I love the drink menu.  Great Beer selection.  I love pizza and pasta with fresh ingredients.  That's this place's specialty.  But despite the uniqueness of many of the selections on the menu, I just wasn't all that impressed with what was on the plates.   My group of four ordered the Tonnarelli "Cacio e Pepe."  This was really good, the pasta and sauce taste home-made, but it was a little too creamy for me.  We also had the Zucca Pizza.  A decent pizza with summer squash, leeks, squash blossoms pecorino and basil.  This was pretty good, and flavorful, but not a cohesive pizza.  It just felt like the toppings were tossed on top of a white pizza.  We also had the Roasted Corn Pizza.  This was great.  Corn, chillies, and cilantro.  Perfect.

XotcQ8QgdVeeswxEJEXWyg.text: Great food.....excellent pizza and vibe. But it was our server Ryan who made the evening/experience really fun! So glad we went!

EtTrqPvbBMRvA3FVWXC_MA.text: The Parlor is the spot for awesome homemade pasta in a pleasant and comfortable atmosphere.  The cauliflower appetizer is really delicious.  They also have pretty good sandwiches, though the French fries are not my favorite.  The service is prompt and quite friendly.  I recommend getting the larger order of pasta if that's going to be your whole meal as the portions are on the smaller side.

JGKSBEEsxkAuv22U13pslQ.text: Amazing pizza! Looks a lot nicer inside than expected! Great service and delicious pizza- had one with shrimp and calamari and was amazing!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ASGwTxJuc0GUikUMUun9zA.text: While on our quest for the city's best traditional margherita pizza we stopped here to try it out what they had to offer.  The first thing I like about this place is the fresh herb garden outside when you walk up. The smell of fresh basil is intoxicating as you put your name in for a table. This got us very excited!  We had very quick service! I ordered the arancine as our appetizer the saffron risotto was heavenly. So we were excited to get our margherita pizza...   When it came we were disappointed...now I know that ever restaurant has their own take on margherita pizza, but if you are going to claim you have the some of the best pizza in town then I think your margherita pizza should be pretty dang close to the traditional Italian neapolitan pizza style margherita pizza. BUT it wasn't, it was actually quite gross.   The crust was WAY to floury and there was no sauce, NONE just ice cold tomato slices stuck on the pizza with the cheese not even melted all the way. The basil just thrown on there.   We had to choke it down and the server even asked us why we didn't finish it as if he was surprised we didn't like it. We tried to explain to him the type of margherita pizza we like and how it should be done and he looked at us like we were crazy. Obviously, he isn't much of a foodie. But we didn't want to be rude and we didn't send it back, we just quietly ate and quickly asked for our bill.   It surprises me that other reviews claim the margherita is good here. They obviously like a salad thrown on a warm pizza crust or have never had True neapolitan style margherita pizza....   However, a couple weeks later we discovered Pomo in Scottsdale and that my friends is the best margherita pizza in the Phoenix area. They do neapolitan the right way...  I doubt we ever go back to The Parlor. We are not fans of meaty type pizzas, if we were I am sure we would like this place as that is the type of pizzas every table around us ordered. So maybe that is how they got a good name is for those type of pizzas.

8x6IeRtKBjKmgSmX2wnLRQ.text: Just tried the parlor. The food is good. Nothing I had was excellent through. The mushroom truffle pizza did not have enough truffle flavor. The beet salad was descent. The duck club was good, the cauliflower was just ok. Dessert was the best part of the meal.

oQj8FSWIXL1nlNleevsSUA.text: Just. Excellent. I left in a satisfied coma, reminiscing about everything I had just eaten-- the meat and cheese spread with fresh, soft flat bread, the amazing olives (I bet they grow them!), the insalata, and the amazing cocktails!  Basically, I am dumb for passing this place by for years before finally going in. Behind the star shaped cinder block exterior is a heart of gold (and pizza!).

V9ezD-rRbDCKOz2NQa3SLw.text: The Bourb! Another fave: Makers and Amarana cherries. A delicious excuse to spend $10 on a drink!   P.S. The chocolate cake is also irresistable. :p

503kh7FEzCt_hL_HJ9xLfQ.text: Fabulous pizza crust, just like the reviews said! I don't normally eat the crust, but I did eat this crust! I got the Margareta pizza, but added sauce, and my husband built his own. We both loved or pizzas. You could just tell the ingredients were quality! Tasted so good! We also tried the cauliflower as an opener. It was good, but nothing I'll die if I don't have it again. We prefer our cauliflower a little more cooked.  The service was just fabulous from the moment we walked in the door.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pizza Margarita...

95lNruDhk6_sQiPgNZBIdQ.text: We were craving pasta & stumbled across this place. We had pasta, pesto pizza, and (drumroll please) Cauliflower Gratinata.. which was deliiiiiish! Our server was so cool & invited us back for good eats during brunch. The sangrias were also yum! Can't wait to come back

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pasta, pesto pizza, white &amp; red sangrias
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The best Cauliflower I&#39;ve ever had.. EVER!

uDvh4j2w1PVjjdoykx46lA.text: Pretty damn good pizza! The rice balls were great as well! The only thing we ordered that was not a 5 was the eggplant caponata. I grew up eating eggplant caponata and it's one of my faves. This version lacks that classic taste. I would rate the caponata a 2. Now back to the pizza, the reviews don't lie. This place has really good fired pizza. The toppings are delicious. No need to rewrite what has been said before. The mini arincini (rice balls) were pretty good as well, we'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Caponata &amp; Pizza

Jhryp4TQo767ks_GnFxA1w.text: This place was beyond my expectation.  I read the history on the lunch menu and was surprised to not have gone here sooner.  The place is very upscale casual, service was above average and the pizza was out of this world. I ordered the most popular (according to our server) which I cant recall the name but it was the salami pizza and he added jalapeno and an egg which was all surprisingly over the top VERY GOOD.  I like it when they tell me the popular menu items and how people order it.  Turned out to be super awesome and cant wait to come back.   I would take a date here or a casual lunch meeting.  Oh yeah, the cauliflower appetizer was pretty good but I think it is a little over-hyped on Yelp.   I will have to come back with the wife soon so I can try some other options.  It was a little pricey but well worth the cost for the great food and service.

ZRb9XT7hX2I57B_ZNo-NBw.text: I took my girlfriend here for a date. We ordered a meat & cheese board, Caesar salad and meat lovers 12" pizza...OMG, everything was so amazing. And, the staff was exceptional. We will definitely be coming back...very soon

2E7pMlbt9A8BuG7FyXWnPA.text: Pizza was great and the atmosphere was what I was looking for.  The customer service was excellent.  Management is doing a great job of communicating this to their employees.  We had no complaints.  We will definitely bring the rest of our family next time.

43urEfoaBgjsuJ6vIEv2oA.text: I LOVE The Parlor!!  It's got charm and a fun sort of swanky-big-city meets home-town-charm atmosphere and fun staff.  Check out the herb garden on the way in and the features from the old beauty parlor! Perfect for a date night or hh with the girls!   And the food!! Oh the food!  Prepare to leave stuffed but it will be one of the best meals you've had in a long time!    Start with the cauliflower or brussles sprouts, maybe share a parlor insalata.  They change out specials seasonally that are always delicious and innovative, but the staples are my favorite.  If you are feeling pizza, go for the calabrian, a spicier more sophisticated cousin of the classic pepperoni.    My all time favorite is the pappardelle bolognese, I have yet to have a bolognese that even comes close, and the wide delicious pappardelle pasta is made in house, truly a MUST!    Can't choose, get a few things in the smaller sizes and try to save room for dessert!

PhPovUrWaZMBIugj9-8R_w.text: Favorite pizza place in Arizona. I stop here every time I'm in Phoenix and it's always phenomenal. I highly recommend the pizza specifically the bbq chicken, fungi, or my favorite the salsiccia. They have a pretty good wine and beer list as well. I've always had great service here they never try to rush you through when it's busy. The parlor also has some of the best tiramisu you can find, it doesn't have any twists on it just a really well done classic dessert. Overall a very good restaurant.

UGNd-RVuIhki8dVvWCOgeQ.text: This place is great. Service and management killed it. Had some issues with the order  (kitchen mishap)  and they treated us like royalty and came through more then they needed. The food was great and leftovers were amazing!   Thanks team. we will be back

LldextFZa85JddMi9If1aQ.text: Tried this place for a co-workers birthday lunch. It did not disappoint! It was SO amazing! I had their margarita pizza and had a sample of their Funghi pizza, both were to die for! We also ordered historic undercover cucumber pilsner and it was like nothing I've ever had before! Light and refreshing!

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margarita Pizza
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Historic Undercover Cucumber Pilsner

6Q6nbn-nj8C313kFedM4Gg.text: Pizza is great! however, it is not the best thing in this place. First order an Alcatraz, if they have any left, and then order their bolognese... its the best in town

coYUS3ONyBDKc8hCg-3GEQ.text: Great food and atmosphere!  We had the cauliflower to start and then shared the lamb ravioli and a pizza to share and then finished with the tiramisu.   All the food was Awesome!

3HLPEt9YrQLv1SvuFOrI7w.text: For my 200th review, I finally stopped at the Parlor.  Funny thing in 15 years I've never taken notice of it.  I thought it was a small hair salon lol.  Once we walked in though realized this was going to be one of my regular restaurants.  Had a meat and cheese selection for an appetizer, great flavor.  I had a pasta dish with big chunks of bacon crunchies and red sauce, tres yum.  It was very busy but the noise level was great.  They also let you design your own pizza.  Great place and close to me=my new fave.

Pdgu4zomPzW9uR1THn17Cw.text: My boyfriend and I came in around 8:00pm on a Friday and we were seated within 5 mins, our waitress was so sweet and high energy! We ordered the large farm greens salad and split it! Definitely enough for two hungry fit people; plus, we ordered the bbq chicken pizza 8inch (also to share). The salad and pizza are absolutely delicious. The BBQ chicken pizza is unlike any other BBQ chicken! We closed our eyes and enjoyed! The atmosphere of the parlor is great for a weeknight, with dim lighting and candle lit tables--definitely great for a date night or just to grab some amazing food and enjoy fabulous service! Thank you! We love the parlor! It's our second time here now and they've treated us well!

8ywIxfiEfBnv0d9fYGEjdg.text: You know this place is amazing when the pizza at The Parlor is better than ANY pizza you've had in Italy..

43VzVqtp9LE-Cowihvr48g.text: I love this place. Great pizza and happy hour is awesome. The corn pizza is spicy and delicious and the white sangria amazing and refreshing. The wait staff are friendly and prompt. I have only had good experiences.

RK4BKmyQzXHgmuZ7pO0jNQ.text: My dining companion built his own pizza and I had the puttanesca pizza (shrimp, calamari, fennel, etc).  I liked everything except the fennel.  The spicy tomato sauce was nice too.  We got the House salad for a starter.  The small size was plenty large for both of us to share.  Nothing too remarkable about the salad, but I did enjoy it.  Since our pizzas took so long to get out to us, they gave us free dessert, which was really considerate -- we didn't even have to mention that the food took a long time or anything, they just noticed and took the initiative themselves.  We ordered the maple trifle which was really interesting.... it came with chunks of date cake, whipped cream, nuts.  Not my favorite dessert but they get points for trying something different!

5RQxGtaZ5rpn7ZW8XdADYQ.text: Cas on the date night pizza Parlor. This is the place. I love this Camelback place. Has a cute outdoor fireplace. Cool microbrews; nice wines. Best part... trendy eats. Antipasto...meat and cheese platters. All things I love on date nights. Pizzas are singular, in case your down with the funghi and he's all in for the meaty. Sandwiches, pastas, salads are very robust. Cut to dessert..or don't.. like me.. I drink my wine for dessert.  Awesome staff to recommend what you may or may not know. No rush service. Trendy, vibrant ambience. Lively like it should be for the trendy area it is.  So yummy. I was a pig pigster and ordered an extra singledom and took one home last time for the next day!

sgFgIsFekFEj7u4u29viEQ.text: My wife and I ordered two different items and shared. I ordered the Puttanesca Pizza. It had squid, shrimp, tomatoes, garlic, onion, capers, olives, and fennel. Cooked to perfection. My wife ordered seafood linguini which had shellfish, tomato, zucchini, and acqua pazza. If time and tummy space were unlimited we would have tried everything on the menu. It's that good.

U4Nz6uayLjzqNEjGEFmPkA.text: This place has Good Pizzas.  We ordered a total of 4 different Pizzas and couple of appetizers. BBQ Chkn Chkn Pesto Pepperoni and Salsicsa. Have to say the best one was Peperoni.  The Califlower Gratin was great and Calamari was Good.

kZ5r-XgFPGTGACdL9q0-Hg.text: Uhm, YUM. I celebrated my 30th birthday here & they were very accommodating with a reservation for a large group on a weekend. I am mostly-a-pescetarian, but the pepperoni pizza here is to die for. The salads are also fantastic - my favorite is the beet salad. As I recall most of the salads come with meat on them, but I'm sure any of them could be ordered without it. The decor/ambiance are very hipster-adorable & the staff has been friendly & laid back. I'll definitely be back!

Kemp_9nmIu0A5bBXkKmuCA.text: This place is a home-run.  I knew as I walked in the door.  Archtecture is killer.  Barternder is a pro (known him from other places).  Food was fantastic, and very reasonably priced.  If you like like AZ88, anything from Craig DiMarco, Hanny's, Anything from Chris Bianco... you will love this new restaurant.

3j0srBScfJ4J3IKWkKZAqw.text: this place is awesome. GO. & soon - already decent wait times.   OH, pitches of pbr for 7 bucks. yeah, yeah. shut up.  GO GO GO.

XZS_X-9bsw2bJrUjVUzuEQ.text: What? Yes that. You said? Who did that? When?  Ben? I don't know anyone named Ben?  Oh... is this annoying to you?  Well it sure as hell is to everyone at our table who can't hear a damn thing in this place.  Concrete walls, wood everywhere, and loud music that people are determined to talk over - all combined they make this like going to a live concert.  Maybe the 20-something kids don't mind this but I think the adult customers will probably find it annoying as I did.  On the whole, this place is better than the nearby competition (Oreganos).  Better decor, better beer choices, better quality food, and slightly better parking (only slightly, it still sucks at Parlor).  The cauiflower with aged cheddar cheese was quite tasty, but only came with 1 small piece of bread.  Pizzas were above average but not great - our crusts were burnt, and it felt like Sunday morning when I get to be the one who eats up the burnt pieces of toast.  Cheeses & herbs/seasonings were good, but with the build your own I wish I had known I was going to pay individually for mozzerella cheese.  Would it have had no cheese if I had not checked that box?  Isn't cheese included in the base price of a pizza?  They have a far better than average draft beer list, including 2 offerings from Four Peaks, a few imports, and the obligatory macro-swill that so many Americans prefer.  Great that they had HopKnot.  Prices were reasonable and service was average.  The female server "uniform" of a skin tight white shirt should not be worn by everyone.  It looked great on the thin girls, but for the others it just highlighted the spare tire that shouldn't be there when you're that young.  Drivers of nice cars are forewarned - the spillover parking is pretty much gravel, with some of the spots quite narrow, and don't be surprised to see some inconsiderate customers parking illegally and almost blocking you into your spot.  They don't take Discover Card.

tY-wCqEmiHrPd7vQSa4Pag.text: A friend recommended this place and so I decided to try it for lunch. I ordered the Roasted Corn pizza and it was delicious. The atmosphere here is very nice and I would definitely recommend this place to others. My friend had the Margherita and he thought it was ok. Although I disagree. Only negative here is the service. For some reason, it was incredibly slow, even though the place was not that busy. We had to wait for 30 minutes after we were done to get the check and another 20 min to find a pen that worked to sign them. Maybe this was an off day. Overall great pizza and good atmosphere.

WbkO1cZvprEVTUq1SBGKHA.text: So, Ive been drivng by this place for years...and when it came time to decide where to go for dinner...well it slipped my mind. All I can say is it wont slip my mind any longer...  It is a very nice spot. Dimmed lighting and great decor. Modern   The Food was excellent. We ordered the calamari, a dinner size portion salad and split it, and a pasta dish...everything came out perfect and service was prompt. Very friendly waitstaff.  Only negative was the seats...all of us would of had more drinks and stayed longer but they were not too comfortable. Otherwise it was a great dining experience. We will be back...hopefully they get some cushions :-)

K5x5U2IJwBL0qTXc11LP4Q.text: Amazing food and great atmosphere! This is our go to place in Central Phoenix!

gamNd0N2a8SzLVUW2V9f9g.text: Born to an Italian family I'm pretty tough on Italian food. I ordered the seafood linguine and was very pleased.

z2pRK_wbcKz-fO-9BBdKXw.text: I have been needing to write this for a while but been in the hospital and sick so this is a month late. So back in October I decided I needed a little bit of a change from the usual pizza joints my family and I go to. I had seen this place on TV (Check Please) and it looked pretty good. Oh my Hannah Montana this place is banging like a biscuit. I have pictures which I will add later but I do recommend this place for a date and for a chill night out. This place is cozy, quaint and very delish so come hungry and you will leave happy.

9yh9iyvt3e6_wb8fx-gVdg.text: There is a reason The Parlor gets so many great reviews. This restaurant has delectable food and has such a fun atmosphere. We went here about a year ago when it first opened and it was jammed packed with beautiful people. This time we went on a Saturday afternoon for lunch and it was still delicious but with a much more mellow vibe.   Definitely try the garden mojito. It is really refreshing and the cucumber and fresh mint are what makes the drink. Brandon, my fiance, loves that they have cold PBR for $2.50 on tap.   All of the salads sound terrific but we decided on the parlor insalata for me and the farm greens for Brandon. Both salads were made with very fresh ingredients and a big portion for a small sized salad. The salads are even perfect by themselves for a lunch entree.  We were going to try and design our own pizza but decided we should leave this job to the professionals and went with the smokey pizza (ricotta cheese, prosciutto and arugula). It was amazing! The crust is perfect- light, crispy and tasty.   I love the Parlor , I only wish it was open on Sundays and that the parking situation wasn't so crappy. Lucky for me this place is within walking distance so we will be back for sure!

8PUzGJJLztmXD-s09jGUBw.text: Seriously, how did this place get so many reviews in such a short amount of time?  Were we all just dying for a new place in CenPho or what?  Anyways, we finally went to the Parlor which opened while we were off staying cool in Washington, and I feel like we are late to the party.  Everyone has covered just about every aspect of this place.  Walking up, you see the garden where they grow herbs, eggplant, tomatoes, peppers, and a few other goodies that they use for specials.  Inside, the place has been renovated wonderfully and it is beautiful.  The old 60's-style wall is really made into the centerpiece of the restaurant and I love everything about it.  I tried the Watermelon Agua (vodka + watermelon juice) and it was amazing.  Be had the eggplant bruschetta and it was a wonderful combination of sweet and tart.  Brilliant!  We also ordered a pepperoni pizza and a potato pizza.  The pepperoni was by far the best because the meat was perfectly spicy and, I imagine, from Schreiners.  Finally, we had some lemon pudding with raspberries with a ginger cookie.  Strange combination but excellent.  The food was outstanding and our server was one of the best I've ever had.  Can't say enough about how great this place is.  Glad to have it and ESPECIALLY glad to have it by the Colonnade (which is a culinary vacuum.

KQlI_m2CtGY9u4aeYkzjOQ.text: What a fantastic tuna sandwich (Sicilian Tuna Melt: preserved Sicilian tuna, capers, olives, cheddar, Romesco [sauce], arugula, $10.50) with salad. Very useful for a quick to-go lunch, though a bit higher priced than the average. Great atmosphere; I look forward to eating here and to ordering the pizza.

PioSZAwo-L3aIT3ojiGF6g.text: Too bad they don't have parking and require you to use Valet, and wait it line too? There must be a better idea. Sorry I didn't get past that rule and see what was inside.

kvCJOYNyWyMEgermaSDM2g.text: My friend and I wanted to try this place and was I impressed . From the food ,staff and the awesome patio ! Check this place out if you get the chance

aXMHJTc1FKbUppt_ZFRz3g.text: You know, this place has now surpassed Grimaldi's for me. Their pizza is exceptional. Great selection of toppings and a great atmosphere.  Just go man. Just go.

guiT8t4NZqG2ck6UW1AB3g.text: Excellent service, atmosphere and food. Oh, and the beer on tap is great, too! Love this place!

juwdhoiAW2c6ixBvXVRUdA.text: I have now visited The Parlor twice; once on a Thursday evening and once on a Friday evening. Right off the bat, I love the inconspicuous nature of The Parlor, you could drive by 3 times and still never really see the presence of a hustlin' bustlin' hip pizzeria.   Parking at new & hip restaurants is normally a bear to say the least, but some wonderful and efficient thought was put into the design, making the experience of tackling parking, a whole lot less stressful.  As you walk in (dont miss the fresh herb garden on your righthand side), you cant help but feel the modernist and contemporary stylings.....its the VIG and LGO Pizzeria blended into a wonderful concoction.  During the first visit, we sat on the patio around 530pm. Yeah, it was 105 frickin degrees outside, but with the mist system they have cooling the air and fresh plantings it was quite comfortable. We enjoyed appetizers and a meat/cheese plate to start, and then a pizza with oliver tempanade, Schrieners sausage, and gorgonzola cheese. All of the food was light, fresh, and filling.  A satisfying first trip.  Round two was on a busy Friday night, around 745pm. Expecting to wait an hour, we were pleasantly surprised that it was just a 20 minute wait for a party of two. In the meantime we enjoyed a glass of wine at the bar and spent half our time watching Sportscenter and half our time people watching... after being seated in the main dining room, instead of trying another meat/cheese combination or appetizer, we dove head first into 2 pizzas and a bottle of vino. We tried the traditional pepperoni and then the yukon gold potato pie. Again the food was fresh, well cooked, and served in a timely manner.  The Parlor should be your new pizza epicenter if you like friendly service, fresh tasting food, and a centrally convenient location.

mW8l5i9TwTjU0M0x9MCF4A.text: We had a wait but hanging at the bar made up for it.  The pizza was tasty, although it didn't hold it's shape.  Loved the decor and vibe will definitely go again.

eqPaP6BBPFCwpE-skdnZtQ.text: I have been to The Parlor three times in the past couple of weeks, and everything I have tried has been excellent.  First, the pizza's.  I have had the Margherita, and it is sublime.  The hot wood-fired oven makes the crust perfect, and the taste of the bread is wonderful.  Same goes for their twist on the BBQ Chicken pizza salad.  Instead of raw red onions, you get grilled shallots.  Some heat is added with serrano chiles to give it wonderful heat in the back of your mouth.  The cheese they use is also great, and it is among the best pizza's in town (which is saying something with places like Bianco and Patsy Grimaldi's in the valley).  For sandwiches/burgers, I had the brie and mushroom burger, which is divine.  The fries are also top-notch (ask for the garlic aioli on the side).  The Duck Club is another instant favorite of mine, with applewood bacon, garlic aioli, and red-wine jam.  The flavors just explode on your first bite.  Finally, the soup I had was great.  It was a split-pea and braised pork soup topped with a dollop of creme fraiche.  The velvety flavors of this soup must come from the fat in the pork.  Don't worry about calories and just order it if it is on the menu.  The decor is great as well, and when it cools down in the valley, it will be a great place for outdoor seating.  Service isn't the best, but I am sure they will improve as time goes on.  Not only do I love this restaurant, but everyone I have taken there has also fallen in love with it.  I am sure it will be a Phoenix institution for years to come if they keep their innovation and quality up to par.

C2xegIuyINEBalETsVat_A.text: When I first heard of this restaurant I was soooo excited especially due to the fact that that the owners father is a owner of a nello's pizza. So I thought this would be the younger modern fusion of pizza. I loved the location and decor of this restaurant it was very inviting and I loved the fact that they carried LUX coffee since that is some good coffee. The pizza is another story I really didn't feel they matched flavors well duck with citrus and and too many herb mixings on all the pizzas we got. we also found hair in one of the pizza's which I got really grossed out after that and I didn't want to continue eating anymore. Overall great decor/ambiance, music and coffee is great but I will not be back after the whole pizza incident.

xXDGr9EUM8NflNL_K418QQ.text: Went to the parlor last night with my boyfriend. We showed up at 6pm and there was a 20 minute wait. I guess you can't make reservations unless your party consists of 10+ people.   Now why does everyone else give this place 5 stars and I give it 4? The food is definitely 5 star food. It's DELICIOUS. My boyfriend got the pizza which was fresh out of the brick oven, bubbly, and full of cheese. The star of the show was my sandwich! I got the "grinder" which had 'seasonal vegetables' provolone cheese, and salami on it. It came with a ton of parmesan and herb dusted fries. The sandwich was on a soft roll, dripping in a vinaigrette that the vegetables had been soaked in until tender. You would think that putting carrots, celary, bell peppers, and cauliflower on a sandwich would be disgusting, but it was ah-maz-ing. I couldn't stop eating it. My stomach was about to explode when finally I asked for a box. Made great leftovers.  I knock 1/2 star off for their non existent appetizers. When I eat pizza, I want some garlic bread. There were no appetizers on the menu. They gave you a paper for cheese & meat which came with rosemary bread, but that's just not my style.  Another 1/2 star was knocked off for the restaurant being short staffed. I felt so bad for our waiter. She was running back and forth, looked stressed, and was waiting way too many tables for her own good.   But the food is de-lic-ious. I'll be back.

kCPK-gUqTMcEOA9eXPJ7Bw.text: Met some colleagues for lunch on a Wednesday.  The server was prompt, polite, and perfectly engaged.    Our spinach salad came out quickly and was perfectly tossed in a lovely presentation.  The lettuce was fresh and the vegetables were fresh.    We ordered the Funghi and the Yukon.  The pizzas were slightly burned at the edges, but the burn actually enhanced the flavor of the mixture of vegetables on the pizza.  We had the donut hold type dessert.  Amazing.  Delicious.  I cannot wait to go back.

w8nwkJG0wsOc3Lkb3np88A.text: Just took my wife here a couple of weeks ago for a night away from the kids.  The wait is long, but the food is worth it, great pizza and other stuff. The service was good, considering how crowded they were, but I would have to come back during the week at lunch or dinner to really see if the employees have the kind of attention to detail to make you come back.  I would definitely go back with my wife, but would not bring my whole family when it is that crowded. Kids would ruin the experience when the wait is that long.  Drinks were also tasty, check out the bar menu...if that suits you. Enjoy! PS My favorite place is Cafepino, because the food is also excellent, but I get consistently great service, and don't have the extended wait. My wife needed a change from Cafepino (that is my "go to"" place; so I made this a nice date nite, and she had a great time. If you want to catch the movie though, than Cafepino is a better choice...

B-dtY0aksWyYsbZdU88uww.text: This place just made my COOL PATIO list - good in summer or winter the way it is set up!  very neato!  Menu offerings were fresh and tasty sounding without getting obnoxiously trendy!  We had spinach salad lightly dressed with EVOO, next time I would ask for a sprinkle of balsamic to add at the table but that's just me.  Shared a Margherita Pizza, liked the crust a lot, nice chewy rind.  They have a small garden area outside, not sure if its for looks or if I just ate some of it - either way its a nice touch!  Friendly service, no rushing us from the table, will definitely return and bring friends.  IN fact, already booked two lunch dates in JANUARY!  Happy New Year to me, found a new LOCALLY owned restaurant!

DZTYZnbXw0qbgXwed38oiw.text: One of the few restaurants I rarely tire of. The only pizza place where the dough and cheese that constitutes one of their delicious pizzas never leaves me feeling tired, groggy, and gross afterward. How do they do that? I love pizza, but most of the time, eating it (eating too much of it...) is physically taxing and leaves me wanting to nap and flog myself for getting into a situation where i'm going to feel full and uncomfortable for hours on end after the meal. But this pizza, though more than satiating, is cloudlike, easier to digest, and airly floats rather than settles rock-like in the stomach. How often is pizza compared to a satiating cloud? Not often!!  I love the atmosphere of this restaurant too, though if the food were mediocre or bad, the stars above would reflect that. The atmosphere only adds a sixth star if that was an option. The Parlor used to be a beauty parlor, which everyone knows by now, but no one knows that my grandma used to get her hair done there.  I love their appetizers. The bay shrimp in the frito misto melt in the mouth, and even the calamari is not rubbery.  The salads are not just afterthoughts here. The parlor insalata is almost as good as the pizza, which crispy chickpeas, fresh greens, kalamata olives, flavorful tomatoes (not bland red chunks of what looks like tomato), feta, lovely vinaigrette dressing, and probably a few other ingredients i am forgetting.   I could go on and on. But I won't....Just wanted to add to the other compliments toward this locally owned restaurant.

f2bL80RANSfuCawPqhKqYA.text: i have been here many times and never been disappointed. i have tried most of their pizzas, appetizers and salads and am completely satisfied with the consistent quality and deliciousness of absolutely everything.  the duck pizza is back on the menu (though changed slightly) so get it while you can.  makes a nice pairing with the pumpkin porter, which is also only available seasonally.  this is one of my favorite restaurants in the city. there is never a bad time to go to the parlor - perfect for every occasion!  (it's kind of hard to see the first time around - look for the neon sign on a nondescript concrete wall)

px9kQaYnt8vwWCW43ZBu3g.text: This place is really cool, especially if you sit at the "pizza bar."  Great atmosphere, fun watching pizza-stretchers and the assembly.  The beet salad is good but over-priced for $10.  The potato pizza was just OK, would order something else.  A lot of the pizzas looked very good.  I don't think they're wood fired (just brick-oven/gas-fired).  The Brussels sprout app is very good.  Would order again, and want to try the Cauliflower grantinata one next time.  Service is good, vibe is good, just a great all-around experience.

cydfSznyu3B9MAkUKpvhKg.text: I was on yelp looking for a good pizza joint in my new area and found something so much better "The Parlor" My boyfriend had mentioned this place before and I said something snarky like "The Parlor of what ... what is it a massage parlor..."   My Deepest Apologies to The Parlor!!!!!   This place is awesome. Our first visit we ordered a selection of cheese and meats, the beet salad, the veal ravioli and the cherry zeppole. The atmosphere is comfortable and casual, there were all ages and kinds dining.  Nummy cheese and meat! Beet salad was good and fresh, the veal ravioli was bowl licking good. (and YES he did it twice) the desert was soo good. Gorgeous little round nuggets of sweet, tender, fluffy, light, cherry goodness. I can't say enough about this place. You have to go and see for yourself. We will be back and we will eventually order everything off the menu!  Oh yea and we were out the door for under fifty dollars!

nov4iZdKP8RHU0GgTpK9fQ.text: I can't stop raving about The Parlor! A group of 6 of us met for dinner here on NYE & I'm thrilled that we did.  I was blown away by 3 AMAZING appetizers that we ordered: Arancini (crispy risotto ball), the Cauliflower Gratinata & Bruxelles (brussel sprouts w/ pancetta). The Zeppole and Carmel Pears & Apples which we had for dessert were just average in comparison with the other food. Next visit I probably won't save any room for dessert. You can find pictures of all 3 apps that have been posted by various reviewers!  This place used to be a beauty parlor but doesn't resemble a pizza "parlor" in looks at all. No checkered red & white table cloths here! We sat out on the covered patio with vine covered walls & candles. I think sometime it would be fun to sit inside & watch the pizza-stretchers and the pizza assembly. Looking forward to going back!

mMR9DHNkqwnlNcDIaC9wgg.text: Ok, so a friend went here last week and got a severe case of food poisoning, involving a hospital visit HUH? HMMMM, 0-2 so I think that' s it for me  trying this place again. I will have to take back my original promise to eat here again.  I am at a loss as to why the great reviews.

TSSWXTynmyCTlTpAOn2mIg.text: My wife and I really like The Parlor. The food is unique, tasty and very well put together. The service is excellent. Everyone seems happy and they are very polite. Also, on busy weekend nights they have complementary valet parking. Take advantage of it or you will not find a space. And even though it is complementary be sure to give the guys a few bucks because they are so darn polite!  The only downside is that the prices are kind of high. Not outrageously high but getting up there a little bit. Our last visit with another couple we ordered two medium pies and we each had two drinks - the bill (including 20% tip) came to $130. This is not a corner pizzeria type place so don't expect corner pizzeria prices.  Also, we took our 7 year old daughter here once and she was not a fan. Even the items on the kids menu have unusual flavoring and most kids prefer plain food. A kids personal pizza with three gourmet cheeses on it. Nope!  We let her try three different items from the kids menu and she had a hard time with each of  them.  Overall this is a great place for date night or a casual get together with friends but leave the kids at home!

hpJE-PBFCWQenSyKtjFesg.text: Great local place that is a must to try if you are in town visiting. The atmosphere is relax and not like any other place. The menu has a good selection on it and everything is yummy. They also have a cute patio, does not seat very many people so consider yourself lucky if you get a seat out there.

wZWiD7vEmpYWx8WGZZnjrA.text: Mmmmmmm pizza.   We came here for girlfriend lunch on a Tuesday and sat at a table in the bar.  It wasn't as busy as I thought it would be at lunchtime near the busy Biltmore business area.  The space is beautiful, keeping True to many of the designs of mid-century buildings found in this area of town with a modern update.   The pizza was great.  We shared a pepperoni that was definitely cooked in a fire oven.  Delicious!  What has had me craving since that visit, however, was a starter.  We shared a cauliflower gratinata.  Yeah, that's right.  I'm craving CAULIFLOWER.  The veggies are baked with cheese and breadcrumbs.  It's just like old fashioned macaroni and cheese, but with a little bit of nutritional value to it.  All that cheese counteracts any good the cauliflower would give your body; but my reasoning suggests the lack of pasta makes this dish an awesome healthier alternative to the old comfort food staple.  I'm hooked and will be back for dinner when I can enjoy some wine with my pizza and cauliflower.

QSrhUxooAQwou_ikQHhguQ.text: I will give them one more star...I actually dared to go back with my friend Jen a couple of weeks ago.  My luck: I got the same waiter.  My hair looked completely different, so you should have seen my shock that he actually remembered me. (And made a joke about giving me the correct check this time)  The one more star is for Tony the Waiter for being super cool....and not poisoning me.

VBp3TGB1w1FNMNkLatWiJQ.text: The Parlor was amazing! The reviews were spot on. I went alone and the bar staff was awesome. I had the Spicy Seafood Pasta (Regular size) and it was delicious and just spicy enough to be great. I topped it off with Dales Pale Ale. Any bar with Dales as a draught beer. I wanted a specific dessert, and then they told me that they were out of it after I had ordered. The manager apologized and paid for another dessert on the house. I will definitely be back.

CJJV9cRIprUUWdG0K_j9Bg.text: Pizza was fantastic! Great fresh item menu. Great craft beer selection amazing wine selection. Ask for Michael at the bar to make the perfect cocktail.

Gyj3J0XafXaZ6BkXEcBYqw.text: We had a group of 8.  We were sat quickly.. SWEET!  The ambiance very west elm, loved it. The service was great and very attentive, my drink was refilled without ask.  And one time, I did not even know it was refilled...  Ninja waiters?   We order the meat and cheese appetizer... YUM!  I ordered the pepperoni pizza...  Thin crust, cheese is just right amount, not cheap on the pepperoni, and the basil was fresh...  Need to drag my foodies girls to this place...

HNr0zq2lCGhq3NdSq9PyDA.text: OK so I will admit the hype kept me at bay. I prefer to wait for the hype to blow over but when it doesn't I'm forced to attend the establishment of said hype. Sometimes I get the hype. Sometimes I wonder who slept with the devil to get the hype. In this case the hype is well founded & the Dbag patrons in full force. Everyone & I mean everyone was everywhere. They were squished in on a Friday night at prime time dinner time on a lovely 110 degree AZ day waiting in every available space inside & out.  This is reminiscent of my other hype induced bad service nightmare at another pizza place. Which left me pizza happy but not worth the 2 hour wait. Yes I said 2 hours. While I'm shaking this off all the while standing in front of the "hostess" station.  I realize not only did I have a whole moment & came to after said moment to see not one of the  1-2-3 women at the "hostess" station had awknowledged me or my hubs. DE JA freaking VU! My hopes sink to the floor & the only beacon of hope is the bar I can see packed to the gills. I'm hoping they will have a frosty beverage to make it up to my hubs. We... no he,  tries like hell to get us a couple of our fave Four Peaks brews for the 40 - 60 minute wait. He returns to me with them & I've lost myself again to a Dbacks game. I'm also doing my best sumo wrestler impression (as lady like as humanly possible) to take up as much space  so nobody horns in on my 2 seats I'm stalking.  I end up having my small victory & have some Dbag old bag ditch her "undrinkable" martini in a space 2x the space available next to my elbow. I move it & she looks at me like I smell bad  (& I don't) vs. saying thanks for moving your elbow. Irritating yes but for the Camelback Corridor it's expected. She was probably a "hostess" in her college days.  After her I put my guards that I seem to have lost recently & am perfectly oblivious to the Dbag fraction.  Enter dinner. The bartender was wonderful as a server & bartender. Very attentive & complimentary on the food choices we ordered that he liked. He made the infractions of the Dbag patron & staff disappear. We started out with & something I would highly reccomend the Polipo which was perfection. There was even enough Polipo sauce left over after our Funghi pizza to sop up with the wonderful pizza crust. The meal was ended on a sweet note with the Mixed Berry Zeppole. Just awesome through & through. On a busy busy Friday night the bar service was great, beer was cold, antipasti everything it should be, great pizza & a sweet ending. I will be back to try what I'm sure will promise to be a great meal. When I do return I'm taking a grilfriend & we're going at an off peak time (if there is one) & enjoying myself at a table. I know I'm such a rebel.

ChXzmEWL7yVmzSeKGCVN4w.text: I really like this place, great pizza, nice friendly staff, the happy hour it's awesome..

afevynUG9Idbt_gbqRxrvQ.text: One of my favorite pizza places. They easily accommodate larger groups. They have a small garden on their patio where they get some of their veggies. Always fresh and seasonal food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Ea8erVepva1zC8XDJACtEg.text: Pronounced with your best NY accent... "Tha Pah-lah"   I'm a sucker for most things Mid-Century modern... and the Parlor is a damn cool building with great decor.  The beer selection is decent.  Nothing crazy, but some good rotating taps.  Always a good Sierra.  And, i love Red Nectar on tap.  Just a good smooth ale for the summer.  Also a nice rotating wine list, pretty good for a pizza place.   Check the chalk board by the bar... whatever is on special is worth trying.  usually something locally grown and seasonal.  Always a good choice!  My Top Picks here: Best Pizza: Smokey.  Best Salad:  Heirloom Tomato Best Sandwich i've ever had in my life: Duck Club  Thats right... i've even been here on several occasions, all by myself, just to pop in after work, sit at the bar and indulge in the Duck Club and a pint after a long day at work.    The duck isnt gamey.  The tomato jam isnt as sweet as i expected.  (Certainly way more savory than the tomato jam that Postino's makes and uses on their bruschetta) the Bacon is thick cut and fantastic.   This is, hands down, my favorite sandwich in Phoenix.  Give it a shot!  Enjoy!

DQSzwmZ7N-Ri3sYDzjtYHg.text: Solid from start to finish.  Phoenix has a ton of good pizza places with good atmospheres from federal, bianco, cibo, base, forno... the list goes on.  The parlor happy hour (3-6) features $5 red & white sangria we enjoyed!  We ordered our happy hour pizza ($7) and shared a small order of bolognese.  Everything was nice & hot with good flavor.  We tried the sauccision and pepperoni pizzas yum!  You get a half price dessert when you check in on Yelp so we had to do the chocolate bundt cake wth cherries.  Awesome whipped cream but I prefer layer cakes.  They have French press coffee or espresso drinks featuring local lux coffee my favor!  All in all, friendly and attentive service with quality food at a reasonable price.  Even off happy hour their pizzas range from $10-13 unlike some of my other trendy places that charge $20-$25 a pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French press &amp; cake
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Top is red sangria &amp; pepperoni pizza with a salsiccia and white White Sangria

cQiQPMv_yrpEgFEiXf4bag.text: Service has been excellent, food is marvelous and ask for Angel he is the best. I believe our servers name was Garris. The salmon was fresh, done to perfection and very tasty

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dinning room area, The Parlor

khrLsQ3Qj8e56AWqdPPXAw.text: The Parlor is the best. I come here at least once a week. The service is excellent, the pizza crust is tasty and not soggy. Yesterday we ordered 2 8" pizzas and one of them had applewood bacon on it. This just made it better than usual. The salads are excellent, fresh and the dressing is slightly sweet but delicious. They the Tiaramasu for dessert, it is the best I have had anywhere.

BuQ15oXBMjDO9mCzhBiQ8w.text: Outstanding pizza and wine list. This was a very pleasant lunch discovery. Service was excellent as was the salad with pickled apples...

Lp1N70BDUhPdlhXFdD8JSw.text: I got the caponatta bruschetta-which was delicious in the first few bites but then the eggplant got very sweet for my taste.  Also got the toscane kale salad--which was pretty good but also a but salty for my taste. Will ask for the dressing on the side next time. Overall, would like to come back and try the other options. Seems like a good place for vegetarians and vegans too!

d00mU7hwLdn075yisn7yXA.text: ...such a cutesy place!!!! Been here twice now with a client.  Great environment to hold those quirky ~ I need your business ~ conversations.    The service is very good.  Non obtrusive.    Menu is nice.  Not too complex.  Able to easily find a dish that won't require too much attention.   Had the Beet Pasta. It was divine.    Definitely worth trying when I can concentrate on the experience

cJLta2EW1oN38i3dbAzsIA.text: Great place for kids and the pizza was spectacular.  We ordered the basic cheese pizza and it couldn't have been better.

otMn6kvTRdAvOqr9A9uy0A.text: We have been here 2 times now and both times the service, food, and ambiance were dead on. This time we had such good service and the food was so well balanced and so fresh that everyone at the table was raving about how good this place was. We had caprese which was easily the best we've ever had. We had the mushroom pizza and the braised pork pasta and they were amazing!!' The kids had pasta and cheese pizza and they wolfed it down so fast then asked for some of the crust from our pizza. I had an old fashioned and my wife had the red sangria we loved them both. Also Monday and Tuesday if you order a bottle of wine and order a large pasta.... the pasta is free!!!!!!! What !!!??? Ya don't go anywhere else. If you love fresh, quality, and well balanced Italian food come here!!! You will not regret it.

5S1KXo00qBHLId0SGKNO1A.text: This place is great!!! Love the spot and the food. The people are even better :) happen to be a neighbor and stoped in. Very glad I did! The place is busy and I can see why. Thanks so much for being a great spot in the neighborhood! Love it A+

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Im7bUr-Cvh72jXK5m3RriA.text: Nice place to catch up with friends. Being a designer I love adaptive reuse projects and absolutely love the decor and the story behind this restaurant.   In the food the mushroom risotto is my favorite, the salads are good. The barbecue chicken pizza is decent but I think I have had better pizzas.

ZLdUWrhUU3M125yM5gKXeQ.text: My second most favorite Italian place m, after "paperoso to go", in NYC.  Food is always amazing here and I usually end up getting their bolognese and a glass of their Malbec.  Their tiramisu is to die for. Highly recommend this place.

yMehJOz5VLTx8wNcRcMujg.text: First time & everything we had was great! Try the oxtail ravioli! Yummy! Service was kind of slow.

zNSr_bvWg0PBKid4ABsmQw.text: When you peruse the menu you will be in conflict as everything looks and sounds so good. I am sure it is! I ordered the duck sandwich. Lots of moist duck and piled high with bacon with butter lettuce and tomato jam. It was SO yummy!  Served with a huge helping of hot crispy fries or a salad. Loved this sandwich. My husband ordered the sausage pizza and said it was great! We also ordered a margarita pizza for our guest. There is a great selection of beer on tap. The service was excellent. We started with choices of meat and cheese served with a couple of different breads. Delicious. It was a very pleasing experience and we will certainly return. The addition of the appetizer platter and beverages did raise our bill to $100 but it is possible to enjoy the food for the reasonable $$ rating. Fresh herbs grown outside the entrance and incorporated into many of the dishes. Lovely place. Great food.

GSHHBGg927qybViifNIn2g.text: When I think of Old Fashioned I think of this place....has nothing to do with the decor. Rather the drinks in this place are on point and out of this world. Had a few with dinner and they were as delicious as I remember. I was meeting friends from University, a reunion of sorts and we all shared a few appetizers, pizza and salads. The Brussels sprouts and cauliflower starters were awesome. The fried calamari though took the cake and made me want to order more helpings. The Salsiccia and the Funghi were our pizzas of choice. Let's just say there were no leftovers for anyone to enjoy later. The salads were eaten up equally as quick. With a large group the service was great however the risotto bowl was a bit small however the dish itself was delicious. This is a safe smart choice for dinner, drinks and atmosphere! Check out the Parlor if you get a chance.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

FEvFM1W1DToYKgvzOJ-FHQ.text: This place has a good, downtown-ish vibe, but beyond that it really wasn't anything special. The food wasn't bad, but it wasn't memorable, either.  The Parlor is the True definition of a three star experience.

RXOmBDi0T2le1MTSTl_Fww.text: Awesome food, delicious pizza and pasta.  They serve draft Kilt lifter four peaks beer!

8FRE8onabdk6JQhoTSk23Q.text: I've been going here for ten years. I always order the mushroom truffle pizza. Service isn't too bad. The restaurant is clean and modern. Bathroom is kind of neat haha!

ZYH2rVwxz5jsrHgqr39tXw.text: This is hands down our favorite restaurant in Phoenix. My husband took me to the Parlor on our first date here when we first met, because it was already one of his favorites. We've celebrated many anniversaries, baby announcements, and regular date nights since then at the Parlor, and here's why: the menu is both consistent and innovative. The best thing on the menu in our opinion is the Spicy BBQ Chicken Pizza, with its tangy sweet BBQ sauce and Serrano peppers. The cheese on this pizza has amazing flavor all on its own! We order this nearly every time we go because it is just so delicious. We also love the Parlor Insalata with its crunchy roasted chick peas and amazing vinaigrette. We could order this pizza and salad every time and leave satisfied (especially with the delicious seasonal cocktail menu! Always lends variety and interest even if you order the same food).   However, why stop with the favorites when there are so many delicious market and seasonal menu items? We love to find out the Market Pizza, and often decide to order one, since the ingredients are seasonal and it's always something new! The pastas are also delicious, our favorite being a winter seasonal, the Sweet Potato Gnocchi with braised short ribs--yum! Our only complaint is that once we went pretty early (during happy hour) and that particular pasta had already sold out (before 6pm!) which was a little disappointing, but shows how delicious it is!  Speaking of happy hour, plenty of good deals to be had there with affordable small pizzas and drinks that make it easier for folks like us to try new menu items while still squeezing in room for our fanorute pizza. Highly recommend this spot for a delicious dinner in Phoenix!

BVH_IfmiNjLurXJVW_6hJA.text: Delicious food and the ambience very nice. Second time here in two weeks and love it.

ojliMmU_2wAbSVn-_1sVKg.text: I'm surprised to be writing this review after reading all the amazing comments. But, we were just not impressed. The place was packed at lunch, which was a good sign. We found a place at the bar and ordered a simple 12" margarita pizza. It took awhile, but that wasn't even the issue. The crust was soft. Like wonder bread soft. It was lukewarm, so it had obviously been sitting for a bit and maybe that's what caused the bread-like bottom, but man. I wanted so much to like this place to add it to the lunch rotation, but with so many other awesome options - this one is a definite no.

L_NdrERkCi26xAvOOyEo1g.text: The food here was really great. I really enjoyed the pizza. I recommend this place over Pizzeria Bianco, which I went to the next day when I was in the area. The Parlor has better prices and better pizza.

8DDBUQRn1kmH-ehBmr_G5g.text: Must try the cauliflower gratinata!! Wow my favorite appetizer ever!  I order this as my main entree all the time. And the wood-baked pizza is one of the best in the valley. Recommend sitting in the patio during fall as they have a cute outdoor sitting area Overall  the atmosphere, food and the staff is great!! Actually the last time I was in was for a bridal shower which was hosted out in the patio. The staff was very nice by letting us have our own space and we were able to decorate for the occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TGbOpx3QuKJzUjxWYx7iiQ.text: Don't be fooled by the outside, it's a cute place for date night.  Lights are dimly lit on the inside and the patio is decorated with globe string lights. My girlfriend and I stumbled upon this place when we missed our reservation at another restaurant. We were pleasantly surprised. We ordered beets salad, bolognese pasta and margherita pizza. Loved the salad and pasta but disappointed in pizza. Pizza was a bit soggy. Probably because of the big slices of tomatoes but tomatoes were good. Would definitely come back when we're in town again.

JEOKI9ymJ8LfvjeNantWlw.text: Yum! I've heard the hype about this place but haven't been until recently! I started with the camelback collins with gin. It was unbelievably refreshing and I believe that it changes depending on the season! On to the entree. I was in the mood for pasta so I got the seafood linguini. And yesss, it hit the spot! It was flavorful without being overbearing. The pasta was fresh, as it's made in house. To finish, i got the tiramisu for dessert. It was the perfect end to my meal. The service was great! They even accommodated us even after we closed out our bill, but then a friend came late and we decided to stay and order more drinks. A great experience, and will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seafood linguini

XMkVZgxC4ReP_xw4bMCYTA.text: I had to leave yet another glowing review for this place...It may not start off the way you think though. We had by far the worst service we have ever experienced at this establishment today. Yep, the 5 stars are NOT a mistake, it's my way of showing appreciation to a place that really does things right and is on point, from my experience on a very consistent basis.   My husband and I love this place and come here on our dates. We have a sitter in place (shout out to my mom and dad for watching our little one so we can have some time as a couple) & naturally came to The Parlor--its our usual spot about once a month or so. We placed our order and waited.   The waiter was ok, which struck us as a little off (they usually go above and beyond immediately). We ordered the garden board (absolutely try this, it is always changing based on what is in season and that is why it's wonderful). We also ordered 2 burgers with a side salad and ranch. Our server didn't check on us and we got our burgers but no garden burger, also the salads came with a sweeter vinegrette (I really don't like sweet tasting dressings). Waiter was still no where to be found so I asked the hostess to help. She was prompt and brought me a new side salad with ranch dressing. We waited for the garden board and still, nothing. It never came. When we saw the waiter getting our bill we noticed that it took him a while.   We assumed he was removing the garden board from our check. He came to the table (finally) but NO MENTION of the garden board. This is what upset me. Everyone makes mistakes, but not owning it really doesn't set well with me.   We paid our tab and I asked the hostess if I could speak with a manager. I didn't want to complain, but they should know about this happening. I let her know we frequent the restaurant and this was certainly an anomaly. I expressed my feelings and she was very professional and polite. To my surprise after asking us to wait a sec, she gave us a voucher to come back on the house & was genuinely sorry for the experience we had.  My husband and I let her know that wasn't necessary and she politely insisted. Again Parlor, you have taken care of your customers well. Way to go and know you have a very loyal customer. Seriously my fellow Yelpers, check this place out ASAP.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie board

sxsAvM1q99lAMnGCKXbuxw.text: I sat at the bar and had great service. Started with salad which had some salami in it. Great and then the bolognese pasta which was fantastic. Ended with tiramisu which might have been my favorite. Rose was tasty and great ambiance which was appreciated.  Will come back soon

rHDMZbQByV6Xh3m9xsnt0Q.text: Tried a new spot in Biltmore last night. Let me start off by saying WOW!!! The pizza was delicious! Dough was fresh, sauce was tasty, and toppings were fresh. Would highly recommend trying it out.   *Phoenix Foodies Approved!

0P-If6DBs-yaaobDJzzQfA.text: It's all good in the neighborhood.  We decided to give The Parlor another go around...and boy am I glad I did.    I was craving some serious old school pizza so we walk into The Parlor. It was a busy night so we had a 15-20 minute wait, not bad considering it was a packed house.   The hostess asked of were thirsty and handed us a glass of water.  It was the best water I've ever tasted. LoL...that's the heat talking but I was so glad she offered. It was a hot one last night.   We were seated pretty quickly and our server Melissa with the amazing smile took our orders quickly.   Plain, well done, extra crispy cheese pizza... Let's see if the parlor can get the simplest pizza made to perfection.    Since each pizza is made to order we had a little downtime. 15 minutes the pizza was hot and bubbling.   My husband grabbed a slice first and his head rolled back....to my surprise he looked up and said: "wow, this pizza just took me back to NYC".  What...that's hard to do.  Then I took a slice....hot, crispy, amazing tangy and sweet sauce the perfect balance and the cheese was just right.    Let's not forget the tiramisu with peanut brittle on top...it had me at first bite.  This cake wasn't too sweet it was perfect for the pallet after you had a cheesy pizza and the peanut brittle was a great added crunch. Well done!   Okay, the parlor, you are definitely worthy of the best pizza in Phoenix.  I'm so glad we gave you a second chance and I will surely be returning with the crew next month.    Yelpers, I must say my first review wasn't the best on the parlor but some establishments are worth a second chance and by far...The Parlor is a third and a fourth chance.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Take home!
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tiramisu... Delicious
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. So good...

VPiniSTjRZjL4-JRSrbbgw.text: I've been to The Parlor many times in the past and was pleased to find things haven't changed! It's always been a wonderful place to get a customized meat & cheese board with a fantastic glass of wine! The atmosphere is contemporary yet warm and inviting, encouraging you to meet up with friends or family to enjoy some fire roasted pizza while you're there! The bathroom takes you back to the Past when it REALLY was a Beauty Parlor with quaint memorabilia! The service was pleasant and prompt with attention to detail! Always have a memorable time there because it's consistently Above my Expectations! Well done- until next time!

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy hour menu
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outdoor dining area is pleasant also with fireplace
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

G_kRKh2mXHUl8-pmAl0RYA.text: Great food and reasonable prices... Will recommend and be back, thank you for the great customer service provided by our host, server, and can't forget the cooks. Thank you

tqdYZHqHRF_8qNKAJrymEg.text: I'm surprised I have not written a review for The Parlor yet as I've had many wonderful meals here. I don't venture too far away from some of my favorite dishes, but those dishes are amazing and I would imagine everything else is as well. The salsiccia pizza is my #1 on the menu, but if I'm going with pasta, I frequent the spicy seafood linguini or the pappardelle bolognese - both are wonderful. Another unique and flavorful pizza is the summer corn, but it is pretty spicy so beware if you're on the fence.   Service is always on point and if the option is available, I love to sit in the bar area. They don't take reservations so sometimes there's a wait, but never anything too lengthy.

tcN78bB7mzcqs-7_vuzIBw.text: This restaurant has been around for awhile now and always a scrumptious choice! Their pizzas are amazing but I usually get their salads and am very happy. The rumor is that it used to be a hair salon (parlor...get it?) but whether True or not a place with a lot of seating, a bar and outdoor space and you can come casual or from work. Recommended!

iALmYHh-5gFMz7u4ygrLQQ.text: Could not let this week pass without leaving a review on my last visit to The Parlor. I must be honest and admit I had not stepped foot here in years, had been meaning to come back and I finally came in. I did not regret it at all, great food, awesome service from our server (Cullen) he was very patient and helpful as I had many questions lol. I could truly say it was an amazing dinner!! We ordered the the cauliflower appetizer I wish it would have been a little softer with a crust from baking but it was delish as it was very satisfying and not overwhelming to where you no longer want your main meal. Next we had  The parlor insalata I was so impressed at how flavorful and crisp it was. Also had the spicy florentine pizza and their pesto pizza add prosciutto. The spicy florentine was sooooooo good and they mean it when they call it spicy so if you don't like spicy maybe try something else. The pesto pizza was delicious as well although I would of liked the prosciutto to be a little more cooked it was too chewy for my liking, other that that the pesto was great not too much,just perfect. I dont know what their pesto is made of but I was satisfied with the flavor. Both pizzas had a crunchy crust which I always look for in a pizza, toppings were fresh..... also our server mentioned a lot of the ingredients used are picked fresh from the owners garden which is pretty awesome and quite interesting. Lastly we had the cheesecake, which was the cherry on top for this delightful dinner. Served with some type of berry compote type also some whipped cream which all together make an amazing dessert. Also the cheesecake is gluten free which is a major plus for me, this cheesecake is not your average cheesecake I highly recommend it!! Over all My return experience was superb and I am looking forward to visiting The parlor in the near future.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Parlor insalata
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cauliflower gratinata
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Charred wood oven cheesecake

yGpJ8rqPdV7JKEuVEaqUdg.text: Great service! Wonderful beet salad and I don't even like beets. The florentine pizza was delightful with many notes- multiple cheeses like ricotta, red pepper  - kind of light on the spinach but you can ask for extra spinach. The chocolate cake is what led us to return.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The chocolate cake is well worth a drive!
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Affagoto  Affogota
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chocolate cake!

W6i0kY9ZZoQdlfw_2ciskg.text: Is pizza supposed to be burnt? Ordered the Salsiccia pizza on a busy Friday night. Now, for me toppings are great, but I'm a carb girl at heart and there is nothing I like more than pizza crust. Unfortunately I couldn't eat any of the crust on my pizza because it was all burnt. Confused, I looked up photos on yelp to find that others had pizza crust just as charred (but no one at our table had burnt pizza). Maybe I'm unrefined and do not understand the way a fired pizza is supposed to taste like in Phoenix, but other pizzas I've tried haven't been as burnt. That aside, the environment of this establishment is pretty cool. The place is definitely bustling on the weekend, so much so that we couldn't find parking and had to park outside of the parking structure a ways away. I always like to find a positive though, and I do feel that staff here are great and they are very attentive to their diners even when it gets so busy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsiccia pizza

c1vOx8rqdSvsme1JDzI59g.text: This was our first time here and it was AMAZING! Phil, our server, was patient with us as it was our first time and made great recommendations and explanation of the menu. The entire restaurant was full, perfect ambiance, and well executed!

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Build your own pizza- olive oil base with handmade mozzarella, seasoned veggies and bacon.

YkSJ_lDZ8Gybde4PIRqiyg.text: The Parlor definitely lived up to the hype! I have passed by this restaurant many times on my drive to work and would have never pictured it as cozy and charming as it is inside! The decor is mainly reclaimed wood with clean and hip accents.   The service, the food, and the atmosphere were all spectacular. Our server greeted us right away and let us know what the most popular dishes were. We split the pesto pasta and the house pizza.
