And though she was not very busy during our mid-afternoon visit she did not bother to (ever) notice we were one set-up short at our table.  Clueless...  The food here is always solid though not a great value.  3.5 star pizzas.  Years ago when first opened they used to be more adventurous and cutting edge with the menu, but these days they have settled on less - interesting 'safe' items geared more towards families and less sophisticated tastes.  Daily happy hour out on their patio is probably the best route:  discounted small pizzas and beer.  Merits 4 stars if coming during happy hour.  And if you hit the skids and fall upon hard times - know that despite your lack of appropriate dress and obvious personal hygene failures -  you and your shopping cart apparently will still be welcome here at The Parlor.  Not sure if you can pay your bill with a giant load of used cans and bottles, though...

H4vaxlsQomY1wLY28XH80A.text: Pizza!  So, pizza is just one of those foods that its hard not to love, dough, sauce, cheese, meat, veggies... its practically the perfect food.  The Parlor is a fun atmosphere and service is always on point.  The pizza is fantastic but I am not sure 2 $$ really actually portrays the pricing, I think its more in the $$$ range.

pMPYX4ff_n66UVCeXLEaWw.text: We go to the Parlor every year with the entire extended family. Each year the service gets slower and slower. We had to speak with the manager twice. Once to get our food after waiting one hour for our food. The second time was to get our check. We will not return to this restaurant.

l9tRZnZcuIohIF65_BKgWQ.text: not impressed. basic wood fire pizza. waiter told me one of their pizzas was voted "best in the country", which i don't believe.  always turned off by the homogeneity of restaurants as this place looked almost "white only" which pretty much reflects the community it surrounds. parking sucks. eh.

0BJogYQ3O5_9XOPbkYbxZg.text: Amazing food!! I had the steak panta-something and it was amazing! The service was great too. My fiance had pasta and that was amazing as well. We finished it off with a banana pudding desert and that was great. Definitely coming back here again!

duNK2sx3zak8cWDf4J1JEg.text: Casual but great place in the neighborhood. They're always friendly and the food is on point every time. Down to the unique touches with their handcrafted cocktails and seasonal menu items which are so consistently creative.  Taylor, one of the mixologist, is extremely meticulous, innovative, and inviting. Another great feature is their patio, especially this time of year! Happy to have this Phoenix staple in the neighborhood.

FUt9J-kF167YOyn6w9xvaw.text: Great service, even better food, and one of my favorite places to eat in town. Everything on the menu is good and the chef's board is a must have!!

z9GwlUEHca5cKL9rYtY3AQ.text: My boyfriend and I went here for dinner last night - it was great! The restaurant itself was really nice, I liked the vibe. They had seating at the bar, indoor seating, as well as a nice patio with outdoor seating. We got there during happy hour on Sunday evening so it was pretty busy, however we still got excellent service and our food came very quickly. We split a mozzarella in corrozza salad to start - it was a nice bed of leafy greens topped with a huge (and I mean huge) ball of breaded and fried mozzarella, all wrapped in prosciutto. It was great (I mean fried cheese, how could it not be?). We took advantage of the happy hour special on 8 in. pizzas. I ordered the 'funghi' which had mushrooms and truffle oil (my all time favorite combo) -delicious! My boyfriend ordered 'the house' pizza which had bacon, kale, and giardiniana - he loved it (I tried a bite and liked it too). The 8 in. pizzas have 6 slices - perfectly sized for 2 people or for one person to have a few slices to bring home and save for later.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Top: The House Pizza. Bottom: The Funghi Pizza.

13LLS_q9Tvo8mGkTKAji7w.text: Service and environment here was really good! The food was okay and a little pricey to me. We had a reservation for a big group and it was easy to make the reservation since it was a weekday. Overall, everything was good but nothing too special.

X9TRSohjm6pyEXv19GLuzg.text: Great from start to finish. Super friendly and attentive waitress, great happy hour prices and everything we ate was top notch. We had the cauliflower gratinata, 2 different salads (spinach and beet), and shared a 8" pepperoni pizza. I'm not sure what took us so long to come here but we will definitely be back!

kHOpwIZMUaKT-Lzq9Ekdvw.text: It is packed all the time here at The Parlor! The food is excellent. There is a wide range of food options on the menu that are all fantastic. It is welcoming to everyone who walks in the door. Come out and try The Parlor.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ExSxFJVWTwnGX9sj38vONw.text: I specifically let them know I was bringing a client in that I was trying to hire and didn't feel that we were passed off appropriately. Food was great and honestly is always. We did the special of $35 for bottle and pasta and the first bartender explained completely differently then what the second bartender had to say or what was on the bill.  I think the bill probably read correctly but I didn't understand it. I wish that things were handled in a better manner especially when I let them know how important this dinner was to me before my client arrived. The first bartender should have introduced us to the person relieving him but instead we were left wondering who was taking care of us and how the bill was changed without letting us know.  When you have been in the industry it just makes it worse and obviously I have higher expectations.  The manager did come by after and really tried to make things right because I was frustrated and at this point it was far too late. Food is always delicious, usually the service is on point, tonight just wasn't our best night. Still love them but left frustrated. I look forward to coming back to a better experience:

fvxrU2bQT3u7Lkz4Fayx9g.text: Went there first time and the food and service was great! Tonight i went and got dennys style service and ordered a glass of wine, the flask looked half full, really skinpping on the wine, will never go there again!!!

XNjvDk77A5jgzmELLV75YA.text: I've been here a number of times and have been satisfied each time. I love going on happy hour because they have a crazy good deal on their personal pizzas and some appetizers. I love the arancini and Frito misto. Pizza is fantastic and last time I went I tried the chai apple zeppole which is like an Italian donut and it was such an amazing and unexpected dessert I would definitely get that again next time I go. I also really love the ambiance of the restaurant and I think it's super cool how they have fresh herbs growing in their garden right in from of the restaurant. Highly recommend this place!

l5RRuEkVznyHdM2IzhVlBg.text: I dig The Parlor.  Their pizzas are great, olives are awesome... Oh man, the brussel sprouts appetizer on special last weekend was the best I've had.  On this last visit I also tried their Manhattan for the first time.  Good thing I did... I have finally found a place (other than Citizen Public House) with a great manhattan!  It was Woodford Reserve, with the perfect amount of bitters, and a marasca cherry on a sprig of toasted rosemary.  Mmmmmm! Service has always been polite and prompt.  The place has a nice seat yourself bar area where you can booze it up (as long as you have a DD) and wait for your table.  And if you have a big party/larger group, they will take a reservation.

aVzJZJpkX3qaLYSRa3wLWQ.text: We have been here few times and usually for the dinner . This Sunday we were starving so went for dinner early . They had happy hour menu for Sunday which has smaller pizzas on it. We ordered 4. House pizza sounded great but wasn't a great choice , it has a lot of peppers on it and pizza crust can't hold all the toppings , it hit soggy right away. Pepperoni , mushroom and bbq chicken pizzas were great. I gave 3 stars because of very POOR customer service , it was a slow afternoon but the service was worse than any busy 6-7 pm on Saturday. Our server never introduced himself: anything to drink ? Ready to order ? Ready for a check ? I swear these were whole 3 sentences he said through our entire dinner. He never even checked to see if our food was ok , someone else delivered it to our table!

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

48JbjTZWwDOfKNrpY5AfnA.text: Amazing restaurant and for sure will be back! Great service and outstanding salads and pizza!!

OzAziIDNnNoVppibi0X-mQ.text: I had dinner at The Parlor last night and I was disappointed at our server. It was a typical busy Friday night and it was obvious that our server wanted to turn our table. I rushed us to the point of being obnoxious and rude. Also....we ordered a BBQ chicken pizza...but the it had so much buffalo sauce and Sriracha sauce on it that it was almost inedible. No bbq sauce.  Our waiter was a guy with a ponytail. Disappointed.  .

9TiQ2RRGB4BSHLc3zY1_nQ.text: UPDATE: The food at Parlor is always amazing, but Customer Service is important too. I used to work in the food industry, so hospitality and professionalism are things I appreciate and to be honest, expect at a nicer restaurant. Yesterday I went with a group of colleagues to the Parlor, (my recommendation, having steered my boss away from their competition). My manager asked for me to head over there ahead of the group to get the table because they do not take reservations. I called ahead and the 'manager' I spoke with said that should be fine, or at least I thought that's what he was saying.  Flash forward, I get to the Parlor with an associate and I tell the hostess our situation and with an attitude she tells me, "that's not what we do here," and that "you'll have to wait till the majority of your group gets here" which by her math is 8 people for a party of 10. I told her everything seemed OK on the phone and we left work early to hold the table for the business dinner, not to mention it was slow and it should have been easy (and a no-brainer) to accommodate a party that size bringing in that kind of cash on a Monday night.  The manager came to explain that it was my misunderstanding, that he didn't say we could sit at the table and that we could wait in the bar area and blah blah why don't buy drinks and appetizers and leaving work isn't so bad and other sarcastic half-hearted remarks. Clearly the customer isn't always right at The Parlor, even when they're actually right. Meanwhile, the hostess who was obviously irritated with my request glared in our direction and when the group arrived and I asked if we could be seated was very snippy. She was also very upset when I asked for them to move the group bar tab (since we couldn't wait at the table) to the table tab -- it was not explained to me before that this wasn't how they do things.  I was really disappointed. The food at the Parlor is fantastic and I'm always telling people what a great spot it is and last night they went out of their way to not go out of their way. This isn't a chain restaurant, there were not enough people dining there to justify those restrictions and the manager was almost as rude as his extremely immature hostess and completely unprofessional. I've been eating there for years and while I might go back I'll never bring them a group that size again.

jBVUDfPzYgkhGJWnnBNTWg.text: Yum yum yum!! Such an underrated spot here in central phx.   Came with a party of 5, sat right down and had very good service - attentive but let us have time to chat!  I always get the pizza here. Its amazing!! Others got burgers and sandwiches and everyone said they were in love.   Will definitely return!!

XoJYy2wl7OLm_LAtryPLng.text: After hearing rave reviews for The Parlor, it certainly had a lot to live up to. And my first visit last week, it definitely won't be my last.   My dinner buddy and I headed to the Parlor after work on a Thursday to find the place packed. Good sign. We made a beeline straight to the bar and admired the warm recycled wood accents and sleek contemporary look. I had the basil gimlet and she sipped on garden mojito, and they were both refreshing and delicious.  It was hard to choose from the delectable menu but decided to take advantage of the DIY sheet. We chose a meat and cheese plate with Humboldt fog (nice and clean), manchego (nutty goodness) and salami (salty and delicious).   Then we decided to pick two 8" pizzas, and they ended up being more than enough. My friend had the barbecue chicken pizza that had a tart BBQ sauce, perfectly cooked chicken and fiery mini jalapeno peppers. We created another pizza with fresh tomatoes, wild mushrooms, homemade sausage and mozzarella, topped with pecorino and oregano. I liked that you could add herbs and pick your cheeses. The whole combination was heavenly, but could have used a bit more mushrooms. I especially loved the chewy yet airy crust.   A minor complaint: My friend and I were quoted at a half hour wait and told the hostess we would be at the bar. When we checked in after 20, my friend noticed that a couple parties of two listed after us had already been seated. If I wasn't enjoying my basil gimlet so much, I would have been a bit more peeved but the hostess got us seated right away.

ptGoz-mA00Hh1a0ortXqBg.text: Yes.   You should eat here. Beet salad was excellent and I even accidentally the whole pizza  Service was good. Interesting space, lot's of exposed pipes, valves, etc, side-by-side with very contemporary furniture give it a hip, post-modern feel. You won't be sorry.

qNAevoEnbGX8vfSUz9sqGA.text: This is a secret gem of a place.  Happy hour is from 3-6.  Get a small pizza for $7 and a beer for $5.  The pizza is incredible and the fried calamari are delicious.  Chef Aric is wonderful, friendly and a fabulous cook.

LLNpE6pk20C2jtG00ZS-8A.text: Wow!  I was so happy I finally made it here!  What a fabulous meal.  We went for an early dinner and got there just in time.  It was packed with a line out the door within a half hour of our arrival.  I had an interesting Moscow Mule that had cucumber in it as well as the standard ingredients; served in the copper cup.  Very refreshing!  My friend had a Mojito.  We then ordered the bone marrow appetizer and a meat and cheese plate.  I had never had bone marrow before, but know it's a foodie fave so I wanted to try it.....  Meh....It just tasted like a little piece of beef fat spread on really good toast.  The meat and cheese plate was awesome.  We had a cheese that had been rubbed with espresso during the aging process....I'd never had coffee-cheese.... lip smackin good....and a burrata , which is housemade mozzarella molded around shreds of the same mozzarella mixed with cream.....OMG, run and order it now!  There was also pepper jelly and pesto dipping sauces on the side which were very good.    On to the salad....We split an heirloom tomato, watermelon, feta cheese, pistachio and Frisee salad that was out of this world.  I thought my friend was going to lick the plate it came on!  Finally, we split a pizza.  We picked our ingredients and chose Pepperoni, roasted Queen Creek olives, wild mushrooms, and fresh basil....It was wonderful.  The crust was chewy and crusty, thin with just the right amount of char.  The sauce was great and toppings even better! Even our server was great.  I had a delightful time and highly recommend The Parlor!

J55VIZIKB0aPj4SiNUQuzQ.text: It is sometimes difficult to start out busy and maintain great standards from the beginning.  The Parlor seems to be nailing it.  Hip yet comfortable decor.   Very creative design, and I loved he subtle yet present homage to the former tenant Salon de Venus.  As soon as we walked in we were greeted with a warm and sincere smile, and that same enthusiasm was felt by every single staff member we encountered.   Ah the food!  Fresh ingredients, a great light pizza crust, and an original beet salad all  had us raving.   The only minor picky foody issue was the Nectarine Crustada for dessert was luke warm at best, would have liked a nice hot dish to melt that delicious ice cream.    But why nit pic?  This place is a big hit, from the moment you walk past the fresh herb and vegetable garden,  to the fantastic staff and the  savory food, this place is already on my regular rotation.

unW6aJoAmVsSJwgib1VCEg.text: I really want to like this place.  It's local, modern, and a great concept.  My first experience was good.  Service was very good.  Food was decent..maybe we should have ordered something else.  The Caponata Bruschetta was amazing.  The "Italian Deli Grinder" was beyond greasy..even for being an italian sandwich, it was too much.  The margherita was also very greasy, and the crust was a bit bland.  At the end of the day, I do plan on giving this place another chance :)  Great atmosphere

ie9Y3ieRZAiql6LIwhW-cw.text: I met a g/f here and we sat on the patio under the heaters to relax and enjoy the night air.  They have a decent wine selection with a couple bucks off per glass for Happy Hour.  None of their food is on Happy Hour which is strange but not a big deal.  We split the Swiss Chard Salad and the specialty pizza (lamb, mint and don't remember what else was on it).  Both were excellent.  I would definitely go back to this cool venue.

QAALSU4Icz72UqDr1CaG4g.text: Had Christmas Party here...and it was great! We ordered pitchers of Spaten and the waitstaff never let your glass get empty! They have a great selection of wine as well!   The mushroom pizza made my taste buds feel like they were bathing in heaven!! ooof! The pepperoni pizza was also delicious!!! If you're in the mood for pasta and like pesto, try their pesto pasta! great flavor, great texture to the pasta...not mushy at all!   YOU MUST TRY!!!! WE CAN'T WAIT TO GO AGAIN!

a23T2az2_sBEbNaZG2o7eg.text: Excellent wood-fired thin crust pizza, nice trendy ambience and the bar area was pretty cool as well, they have complementary valet parking. Away from main Scottsdale downtown though.

3RmQ9Zsf3_pVrjSfz2LE_A.text: Fool me once, Parlor, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me. Like GWB said, we can't get fooled again!  Against better judgment I gave the Parlor a second chance for my girlfriend's sister's birthday gathering. I figured since the manager had written me the following:  "The chefs and I are double checking all of the procedural practices during prep and service to make sure it is not a systematic error.  I'm pretty sure we've eliminated any possibility of this being a repeat occurrence.  Unfortunately, like you mentioned, this stuff happens more often than it should in all kitchens, but I can GUARANTEE you that if you should decide to pay us another visit this won't happen again here."  that it wasn't going to happen again.  And yet, there I was, later that evening, having a hard time breathing, sweating, breaking out in hives on my face and hands, all indications that I had YET AGAIN been cross contamination poisoned by The Parlor.  Once should have been enough. I should have listened to my gut, given the gift card to a friend without life threatening allergies, and just gone on my merry way. But I'm dumb, and I let myself get talked into the Parlor again. Normally I have a "Try to kill me" one strike rule, but I really wanted this to work out.   Never again Parlor. Just not worth the risk to my health and long term plans to be here for Z-Day...

084qkxyKYGKmUFQEaSLmOw.text: All I can say about this place is PERFECT! I've been going to the Parlor since it opened and never once have I been disappointed in my food. It's just phenomenal. Aside from a sometimes long wait, it's worth every last penny :) yay!

0XX7cZDxzTJNAYH3iEV7Dw.text: Excellent service and food.  I started out at the bar.  Friendly bartenders and patrons.  The bartender (sorry I forgot his name) made me a Dark and Tan (I think that is what it was called)  and it was great.   It is two beers combined.   Then the bruschetta, excellent.  We had 4 different pizzas and they were all great.  The desert was just okay, but most people wouldn't have room for it.  Oh, and the service from Paul was fantastic.  I will definitely recommend and be back.

fCcsLIPcrhUMUvaLm7jdOQ.text: If you can not give this place 5 stars you should not be dining at this establishment.  This place rocks and  my first experience here was excellent.  Arrived at 5pm on a friday night, got right in before the normal weekend crowd.    The atmosphere was cool and retro like I would expect being on the edge of the Biltmore/Arcadia area.  Service was great with attentive trendy looking servers.  Prices were cheaper than I expected.   The pizza I ordered  coming out of a wood fired oven was amazing.    I will be back ,but not on a friday night.  Not that this is a bad night to go out.  We all know that foodies don't dine on friday night's.  This was just the first friday I had to go out in 8 months.

LlTOWsd_ZY9Rq0UhsdYtHw.text: Yummmmmyyyy! That was pretty much the only thought in my head the entire drive home from The Parlor. I have been to several adorable restaurants recently, they all had decent food and a good atmosphere. This, however, exceeded my expectations without exceeding my budget. We started off with some cheeses and meats. They are served along side a delicious flat bread and two dipping sauces (pesto and fruit salsa). The pesto was SO fresh the basil must have come directly from the immense garden they have flourishing outside! Every single thing I put in my mouth was delicious, including the wine. The PIZZA though, the PIZZA was to die for! The cheese was perfect, the crust soft, crispy and little sweet, and the ingredients all complimented each other so well. I cannot wait to go back and try a different concoction. I would definitely come back even just to have some wine and appetizers at the bar though. The only reason I am not giving it 5 stars is because the service could have been a tad better. It wasn't bad at all, just could have been a bit more attentive is all.

PssWP56rB9IcreFj0LJVvg.text: Parlor is probably a top ten pizza place in town... probably.  I was a little disappointed with my Smokey Pizza as they were so damn skimpy with the proscuitto and then covered the thing with arugula. That's all I could taste was greens. The crust was also a bit doughy for my taste. This is all down to personal preference, however.  The waiter was very kind and was probably the best thing about the place. They look like they tried to create a postino/vig hybrid atmosphere, and while it was nice inside and airy, I don't see how everyone is raving about how they kept the old salon intact. It looks nothing like that old salon did. NOTHING.  3 stars for average. I guess I shouldn't have been expecting to be blown away. There are too many amateur hour reviewers on this site.

8bh_6uIE0XfYYHw03vpBcg.text: So I have been here about 4 times and every time I go I have a good experience.  I would have to say they have some of the best bruschetta around and if you want brick oven pizza I would suggest this place over Pizzeria Bianco any day of the week...plus that there is never a two hour wait!  I would say they are a bit pricey! But the food definitely doesn't make you feel cheated. And what I really like about the decor of this place  is the little veggies on the vine as you walk into the front door gives this place a cool vibe. Kind of a modern place. Like the lay out quite a bit.   Only down fall is the seats at the bar are not very comfortable and the do not have a foot rail so your kind of hanging there and the booths can be a bit small if your a big guy like me but that aside this place is the bomb.

nzu2Q-aMWIRf7IH1LVyzsA.text: yay! great atmosphere. great decor! pizza was delicious. will definitely be coming back.

0Grj_UebWQ8hbHBBMLCayg.text: Excellent pizza and risotto..great chocolate cake..friendly servers, reasonable prices...fresh ingredients, good atmosphere.  This is my favorite pizza place in phx right now.  Their wine is not so great, drinks are faaarrrr too expensive for anything not well.  If you don't plan on drinking much, you'll be very happy with this place, if you plan on having a few, the outcome will be much diff on your wallet and the value is lost.   They'll get a fifth star when they don't charge $18 for a double vodka drink using stoli. (hey it was my birthday!). Have yet to go for lunch..maybe a good intro to the place.

UgysrPfPalI1ako1SgmfWg.text: This is my new FAV place in Phoenix. The food is amazing, and for those of you who miss Fiamma (The James) you can have it back with this great little joint. The food is all hand crafted and has flavors you wouldn't believe. Try the duck club and you will be come addicted after the first bite. The bread pudding is to die for--and do not dare leave without trying one of their "muddled" specials. FRESH kiwi with vodka, YUMO!

bX4aNj4rywRTwzwibkIBWQ.text: I wanted to like the Parlor too.  It has a nice cool vibe with modern decor.  I've heard great things about the food and that the service was sub-par and to say sub-par is an understatement.  In my opinion our service totally sucked.  Here's why.  I met a friend there for dinner around 5:15 last night-before the rush.  There was our table plus another 2 or 3 in the whole place.  It took at least 15 minutes for our server to come back after bringing us waters to take our order.  We each ordered the 8" make your own pizza-mine was easy.  Cheese, vine ripened tomatos plus spinach.  We both got side salads-which were really good and fresh with tasty homemade dressings.  The pizzas came out and it didn't look like there was spinach on mine-and there wasn't.    I patiently waitied about 5 minutes or so for the waitress to come see if our food came out alright and I told her that mine didn't have the spinach on it.  She says "i'll go put spinach on it."  she leaves and returns a couple minutes later with my pizza.  She sets it down and walks away.  The spinach she put on my pizza was cold and wet and just piled on top.  I look at my friend and say "What am I supposed to do with this?"  First I am 3 1/2 months pregnant-you don't mess with a pregnant womans food but I have NEVER been given pizza topped with cold wet spinach.  I don't eat it and wait for her to come back.  She returns and I say "I really hate to be a pain the ass" and she she says something under her breath but all I hear is "somewhat"  I ignore it and ask her if she could have the kitchen sprinkle a smidge more cheese on the top and pop the pizza back in the oven so that the spinach isn't cold and wet.  She snips "if they put the pizza back in the oven it will get charred-just so you know."  I'm thinking-they screwed it up and now if I want it fixed it will be burnt?  I say "can they just put it in there for like, 20 seconds so the cheese melts?"  she says (rudely) "I'll see what I can do but I'm going to have to charge you for extra cheese"  (each topping is a dollar).  I say fine, whatever.    She brings me my pizza back and it isn't charred-lucky for her.  And when we got our bill she didn't charge me for the extra cheese-which I would've just taken out of her tip anyway.   the food was good but like I said horrible service.  I'll have to really, really want to go there again to endure being treated like that again.

zJ7dl13GCjS4bmSuDoMmaw.text: This place is great. Cool atmosphere really good and friendly service, excellent menu, sausage salami and pepperoni are amazing.

pyPqW5baUzfsmylNZ8pI7w.text: Love Parlor. It's like Positinos, but with substantial food.   The restaurant has a mini herb garden out front which they use for all their dishes. You just can't go wrong with any of the picks here.   On top of that too, the wine and beer selection is pretty top notch.

-zjzhZRCxTzbd08XfIc9Rg.text: I've been here about a hundred times and have never been disappointed. One of my favorites in phoenix. Best pizza for sure, puts pizzeria bianco to shame! Always consistent with great service.

61fpCIf3qJDSeGnz1xIAJQ.text: I Loved everything about this place from the moment I walked through the garden/patio entrance.  They actually grow an assortment of their own vegetables right on their own patio, how cool is that! Not to mention it's a very inviting space.   Inside was no different, it was modern and hip but comfortable too.   I was pleased with the menu, descriptive offerings reasonably priced.   My friend and I ordered the Arancini which is Fried Risotto Balls with cheese snuggled on a bed of pomodoro sauce (see pics) These are just Delicious!! You could make a meal of these I wish the serving was larger.   I also ordered the Funghi Pizza that had Wild Mushrooms, Goat Cheese, Truffle Oil and Chives. Yum Yum! (see pics) At 8in. it was easy to eat by myself, but would have been plenty to share as well.  The goat Cheese gave it just the flavor it needed to be great, some fresh herbs would have only improved it's greatness.   My friend did the build your own pizza and got Spinach, Tomato and Basil, my battery died so no pics, sorry. We swapped slices and I really liked hers as well.   I had other plans for dessert so we didn't order here but I know I will be back, they have so many fabulous items I want to try and I just love the space too.   They said they were working on updating the website to include the menu so hopefully soon you will be able to click and drool, but for now read these reviews and look at the pics, then head immediately over to The Parlor!   Just a Tip: It's located directly across the street from Best Buy on Camelback and 20thST, it's easy to miss, but that should help you find it!

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Funghi Pizza: Wild Mushrooms, Goat Cheese, Truffle Oil and Chive
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Arancini: Crisp Risotto, Pomodoro, Parmigiano

DsMeALKzeZHshn7Uu0894g.text: Great food! Split a burger and BBQ chk pizza. It was soooo good. Homemade BBQ sauce was bomb. Even ranch for fry  dipping was amazing. Morgan was very charming and knowledgeable. Bottom line if you are around, make sure you stop in. Great atmosphere!

ufV4E31OSfPVwFOvipd7FA.text: Excellent atmosphere, eclectic menu, and reasonable prices. Welcome to The Parlor! Pizza seems to be their specialty but the menu offers so much more. Friends swear by the duck club sandwich, and my wife loves the sausage pizza. If you visit during peak times expect a wait, but head to the bar for a drink until your table is ready. Staff is super friendly- our server forgot to deliver apps we ordered and made it right by providing free apps (equal value) for our next visit. He was apologetic and owned up to the mistake (he simply forgot to add to computer) - it happens but he handled it well. I'll be back!

wmCm6b4AzYouyjPEwpU85Q.text: Great  pizza! Best mushroom pizza I have ever had. We also ordered a pepperoni pizza. Excellent. Service was great, atmosphere very very nice. This my new pizza place.  Love it.

Q40XRPzjE-X-k_b6OienYw.text: I've never had anything bad here.......everything has been good and usually can get a table without a long wait.  Try the bolognese  sauce.......it's excellent!

mSt5zz_ufCIvPfwEWdOW5g.text: Blink and you'll miss it, but The Parlor in central Phoenix is worth seeking out.  It was just as busy when I went there a couple months ago as it was when I checked it out almost 3 years ago, with a half-hour wait for two at 8:30 p.m. on a Friday night. If you do have to wait, the twinkly light-lit patio is a pretty place to hang out since it's surrounded by a garden that provides ingredients for the restaurant, and the patio is also a romantic secluded area you should try to score a seat on if you can. The bar area is also cool, with close quarters (you might be at the same long table as another party) and a single television displaying whatever sports game is on.  The Parlor the restaurant is housed in a former beauty parlor, with evidence of a hair drying station placed in the women's bathroom. Other than that, you'd never look at The Parlor as anything different than a cool eatery, ever-busy with hipster servers and high-quality food on seasonal menus.  Pizza is a specialty here (the owner's family also owns Nello's in Ahwatukee), and it's really affordable and really tasty. If you're planning on eating one yourself, definitely order an 8-incher-that's more than enough food to keep you full. I built my own with goat cheese and mixed olives ($10), and I liked the thin, soft middle with the thick and crispy crust.  My companion ordered the veal raviolini ($13.50), which came with a ginger carrot puree and peas and baby carrots. He said the concept was surprising to him, but it worked. The pasta is all made in-house, and he really liked it.  The drinks at The Parlor are just as good as the food. The Jalisco Sunrise ($10) is a spicy concoction of roasted serrano infused Corzo tequila, pink grapefruit, cilantro and lime and is a great desert drink because of the spice-the grapefruit really balances it out well, though.  I also love the Cucumber Lemonade ($8), a refreshing mix of cucumber, lemon and Hendrick's. It's strong but doesn't taste like it.  The Parlor is wonderful in so many ways-drinks, food and atmosphere. Just be prepared to valet your car, and arrive earlier than you'd like to sit down.

cPnGvlYJfdQr3QyfR2xaVA.text: I love the food and ambiance here! My favorite is their chicken Milanese salad. The chicken is so crispy and the greens are a mixture of collard greens that's so different from your traditional salad. It's light yet hardy. I also love their fresh made pastas! I don't think I've ever had a bad dish here. I only wish they'd open another location up north closer to us!

81P2noqtsXvn70NyPKQbBA.text: What a lovely lunch I had at the Parlor!  It was a rainy day and my daughter and I were going to lunch and the movies.  We started with the brussel sprouts, which were amazing.  Being a wimp I will ask for 'no red pepper flakes' next time...but the sprouts were roasted, seasoned and mellow.  I also had the carrot and ginger soup, which my daughter then decided she liked also.  I could eat that soup often!  Then came the pizza.  The pesto pizza.  YUM.  YUM.  YUM.  I loved the crust on this pizza.  I love pesto.  I really enjoyed the little semi-sweet crunch of the pinon nuts added.  My daughter and I were getting really full but managed to take down an 8" pesto pizza.  I look forward to this again.    Note, the staff is really mellow.  Like, REALLY mellow.  If you're expecting fawning service, this isn't the place.  But we didn't have to wait long at all for our food, got everything we asked for and were quite happy!

OGBxWGeb51We-dsA_mL3yQ.text: There is NOTHING spectacular about this place, well outside of the building itself that is. The patio is awesome and the interior is pretty freakin' cool to.  That said, I went here because of the weeks on end that this place was the top of the Yelp charts and I was sadly underwhelmed. Not that there is anything wrong with this place it's just not anything I'd claim to be out of this world.  I had a peperoni pizza and it's nowhere in the league of Pizza A Metro or Cibo ... it's just plain old pizza ... nothing great ...

omReF_mKM3_7naoiNVgL5Q.text: Good food, pretty overpriced and SUPER snooty wait staff. The pizza is good "fancy" pizza, as in it's not you're typically pepperoni and cheese. They use a lot of unique and interesting ingredients and are unwilling to compromise their culinary vision (when we asked to have a particular ingredient on only half of our pie, the waiter took the stick out of his ass long enough to tell us that "Chef doesn't DO halves"). Nevertheless, the food is good and I would go back occasionally.

1sHZHMxypuyYAz-eRksIsA.text: Wow, this place really exceeded my expectations. Excellent, amazing, wonderful pizza!!!!  I would say it is right up there with Pizzeria Bianco, but without the wait.  We will definitely go back soon.  The Beet salad was delicious and perfect, and we had the margherita pizza, which was totally amazing.  Love this place!!!

ng3VGnIpFyeEXClKXu3Jfg.text: So if anyone's read my past reviews everyone knows I have had the best pizza in Portland.   We have been to Cibo and Pizza Bianco and we didn't care for either of them. Just wasn't up to par with my expectations. So we came in very skeptical.   First off they offer free valet which is the bomb. Second the fact that they took an old salon and refurbished the material and reused it in the new space. We loved the interior. Just so welcoming and inviting. The bar area looked so awesome.   We were sat right away. We looked over the menu and decided on the calamari appetizer, spinach salad and the sausage pizza. I ordered a glass of wine also.   I wish we could find a place that would do calamari like Ken's where it's sauteed instead of fried but alas It was still pretty good.  The salad was amazing. The spinach was so fresh and the bacon was so crispy and yummy! The pizza was the best part though. The crust was thin but not too thin and crispy but chewy at the same time. Not too much sauce and the sausage was so good.   We were really glad we found this place. It's our new pizza place!! We cannot wait to take our friends.

Nds69CNS0yBqQ6gt4_i2_w.text: This is by far my favorite place to go for pizza... and all the staff are very responsible and respectful.  If you want great tasting food than this is the place to go! Promise you will be pleased! :)

1Gla9dCslVBQX6Ro4ctIVQ.text: We went here last night and this is our second time! Both times have been outstanding! We had a pitcher of the peaks seasonal beer and it was delicious! They were very accommodating about us wanting to watch a basketball game on the television.   The pepperoni pizza is just divine along with the Caesar salad and cheese plate. The service was amazing and the atmosphere was laid back yet had a busy buzz with people after their long days of working.   I always recommend this place to everyone I know! Will be back soon!

R2-Mlkjto-RTE3Qwg7SZSw.text: Finally, an excuse to eat pizza every week.  The Parlor is one of those unique spots that has that all-around enjoyable vibe. Not only is the building absolutely stunning (renovated from an old beauty salon), but their food is off the charts.   It's easy to feel a sense of romance if you're seated on the patio; lots of vine covered walls and candles make it the perfect spot to bring a date. Being seated inside is just as lovely-- even in their busiest hour, you can still here yourself think and don't feel overwhelmed by the commotion around you.  I picked out the Margherita pizza and a pint of Kiltlifter the first time I was there, and loved the combination so much I never even bothered trying anything else. True bliss.

w8dDQ0y14SYB0VZEM03anQ.text: Food is very good, prices are not too bad.  The music is WAY too loud and on some days the place is incredibly noisy from raucously loud and obnoxious people.

2tS-BkCeh_ghvsQzSRI0iQ.text: I've been to The Parlor on a few occasions and have never had a bad experience here.  We shared the roasted beet salad, polipo, 12" funghi, and had tiramisu for dessert.  I don't eat beets often, but I'm a fan now after having tried the salad.  It's really refreshing, and I highly recommend it.  The polipo was suggested by our server as "the best octopus in the valley", so we went with it.  We were disappointed; it had a nice spicy kick to it, but it was way too salty for our palates (you've been warned).  I've had the funghi before, and it remains one of my favorites.  If you like mushrooms, you'll love it (no skimpin' here).  The tiramisu was pretty good, although we thought that it had a little too much cocoa powder going on on top, and that it needed an extra coffee-flavored oomph to it.  We ordered too much, but we were starving!  Overall, a great meal paired with an awesome pitcher of Oak Creek Nut Brown Ale.  Yummmmmmmmm.  It was a nice night to sit out in the patio.  It tends to get kind of noisy inside, so if you want to actually converse, try to sit outside if you can.  Also, parking is kind of tough unless you get there early (or park across street at the shopping center), but they do offer valet.  I'm still full!

A7IaYc27q_IVpHSftuyPhg.text: Flavor! So many amazing flavors. We ordered the Brussels sprouts, cauliflower, a couple of salads and a pizza. WOW!!! Every single dish was full of flavor. I couldn't pick what I enjoyed most. I remember when this place opened, and I loved it. Most places go downhill as years go by, but this place has gotten better.

JJxdxFunVRuV7YNA5TrasA.text: Nice staff and quick, attentive service. Great food. Had a salad and pizza - both were tasty. Good parking too. I'd go back for sure.

0N6jpMb9t57l_ClnNPv4-w.text: Went here on a Saturday night.  Got the cauliflower app -tasty and cheesy but was missing something (I added pepper). My boyfriend got the pizza it was good but wasn't blown away pretty standard in comparison with other pizza joins like Bianco across the street. I ordered the pesto pasta good flavor I would order it again. For drinks I got the red sangria I prefer a sweeter sangria this one wasn't that sweet.

Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pepperoni and sausage pizza
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cauliflower app

AVe60fnQlcqJHvRn7STppQ.text: My date and I had a nice booth away from the center part of the restaurant ,which is very well adorned, has quite an interesting history and fabulous food! We thoroughly enjoyed the Pepperoni Pizza which we had the option to make it as we wished by checking what items specifically we wanted on it.  It was FAB-U-LOUS?  Taste was 5 out of 5.  Along with our drinks and an efficient waiter, that didn't hover over us, but allowed us to have a quite dinner as two romantics could have, we were very pleased.    Great experience.  Great food and a very pleasant atmosphere.  We WILL return.

OklKNCTmUdi_T0KwZVhNtQ.text: So the last time I was here, I got my brows waxed. That was probably about 7 years ago. I always thought this place was cool,because, it was mid century modern.But, now it is a restaurant, and it is cooler than ever! I came here with 3 friends for lunch. It is a little hard to find if you have never been here before. So make sure to pay attention as it is on the North side of Camelback road. You pull in and park in the back.  They have done such a great job bringing it back to life! The atmosphere is relaxed and 60's. Early 60's , I love it. The menu is amazing. They make all the Pasta from the start right there and it is fabulous! They even offer a Gluten Free pasta,which is amazing as well. I can tell you that was not around in the 60's. I got the seafood with linguine. It was great!! My friends got the steak salad and it too was divine. Next time we might get the pizza. Everyone says that is awesome as well.  The place is decorated wonderfully. When it is cool enough outside you can sit on the Patio. They even grow their own herbs right there in their garden. I am always Happy when I see a cool Ladies Room. This is right up there. Even with a cool hair dryer chair. Look at my photos. Cool place, Wonderful Food. Worth a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fantastic ladies room. With retro hairdryer and a picture with the old wallpaper
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Everything about our meals were wonderful

wlBUaBOYPQsShhaa7_fLsA.text: Delicious as always we had the funghi pizza, thr bruschetta, the summer corn and the spicy florentine. Excellent pizza and service. We forgot how much we enjoyed the food here.

nGyxJt-zGs75J8NrUVCLBg.text: Pretty good. Nice building, good service. The food is four stars, everything else is five stars.

ihdD1_N-zoCv5dklLHK96w.text: Wonderful once again!  This time we visited during a busy lunch service.  All went extremely well.  We were in a party of 4 who ordered different entrees and beverages that were wonderful.  My personal selection was Pecorino Tagliatelli which was memorable.  The size of this meal was just right and the ingredients were fresh and delicious.  My 3 lunch partners expressed satisfaction with their entrees too.  The service was great, ambiance pleasant and we relaxed and were able to have extra time for conversation.  We will return.  Thank you, Parlor staff.

1jFtVYf13uXq3efq8nSdYA.text: The pizza was too salty for my liking. The waitress messed up our order so we had an extra pizza to enjoy. The next day I was dying for thirst. Nice atmosphere and friendly staff.

572iFvwhUtHs9z9-9qW_DQ.text: Perfect date night spot. The entrance alone to this place is magically lit and dotted with greenery. Your immediately greeted upon entering with options to eat in the bar area, large open dining room or outdoor garden area with misters.  Service was slow but we eventually ordered some cocktails, i got the ciao bella and my husband got the smoke and mirrors. Mine was a coffee based drink and was rich with velvety chocolate tones yum, my husband was not so enticed by his, it tasted like liquid hickory coals just way too overpowered with smoke.  They have a unique way of ordering antipasta, its almost setup like a sushi order sheet were you can pick and choose what will come on your butcher board. I liked that alot of the options were locally sourced as well. It arrived looking like a work of art and was a delicious start to the meal.   My husband ordered the seafood linguine and the yukon gold pizza. I got the summer corn risotto and the funghi pizza with no cheese. We wanted to share a pizza but they wouldnt allow us to split toppings which was disappointing. My risotto was creamy and packed with roasted corn flavors and i loved the crunch that came from the corn fritters on top, it was a nice change of textures. My pizza was very generously laden with mushrooms, didnt get any of the advertised truffle flavor though which would have really set it over the top, not a memorable pizza. My husbands linguine had great flavor and a nice spice with perfect al dente housemade noodles but the quality of the seafood was just not there. I know were in a desert but we've gotten much better quality in the area. He did enjoy his pizza though, he said it was like a loaded baked potato and pizza had a baby.  We were too stuffed to try dessert and had to get togo boxes for the pizzas. Service was slow again to get our check but she was polite. All in all the food was good and the restaurant had a romantic ambience, it was just lacking in that excitement, nothing blew us away in terms of flavor and creativity. Dont think well be back but it was still a nice dinner date.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outdoor dining (couldnt get a good pic)
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Entrance
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nice brick pizza oven

TiBibju6QuykGIObdnJnxw.text: I was here once before a couple years ago. All I remember is that it was a really good pizza.   I recently met a friend here for Happy Hour and my 2nd visit. We sat at the bar for 3 hours! I didn't drink 3 hrs of liquor, but I definitely ate 3 hrs of food. Noise level was quiet enough that we could carry on a decent conversation of "catch-up!"  I started with a margarita (of course), moved on to a Garden Mojito, then to an 8" Market Pizza . . . next a black cherry tart and an Americano. I usually judge a place by their margarita and by their coffee. Most places in town have acceptable margaritas and just so-so coffee.   The Parlor had a really good margarita and the Americano was worth going back for if you have nothing else!    The special market pizza was unusual enough that I can honestly say it was the most unusual pizza I think I have ever had. What was it? You have to go while it is still on the menu to try it yourself.   The cherries in the tart were great, but the tart shell was just a little too overdone for my taste. Hard. If you must have one, eat the cherries and the ice cream on top. Leave the shell.  Go for the Americano!!

YxBCUNtEOdOnDR6ash-_SA.text: This may be my new fav pizza spot! I'm so glad I stopped in for happy hour last week! They have some great deals on apps, pizzas, and drinks! My friend and I started with the famous cauliflower gratinata. We really enjoyed it! We used the remaining cheese sauce to dip our pizza crust in (so creative, I know). As for our pizza selections, we ordered the spicy florentine (no chiles) and margarita pizza. They were both really amazing. The spicy florentine - hold the spice - was my favorite! I'm craving it as I write this. I can't wait to return back and try some of the other options they offer. Thank you, The Parlor!

Q6jrew_Pvjl8cDZiDk6qjQ.text: We arrived for a birthday celebration. Our wait staff was incredibly helpful with suggestions and effficient with service. She was understanding of our celebration and jovial .

6iCpgNsVXoHlHwdqXGqTSA.text: Spicy Florantine and Funghi pizzas were incredible.  Farmer insalda and calamari were also awesome.  Sat at the bar. Mike and Jake were great!  Love this place. Worth the drive from the east valley.

0uKv-gG-GSYszc15Bmucyw.text: The Parlor is racist. A group of 11 young Latinos walked up to the front desk and ask to be seated. We were told please wait 20-25 minutes. After a long day visiting all the way from California for a Spring Training baseball game, we were in the mood for some good pizza. After the 20-25 minutes, we asked about our wait where the hostess then answered, it would be another 30 minutes. Fine. We decided to wait. Not only did we wait outside, but it just so happened that every group of Caucasians that arrived after us were all seated before us. Or at least waiting inside, there didn't seem to be room for us with the discriminatory looks we were receiving by our urban apparel. Because we didn't have Gucci loafers or Yeezy's on we seemed to be looked down upon as if we weren't good enough to be there. After the hour wait we waited for a little while longer to come to grips with the fact that after wasting our time, we were told our group would have to be split. Really? Pathetic. Customer service was subpar to say the least. It seems that the homegrown fruits and vegetables in the garden out front didn't reflect homegrown values or principles of common courtesy or respect for all colors of people. If you're between the age of 18-28, take it from me. Go somewhere you'll be respected. Being young doesn't give an organization the right look down upon us. I felt categorized, undermined and disrespected. And parking sucks.

kAiuE5kWr6JnU84cV-Duag.text: Really like this place, very spacious inside. Service is always great as is the food. We always get charcuterie and a pizza. Big selection of meats and cheese, pizza is just as good as bianco without the wait.

Nz0YWEau_ZiIMLLF08MGAQ.text: So we call this place about 20-30 minutes before arrival and ask for a wait time... they said "no wait time we should be able to seat you shortly after you show up". Well overall his place smelt alright... from the outside we pull up and I understand we have a party of 11 but don't tell us our wait is only going to be 20-30 minutes when The reality is us going to end up waiting over an hour and not be seated at all... what made it even worse is when the server comes out to tell us "I'm just a server so I can't do anything but we're still working on getting you seated" like bud you could've told us that 30 minutes ago instead of leaving us there chillin outside for a minute with no word on when we were going to be seated.. highly DO NOT recommend this place especially with a group not only because of the wait but also because of the lack of consideration. Very unprofessional in my opinion. Ruined about an hour of our buddy's bachelor weekend in Arizona (we're from Cali) ended up at chick fil A and got way better service ... would never return .. thank you

AtmF7OjcPVGF4U-kiTp_IA.text: The 4.5 stars for this restaurant may be for the food, but I'll never know. What I do know though, it isn't for the service. We arrived on Saturday night, when it seemed to be a packed house. The hostess assured us it would be no more than a half hour wait. We waited for over an hour while watching multiple parties seated before us who arrived after we did. We did not receive any updates on the status of our party until we asked the hostess how much longer it would be. She stated it would be another 30 minutes but if we chose to sit outside it would be sooner. We stated we would. Finally after another half hour a server, came outside and told us, they would able to seat us "soon", but "unfortunately" they would not be able to set us together. After almost 2 hours! Couldn't have that been stated sooner? They did not have the courtesy to apologize for the for overly long wait or, the inability to accommodate us when we were assured they could. Maybe if those things would have happened, this review wouldn't have been written, but they didn't, and it has been. None of us will be returning.

ifrovfcC_Gko6Amq48sHVA.text: I absolutely loved this place. Staff was very friendly. Had the Arancini for an appetizer and it was great. The bolognese which was also great. Pepperoni pizza was great. Margarita pizza was just ok.  Overall this place was awesome. Definitely will be back, especially during happy hour.

brhbctI-XL47hPNS6ZhH3A.text: The Parlor has phenomenal wood fire pizza and amazing cocktails. The service is friendly and the atmosphere is very modern and casual. Expect to wait for a table but they do a good job of accommodating guests.

PmBaI2KFyJxdGaYpFl7w-g.text: In my opinion, there are better pizza places in the valley for sure. I think this place has a nice vibe and cute character but I don't think it's the best place for wood fired pizza. Don't get me wrong, it's tasty and if you're in the neighborhood or get invited to dinner definitely go and try it out for yourself but if you want the best then look elsewhere. I prefer Cibo to any other pizza place in town. What I do like about the parlor is that it has a happy hour which the other pizza places mostly do not. I know people that really like this place so definitely give it a try if you're curious.

saBeuU_QSglVeLL4QGm2Ww.text: We got takeout from here; our first time trying this place, even though it has caught our eye for quite sometime. The pictures attached, are at home, on the plate.   When we called to order, they answered by the second ring, which is something I appreciate. They were friendly, and informative. It was an easy process.   Parking was open and good, even though when we went inside to pick up our order, the restaurant was pretty full (on a Sunday night around 7:45) with young, trendy people. This wasn't surprising as it matched the decor, young and trendy. I really liked the vibe and atmosphere inside the restaurant, and we can't wait to go back to experience the very nice patio outside.   The price was a little high, but not crazy. We ordered the spicy seafood linguine, the large one which is enough for two people, and a beet and goat cheese salad. The pasta was decent, not the best I have ever had. They give you a nice amount of shellfish, which is good, but the sauce lacked the "wow" factor. I would have done something different with that recipe. We enjoyed eating it though. The salad was though, phenomenal. It had an arugula base, beets, sweet potatoes, and a piece of crispy goat cheese. The dressing paired well and the salad is something I would try again.   Again, we did takeout, but this place did a lot of things right. We can't wait to go back again and try one of the pizzas where the topping choices look superb.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

I_usTB0Wp8B0Jq_YeTlhZA.text: Monday/Tuesday special is such an awesome deal- 12 inch pizza plus a pitcher of beer for only $25! We got the pesto pizza with prosciutto. Oh my.. the pesto is amazing and the crust is perfectly crispy!! Great beer options as well, we got the ayinger Hefeweizen and it was a great pairing with our pizza. We also checked in and got 50% off a dessert item. The tiramisu was a wonderful finale to our lunch. Overall, quite a memorable experience, thanks Amanda for serving us!

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tiramisu: the almond brittle is a great touch!
Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pesto pizza with prosciutto!! Sooo good!

CIKQ9UhgTGlf5duTOT7JMg.text: Great service! Very good food, drinks, desert, and coffee. Everything came out really quickly and the selections were good. The atmosphere is relaxing. If you're in the neighborhood this is a great place to stop!

QANJYqOshTL4CfNmnAJo5Q.text: The Parlor is better than Bianco's. Change my mind.   Get the pesto pizza. Off menu and clutch AF. I recommend adding sausage as well. Salads are fire too.

0yJWwkzBFKSR-tw1ny1uYQ.text: The Parlor is up there as one of the best pizza places in the Phoenix area. Their Yukon Gold pizza was my absolute favorite. The Spicy Barbecue Chicken pizza is also a great choice. If this is your first time, I recommend ordering multiple small pizzas to navigate the variety. You won't be disappointed.

Fmsm4S5vt08egi_EwY5FnQ.text: Great pizza! The happy hour specials make this place truly worth the price! We went and it was not overly busy. We were seated right away and the decor inside is awesome. We will definitely eat here again when we return to the Phoenix area.

1uK0Rti3yamy7AuZWkYmWQ.text: This is in our top 5 restaurants for Phoenix! We absolutely love the charcuterie boards, the negroni's, the farm greens salad, and the calabrese pizza!! Love their staff too! Their turnover seems to be low, because we've seen the same staff there for at least 4 years! And of course the ambiance is another reason to visit!

3_h0CgCRUNGl93Mji1oZcA.text: Let me see you toss it up since this is supposed to be the #1 pizzeria in Arizona. I'm always searching for our next unforgettable dining experience and came here with high expectations of their famous pizzas.   Since I arrived during Happy Hour (3-6pm daily), I decided to take advantage of their special pricing on food and cocktails. My hankering directed me towards a refreshing glass of white sangria ($5). The fruity stiff mixture had a great kick of white wine and fresh fruit. One more glass and I would have been dancing on the tables. On another occasion, I ordered the red but will stick to the white because I loved it with the fruits.  In total, I've tried four pizzas during Happy Hour to get a sense of their fine crafted pizzas (8" for $7.50). In order of my preference:  Funghi - roasted mushrooms, goat cheese, truffle oil, chive Pesto - roasted tomato, house made mozzarella, basil pesto, pine nuts Puttanesca - calamari, shrimp, capers, spicy tomato sauce, olives, fennel, Calabrian chile Vine Ripe Margherita - fresh vine ripe tomato, house made mozzarella, basil, olive oil  If you love mushrooms, you must bookmark this place immediately. They were extremely generous with the toppings and the earthy texture made each bite filled with funghi happiness. I opted for light goat cheese because I'm lactose challenged and watching my calories.   Try the Pesto if you love basil because you'll enjoy the saltiness of the green sauce in each bite. They serve it with cherry tomatoes compared to sliced red tomatoes.   The Puttanesca was also a great choice for those wanting a little more substance and protein. I especially loved the spicy tomato sauce as it added more depth to the dough and toppings.   Finally, the traditional Margherita showcased their homemade mozzarella all put together in each slice. The tomato slices are more of the full sized compared to the ones served on the Pesto. Again, I would have liked it more but too much cheese doesn't make me a happy gal.  Overall, all these pizzas exceeded our expectations because the dough had a chew while not being too tough. Our initial visit, we thought the dough was softer compared to our subsequent experience and missed that taste and texture.   Add more carbs to your meal and order the tiramisu ($8)! For any coffee and chocolate lover, this dish will seal your meal. I loved the richness of the espresso soaked ladyfingers upon layer and layer. The sprinkled toffee bites around the dessert made this dish 5 star worthy.  Inside, the dark wooden dining area has booth and table seating and the outside dining is covered from the sun. Towards the back is a full bar complete with high tables and tvs. This is definitely a great place for a date, or catching up with friends. The parking lot fills up quickly in the back. Service here was attentive and not too intrusive as we like.   Is it our favorite? TBD!  Play on, play on...

OgZ6GC_cogMVywi6WqX4IA.text: The parlor is such a goldmine! I decided to take my colleagues out to lunch and The Parlor was recommend for the variety of options on the menu.   The atmosphere was fantastic and we were seated right away. It took us so long to decide what to get because everything looked so good! We finally decided on the Funghi Pizza, Spicy BBQ Chicken and the Chicken Milanese. Everything was absolutely delicious!   It was so good that within the week I was craving more! I can't wait to go again and this time outside of work so I can try some of the items on their wine  and cocktail menu!

mSaimVoxzsEyTL8Y1PFf9g.text: Good, fired pie.  Again, not the best I have had, but comparable to may throughout the valley.  The location is good, and the atmosphere is better than most.  The service is also usually very good.  In the Biltmore, need a pizza, come here.

02OvIl43W8gUUR1GT7t7jg.text: Very first "the parlor" experience via postmates. Im very impressed (and even more so that it was delivered to my door). I ordered the grinder and it arrived with a delish side salad. The entire meal was delicious. Will definitely be ordering again. Can not wait to try the pizzas!

Zzx2CNyx7b5DOMS-3scIsA.text: Amazing! The service was kind to my elderly father The cauliflower gratin, bolognese and pizza of the day are not to be missed ! And don't get me started on the parlor insalata. I moved to California and wish there was one near us! I would go regularly to get this phenomenal gastric experience

hNNHTgbjPM1ryXRRbPUwTA.text: Good atmosphere, great customer service and amazing pizzas!!! The place was packed! So if you want a table it can take up to 45 minute wait. But the have other options, like patio, bar or pizza bar (which is where we were placed and it was super cool!)

UASh-yu6JitlERh16BOJkw.text: Fabulous dinner and dessert! Highly recommend this restaurant and the banana trifle dessert was amazing!

c8wmZwG8wv3B8pXFEzLUIg.text: The parlor by far hands-down has the best pizza in town got a trade out the atmosphere is great but mainly the pizza unbelievable thank you

Uj-vpIg0eBWJqLldcDWaEA.text: Service was great - Fryen was attentive with great recommendations.  Runners were pleasant.  Food was delish - we had the arancini, the frito misto, bbq chicken pizza, the grinder with a mixed green salad, and to finish off the Neapolitan shortcake.  Everything was great - only suggestion if ordering the grinder is to ask to hold off on the buttering of the bread as their is enough oils within the sandwich.  Please do yourself a favor and try the shortcake- truly delicious!!!  Definitely will be returning....

va_0LjS_OnYJF7ndWut0UA.text: Best tasting pizza I have had in a very long time. Great gluten free pasta. Service was excellent. I highly recommend

Kn4obowi3zoh-FebY5rgNA.text: My wife and I went there for the 2nd time last night.  The first time we went we weren't too impressed but decided to try them again for maybe a better experience.  We were no more impressed this time as compared to the previous visit.  Although the service was acceptable, the food was something else.  The appetizer was ok but the sauce tasted as though it was pizza sauce form a can. Then the pizza came and was SO GREASY it was almost inedible. The only thing we ordered that was great was the pasta but I was disappointed that I had to settle with only menu items.  The kitchen was unable to cook off-menu.  I wanted Cacio e pepe (the easiest sauce to make) and the chef could not make it.  I guess wwe're still looking for a good Italian/Pizza place.

IbhIWX82T23dusMY2N3tAA.text: Pecorino tagliatelle(pictured) is excellent! It is one of my favorite pasta dishes! The pesto pizza is equally as delicious along with the spinach salad and the tuna melt. To be brief, you cannot go wrong ordering anything from this place! Highly recommend!

wXAdvBcjHoCxQPujqlzFGg.text: Ordered pizza and two appetizers. Pizza was great everything that was expected. Visiting the place and looking at reviews from Yelp and decided to give a try. Didn't disappoint. I can't remember the name of appetizers. It was great. A little noisy for my taste. The pace is a little dark to take photos for food. Visited the bathroom and took a picture it was clean and nice. Love the decor.

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1WN7BaY7L4SB1PtljSIYow.text: I absolutely love the food in this establishment.   I have even had great customer service here before. However, on July 27th, I ventured to this establishment alone and my experience changed. I went during lunch and for me the vibe was off from the very start. In what was an pretty moderately filled space the waitress attempted to sit me miles from other people. I objected and asked for a booth. I then was attempting to browse the menu and she interjected and stated that the menu I was browsing was for bottles. Mind you I have eaten in this restaurant over 30 times now with my friends. I decided against ordering a bottle. I told her to leave the menu and I might order a drink later. She took my order and I was very clear I wanted a large pizza. I waited for my meal only to be given a small. This is still not the worst part. She had other tables and she interacted with them completely different. They received great attentive customer service. I was left alone and only offered a refill once. The people in front of me never saw an empty glass. My spirit said no tip but I realize that this is how most waitresses feed there families and so what could have been a 10 tip which is what I tip when I get great customer service turned into a 5 dollar thank you for working tip. I hope this review get the restaurant to see that all customers matter not just groups that have higher tipping potential.

6e5YGF_F1Ae5x1q5WU01kQ.text: I've been many times. Today my friend and I decided this is where we will celebrate her birthday.  Gifts in hand.... we met . Seated at a lovely booth and given water.  Started with a bottle of Rose' and the Frito Misto.  Very good.  We then ordered 2 11" pizzas both done as ordered.  Mentioned to our server ( again) that it was my friends birthday and I could use the yelp app for %50 off a dessert. He didn't bat an eye and so we ordered the chocolate cake....with a press coffee and 2 cellos.  So needless to say... I was surprised to come home to my receipt to find I was charged $8 for the dessert. Really?  As you can guess.... it's not about the $8.... but the fact that not only were there Birthday gifts on the table.... and I mentioned the %50 off from yelp.   Just disappointed in that.  I know I'll be back... but I will make sure I just use my yelp app.

H3GgjXbLH8cqQvIkFreTmA.text: Went for the first time during happy hour for their 8in pizzas for $8 were delicious and came out quickly. We were seated 10 minutes from happy hour ending but had no issues ordering our pizza at the happy hour prices. We enjoyed the Pepperoni and the Spicy Florentine. We will be back to try some of the other pizzas the Parlor has to offer.

961Ppxf5NBlF5ttjA_IGNQ.text: I have gone back to this place many time since my first review! And while I still can't find a pizza that I like, the pasta is AWESOME. Totally yummy. I had the gnocci, the braised pork and the bolognese and they were all so good. I believe all their pasta are made in house. I'm glad I went back to try different things on the menu!

9vxHvgkD9mU5ca1GiDqBlw.text: The Florentine pizza is great! So good!!! The flavors really complement each other and make the pizza divine. The sweet corn was pretty good too! Over all great place!

WJkQqONbkmz2oa-6Vz4oqg.text: Wow. Can't believe I had not posted a review on this place. Been here a few times and each time bf and I have been lucky to not have to wait for seating. This place is quite popular. Each experience we have had has been phenomenal. The service is great and the food is delicious. On our recent visit we had little time to eat but we were starving and nearby. We placed our order. Had the calamari which was AMAZING by far on the top 5 I've had here in AZ. The service was quick. I ordered the bolognese added some crushed red pepper and done. Delicious. Bf ordered the spicy seafood pasta. Haha. Might have been a tad but spicy for him but he enjoyed it. Can't wait to be back.

7oBdQw2MnFblBPzA33469A.text: Wow, loved my experience here! Took a chance on this place for a late night meal, so happy I did. Plenty of on-site parking, including valet. Little tough to spot, eyes wide open! Seemed like a good bar area adjacent, but I was hungry, and grabbed a seat at the pizza counter and had an outstanding dinner. Tremendous service by Eddie, who helped me select an incredible Pizza that included sausage and basil..made it right in front of me, fun to see the pizza makers use the kiln. Fabulous meal. Fair pricing. Will return without hesitation.

rFHv5qBH_Uw9I6P5VomjVQ.text: We really like the pizza here, and they have a good selection of beers. I think it's well priced for what you get, too. The decor is cute, and the staff is friendly.

Iv7iHMPZCS2J-dFnXVkN1A.text: Got "The House"' pizza Extra crispy Delicious is all i can say added the sweet pepper dipping sauce for the crust and wow oh wow Hooked on the flavors. Amaze balls after that I guess they have happy hour for $8 which makes this pizza place a deal.

OVDCiYo4tQU9sz6bVteLWg.text: I didn't realize this place existed for the longest time. It's easy to miss driving by and I wouldn't have paid much attention to it except for the fact that my neighbors raved to me about it. When it came out in Phoenix's magazine as one of the top 10 pizza places in Phoenix I knew I finally had to try it.  Happy hour is everyday from 3-6 so I decided to come at 3 on a Saturday for a late, late lunch. There was plenty of seating and parking available but I can tell how this place would fill up quickly at night - especially the parking.  Good waiter, good service. I went with a classic pepperoni pizza and a draft beer, both of which were part of the happy hour menu. All of their pizzas are $7.50 during happy hour! The pizza was delicious. Thin crust that has flavor but not so thin that you feel like you're eating a cracker. It was baked perfectly. I enjoyed eating the crusts as much as I enjoyed the pizza. The pepperoni and mozzarella were plentiful and delicious.  This place has good ambiance and would be great for a night out with friends or date night. I ended up getting a scoop of chocolate gelato as the Yelp check-in deal gets you 50% off a dessert. It was incredibly rich dark chocolate gelato. A great finish to a good meal.  I'm excited to come back and try some of their pasta very soon!

photos.caption: Photo of The Parlor - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pepperoni pizza
